text: I was expecting a little more based on the good reviews. I ordered the brisket and wife had the monster. The barbecue sauce was fine but the meat was a little dry. Sides were fine. The service was minimal, no smiles and the cashier wasn't really helpful.
BBQ how you like it!!  Smoked, charred, grilled to make your taste buds pop.  Many options to choose from and mouthwatering.     Yummy Yummy to my Tummy!!! Happy Man!!

Food was excellent and service was even better! Mac & cheese was amazing. Got the pulled pork bowl and loved it. My boyfriend got a burrito and enjoyed his just as much. So happy to have a tasty BBQ restaurant in our area!
Ordered a half slab of ribs for carry out. Got home and there were 5 ribs, and this cost $15? The ribs were also dry. Don't think I will be going back again.
So glad they opened here! This is really decent BBQ... The prices are decent and the portions are generous. Definitely worth it on cheat day!
This is the best BBQ place I've ever been too. They have so many types of sauce and their meats are always fresh

Went here for lunch on a Sunday, had a lot of traffic which is always a good sign. I ordered the BBQ sampler with brisket, pulled pork and pulled chicken.  I loved the brisket and pork, full of flavor and super tender. The chicken was ok. Perfect amount of smoke.  The beef brisket was my favorite. I also loved the sweet potato fries and the beans were awesome, not too sweet. Would definitely come again.

$15 dollars later ..... I was super stuffed and felt like a greasy mess (I had the Midwest Monster). The food was not bad! It was just not incredibly amazing for the price! My friend went with her bf and spent $30 on two people!

First time here, stopped because of the reviews, and because I saw DDD was here. Some of the best BBQ ribs I have ever had!  The ribs were perfectly smoky, with a little brown sugar and a spicy kick.  I really appreciated that the ribs were cooked well, had a nice crust, and were beautifully juicy inside. One of the nice young ladies who works there brought us some excellent cornbread muffins to accompany our ribs, very nice of her! I would definitely recommend, and I plan to be back- worth the 2 hour drive from tucson!

Dined in for dinner a couple of weeks ago. Tried a sample of Ribs and Brisket.  I LOVED the brisket-it was very tender, and had great flavor. Ribs were fall off the bone tender. They offer several different sauces- sweet and smokey to hot and spicy. I really like the hot and spicy.  We will be back for more great BBQ!

The people were super friendly and the ribs were fantastic. A true gem of a place and one I have already recommended to others. I will be back. The mac & cheese is spicy and tasty - not your typical mac & cheese. I look forward to trying the brisket next.

Awesome food and awesome people working there! Anytime I'm in the area I make it a point to stop in. I consider it to be one of the top BBQ spots in Phoenix. Definitely get some brisket and the Mac and cheese is killer!

Honestly wasnt that impressed... I work at a Hotel near this Resturant and i had a few guest tell me about it and how much they liked it. But when i finally go and try this place it really wasnt that good and kinda pricey.. Really got my hopes up on this one.

These folks at Pork on a Fork are simply delightful and the food was AWESOME!  We had a graduation party for 25 and all everyone could talk about was the fantastic food we had.  We opted for ribs and chicken, mac and cheese, salad and baked beans...and wow, it was very yummy!  Veronica was a dream to work with...delivery was on time and just as promised...and my invoice was accurate.  I couldn't have asked for more.  When we return to the Phoenix area, we will be calling Pork on a Fork again for sure!!  5 Stars!!  :)

"Best BBQ in the Valley!"  Oh stop!  Save your money.  Go to Rudy's in Chandler for the wet brisket or back to KC.   This place is below average.  Ribs are poor.  Slaw is tasteless.  Fries are greasy.  The beans are at least decent.  Beef is way overcooked and not flavorful.  Poor ambiance.  A garage without any character.  Sloppy order handling.  Overpriced, way overpriced.  Skip it!  Take a bagged lunch with peanut butter.  Just cutesy marketing with lousy food.  Poor effort, Pork, start over.  No wet wipes?  Worthless napkins?  Staff too busy or poorly trained to take care of customers?  What were you thinking?  We are BBQ starved in Phoenix, but THIS? Very disappointed and not going near there again.
Pulled pork is just right, almost melts in your mouth and its not greasy like most. The best bbq place I've been to in the valley.

1st time trying this place. Have to say last one as well. My wife and 2 boys went in high hopes and we'll fell short way short. Everybody had pulled pork and I had the monster. Everything was extremely dry. You had to drown the meat in there sauce. The meat didn't look pulled at all looked like small cubes. As for the taste the meat had NO pork flavor at all. All you taste is smoke flavor. I've had good BBQ and this was not award winning pork. If you like your pork with just smoke flavoring added to this is your place. As for the sides, blah!! Potato salad bland macaroni salad bland dry coleslaw the only thing halfway decent was a frys and even them you can tell were store bought and just thrown in a fryer. They tried to add flavor by sprinkling paprika on all there sides. Their barbecue beans taste like they were canned and added some pulled pork or brisket to it to make it their own. Looks like older reviews when first opened and when DDD TV show was there it might have been better but by far from being any good. I'll stick to Tom's BBQ a lot cheaper and WAY better. A true BBQ place you smell the BBQ not this place.

Its ok, but honestly i was extremely embarrassed when the cashier charged me for three platters instead of the two i ordered and i had to start returning food in front of a packing waiting area because id only brought 40$ in my wallet. And the wait times just to get the food always average around 10 minutes.
Love the pulled pork sandwich here!  Mac and cheese and bbq baked beans round out my meal perfectly.

Love it, love it, love it! I'm here every Friday, that's why I'm currently the DUKE!  The staff is awesome at P on a F, they are all really friendly.  The only complaint I have is my shirt stinks like delicious smoked BBQ the rest of the day. I order the brisket sandwich with sweet potato fries. I'll be in every Friday defending my Dukedom and stuffing my face!
Great food as always for a good price! Cashier seemed grumpy today and can ruin one's appetite!

Absolutely amazing BBQ and service. What a friendly and helpful staff!  The menu is diverse and the servers are super helpful if you are undecided. 4 different homemade sauces to smother your hearts delight and the pulled pork is heavenly melting in your mouth. Highly recommend this BBQ. Best I have ever had!!

This place is amazing. Food is incredible and everyone there is super friendly! Since moving here a few months ago I was introduced by a neighbor and have since brought everyone I can to POAF. Do yourself a favor and try the Midwest monster with Mac and cheese.

Found this place because of a Yelp search for BBQ. The food was good. The service was good and it's close by. Would definitely go there again. Our company brought this in for lunch today (6/18/14) and now everyone loves it!  Did not disappoint

Another fantastic meal here! This time I went for the Sampler and substituted Brisket for the Chicken, +$1.49(not a huge fan of chicken on the bone) Pork, and a smoked sausage.  Delicious! The Pork was better than last time, more juicy. The Smoked Sausage was one of the best pieces of sausage I have ever had. Great Smokey flavor and an awesome snap! The Brisket, well 1 piece was better than the other, but still great. I think the 1 piece was a bit of a burnt end, which I know some people love, but it was just a tad tougher and drier than the other. I am hooked on this place and have upgraded to 5 Stars. I think next on the list is to try their Ribs!  The only thing I can say about some of the previous bad reviews is they got a bad meal, it happens...
Great bbq. Everything done right, down to the perfect dispensing bottles. Great choices, love that you can get waffle fries, cooked to order. The meat is juicy, tender, not over seasoned.

Place has excellent food,probably the best mac and cheese ever. Only problem is the dining room was dirty and the damn flies , every time I eat there I get invaded by flies. I will only do take out from know on.
Loved the pulled pork. Great mac/cheese and baked beans were bananas delicious! Friendly folks and legit bbq in Phoenix finally!

Today we didn't feel like firing up the grill, so the most brilliant idea popped into my head and I said, "Ooooh!! I want ribs! Let's order from Pork on a Fork!"  We each ordered the sampler plate, subbed briskit for the chicken, and even added a couple ribs.  We ordered our meals to go and couldn't wait to get home to get our grub on. Oh my goodness!! I was loving every bite of the tender briskit, the ribs, the pulled pork, mac n cheese, and coleslaw!  Whew!! It was a very delicious and satisfying meal, and while I wasn't able to finish it, no worries! I plan on finishing it later... well, that is if I ever get hungry again  By far the best BBQ I've ever had in Phoenix!...  well hell, I'd even say it was better than any I've had in TX! If you love BBQ, you will not be disappointed! And if you're a vegetarian... their coleslaw is super phenomenal!!

Nothing to write home about.  I ordered the pulled pork sandwich with coleslaw and BBQ beans. The meat was decent but dry. I added the smokey BBQ sauce twice to try and moisten it up.  There didn't seem to be any sauce on the meat to start with.  Same issue with the coleslaw; there was little more than chopped cabbage.  The meal was saved by the beans which were quite tasty.

The best BBQ I've tasted in Phoenix! I had the pulled pork sandwich with coleslaw and baked beans and for lunch. The pork was tender, moist, and had a perfectly underwhelming smoky flavor. The beans were equally as amazing as the pork with chunks of BBQ meat mixed it, awesome. Coleslaw is coleslaw, but most importantly it was fresh and crispy.   I'll agree that sauces are not spicy, but there is a good range with different flavors for different tastes. I don't understand the review that gave 1 star and described the pork as "dry" and the consistency of "baby food" at the same time, seems contradictory to me. I think the owners take their food very seriously so I would be surprised to find anything sub-par on their menu.  Bottom line, it's going to be hard to take any of the other BBQ joints in the area seriously. Pork on a Fork is on another level completely, it's amazing.
Wonderful discovery. Pulled pork plate was top notch. Good amount of food. We'll be back.
Amazing brisket and smoked sausage , great mac salad. And good services and prices. Will be back!!

We tried the pulled pork and beef brisket sandwiches.  The beef was as a tender as butter - no need to even use a knife.  The pulled pork was a great variety of smokines and slighly crispy ends--yum!  They have four selections of sauces and we mixed and matched to our content.  Very nice owners and definitely the best BBQ we've had in quite a while.  We wish they were open on weekends!

2 words: Food Poisoning I ate a handful of times to Pork on a Fork after they opened. I thought it was great to have a close place with good BBQ...... Until my colleague and I went for lunch recently. I had the worst night in my recent memory. My colleague also got sick. Now I can't think about Pork on a Fork without feeling sick.
The brisket was moist and tender. Had good smokey flavor!! I will definitely come back again next time I am in Phoenix.
Food is very good. Pulled pork, Midwest monster is fantastic as well. The people behind the counter are super helpful and friendly. 5 star !

I had the sampler platter with pulled pork, brisket, and a chicken thigh with sides of mac n cheese and beans.  The beans were a bit cold, but the mac n cheese was very good.  It actually had real cheese rather than just a cheese sauce.  The pulled pork was excellent and I would definitely come back for it.  The brisket had very good flavor, but I did have a few bites that were a little dry.  The chicken thigh was very good and had the buttery texture that I love when eating smoked chicken.  I prefer not to use BBQ sauce but I did try 3 of the 4 that they carry.  I enjoy spicy food but the spicy bbq sauce tasted like an ashtray finished with vinegar.  Needless to say that I didnt care for any of their sauces.  However, I came for the BBQ meat, not the sauce, and was not disappointed!  Will definitely be back.
The pulled pork was good but their buns were dry, like they had been left out too long.  They do have a variety of 5 sauces to choose from.

Amazing BBQ.  Ribs and Pulled pork are so good they don't even need sauce... However the BBQ Sauces are awesome!!!Sweet & Mild, Crazy J Hot & Zippy Mustard are all amazing.   Fred Langley catered his party with this place and it was the best I have ever had!   Gonna go there bet soon!!!

Was craving for something filling after what seemed like a purgatorial wait at the dealership for my vehicle today.  Scanning the archetypal lunch recommendation from Yelp's search list I spot POAF.  This is not my first visit here so I know what to expect and my recollection was of: messy fingers, sauce residue in and around the mouth and lots of used napkins; this despite using the plastic utensils.   They've expanded since my last visit to now include the front of the building that used to be a coffee place which now serve as their take-out area.  The dining area is relatively the same from what I can remember - a few seating up-front and a larger area in the back.   Today, I went with the sampler again but I opted for all the proteins -- pulled pork, beef brisket, sausage and chicken with mac & cheese and baked beans for sides.  It was as good as I can recall from my last experience but I can only give it 4 stars because Corky's in Memphis, TN, in my opinion, was my Gold standard in BBQ.  Overall, great friendly service as usual and food that's definitely re-eatable (as in worth coming back for).  P.S.  If you're planning to go elsewhere after having dined here, then you might want to bring cologne or perfume because the smoky BBQ bouquet will cling to your clothes. I suppose it's not as bad as the smoke of a different nature from the casinos.

I have eaten here 3 times now (2 dine in and 1 UberEATS). Each time they were out of something that we wanted. The first 2 times they were out of cornbread. The bbq is ok in flavor but dry. This is ok because they have sauce but you would expect a bbq joint to have very juicy meat. The worst experience was when we used UberEATS. We asked for extra sauce one of each kind because they have 4. We didn't receive any sauce at all. We called Uber who called the restaurant which said they only give 1 cup of sauce even though we didnt get any. For this reason I recommend avoiding using delivery or going elsewhere if you want juicy bbq.
Your barbecue is very good. The brisket is good the ribs are good. One of the best places on the side of town.  Definitely worth worth a try
I really like BBQ and since this is local to my business I go there quite frequently and have to say not only does it taste great but the prices are very reasonable as are the portion sizes.

I  dine here on a regular basis when I get the hankerin' for some bbq because it is within biking distance from my house. I have been coming here for a few years and have noticed the quality drop significantly. A few years ago I would order the pulled pork sandwich and it would be so good and moist and have the perfect fat to meat ratio it wouldn't need any sauce at all. Now it is so dry you have to drench it in sauce just to be able to swallow it. I really hate to mask the flavor of bbq with sauce. POAF if you are reading this please go back to making your bbq like you did a few years back. What happened to you guys? Very disappointed.

Slightly leery of food places with Guy Fieri plastered everywhere, but I did see they made a National top 10 BBQ list so I had to try.  I don't remember much after eating the brisket....that's really all that mattered in life.  It melts in your mouth, and all is right at that moment.   The service is good, and the ambiance actually matches a BBQ joint pretty well.  I'm knocking off a star because it is hard to find, but the food is what matters most, and it was awesome.

This kind of breaks my heart giving this place a drop in the love category. We've been coming here for years and it's going downhill. I want to say it's because we came in 45 minutes to close, but I'm not fully sure it is. They have certainly cut a lot from their menu.  Last night my husband and I went in and got our meal to go...we new we were going in late and didn't want to keep the workers.  Husband ordered the sausage and got 1 link...usually with an evening meal it comes with 2, but this came with one. I didn't realize until after we left and he said something. I ordered the brisket because they no longer sell chicken (except pulled chicken). It was very dry, not normal for POAF. I feel like they changed the potato salad recipe as well because I didn't like it at all and I've always loved the potato salad. They got rid of the mac n cheese bites too because they didn't sell enough, but every time we went in they were out so I'm not sure how true that is. So I got the Mac n cheese regular and it's very bland and tasted like cooked noodles, no cheese flavor at all. Hubby liked his baked beans though so that's good because his 1 sausage link wasn't filling. Not saying I won't return, but I certainly am not craving a second night of it like I always do.  When we left last night I told my husband I bet they are going out of business and that's why they've downgraded so much on selections.

The food was delicious and the portions were great!  I got the pulled pork sandwich with a side of macaroni salad and sweet potato fries. The buns were soft and fluffy, and there was a generous amount of pork. My brother said the beef brisket was really good. My dad got the burrito and it was huge.  All the sauces for your meats are at each table. Our table had the zippy mustard, smoky & tangy BBQ, and mild & sweet BBQ,  My brother's and my favorite was the zippy mustard; I also liked the sweet & mild BBQ.  Note: they put the fries in the fryer after you order them so if you're super hungry and/or in a rush, you should avoid the fries. My dad had to wait a few mins for his waffle fries, and I waited quite a bit for my sweet potato fries (and a few still weren't fully cooked).  Verdict: will definitely be back!!

Excellent food and catering services! We served Pork on a Fork brisket and shredded pork with several sides for a family gathering of 18. The food was delicious with very generous portions. Ordering and pick up was easy. Great value.

Best BBQ ever! We love the food, the staff, and did I mention the food. We have had to cut back from having it every weekend because it was helping is gain some unwanted weight LOL but everyone we introduce to Pork on a Fork loves it and becomes a loyal follower as well.
Best BBQ I've had in a while. Its the kind of place that you find as a one-off and realize what you are missing out on in the world of American BBQ

Pork on a Fork - Exceptional!! Those of us who love BBQ just know when it is done right.  Pork on a Fork does it right!  All of the food is tasty, but the Baby Back Ribs might be the best that I have had outside of Texas.   We picked up food for a party and the catering department had everything ready on time and well packaged for freshness.  It is worth it to add the Baby Back Ribs to the main selection for a small additional fee. They included a full-sized BBQ sauce in three flavors, which our guests loved.  We have also dined at their location, which is a throw-back to any of the BBQ joints that I have always found to have the best food (meaning, don't expect fancy).  I usually try to include a downside for your consideration, but had to think hard for this one, so here goes -  the restaurant is a little hard to find since it is in an office park.  On second thought, the location is not a problem once you get in and have a Baby Back Rib.
Congats guys. I am so happy for you. A 5 star product at a 3 star price. The best BBQ in Phoenix bar none! Love me some Pork on a Fork!

I really wanted to give this place 5 stars but the staff are very absent minded and/or bad at service. Ordered the food corn bread wasn't ready but would be another 8 min. No big deal the staff was super nice and offered a side of coleslaw just because. My wife ordered a side salad and they said they would make it and bring it right out. 5 min later no salad I go up and ask for the salad was told "someone is making it". 5 min later still "making it" Well 15 min later he cornbread comes out and still no salad I ask the cook where the side salad and then the cook was surprised cause no one asked him to make a side salad. Two min later salad came. A lot of wilted lettuce and huge pieces of lettuce that my wife had to tear herself. Food was alright but I won't be going out of my way to go to this place again.

This is terrific no frills barbeque. The meat is full of flavor and juicy... sauces are served on the side and are also really good. Try the Midwest Monster - you won't be disappointed and your taste buds will be kept very busy!

Went there recently with my wife for a late lunch. We had the sampler as well as the ribs. The brisket was dry as was the chicken. Rib meat should fall off the  bone not hang on for dear life. We won't be going back.

My fiance found POAF online when we were looking for a good BBQ place to cater for our wedding. We decided to come in for lunch and try a sample plate of everything. HOLY COW (no pun intended) the meats were amazing and the beans were to die for! The dining area we heard is new so once you have your plate and can't wait to eat it at home, you can enjoy in the back dining room where they jave soda machines, booths, tables, etc. with all of their amazing sauces on the tables to enjoy. Needless to say we got Matt's info to set up a meeting to cater - can't wait for May 23rd to come! ;-)

I had a small craving for BBQ and unfortunately after I was full the craving only became BIGGER. Now I fear I might be venturing out into the late night only seeking more of its deliciousness!!  I ordered a brisket sandwich with a side of BBQ beans and a side salad. It did cost more than I would like to spend and I wasn't able to finish it all. Kinda wish there was an option to just buy the sandwich and a bag of chips.

I love to BBQ myself , and lived in Texas, as well as Kansas City MO, and I can tell you this place is AWESOME!!! Great balance of taste on the meats, nice smoke, great sides, and the BBQ sauce is awesome. New favorite place!!!

Really good meat!  I had the ribs without the sauce.  I can tell you the rub was very flavorful.    We also had the pulled pork bowl.   The rice and beans were less than desirable,  but again,  the meat was really good.    They could improve on the side  salad... there was nothing to it really.    Only greens and a few yellow peppers.  They have other stuff to top it with,  but minimal (tomatoes,  pickles,  cheese,  corn ).   Definitely worth your time.  Your belly won't regret it!

This was mine and a friends FIRST and LAST time.  We both ordered the BBQ Pulled Pork Sandwich. After adding some BBQ sauce as most people would, we began to eat with great expectations.  After the first bite, the meat had a STRONG smoke taste, but unfortunately lacked the pork flavor. The meat was dry, so we requested some au jus and added that to the sandwich. This made the poor quality bun fall apart. (Yuk)  Most of the pork looked and felt like it was run through a food processor. It was so mushy, that most of it had the texture of baby food. (Yuk again)  For side orders, we both had the waffle fries that looked good but, no flavor. They were fried in oil that was too cool and therefore, ugh. And we also had the BBQ beans that was no more than pork and beans from a can. (Yuk again)  Even the sodas were watered down!  Not a good experience from a new establishment.  Hmmm ... maybe they just had a bad day.  I know we did too! We should have compained but, our payback is this review and ... our pass-it-along message to family and friends.  Roger  P.S.: The parking accommodations sucked too!
This place was awesome! I had pulled pork, sausage and brisket. It was great! The line was a little long but I feel like that's always a good sign!

We have been going to Pork On A Fork for over 4 years and have always enjoyed the food. The place is in a warehouse area and not fancy but the food is good although a bit pricey.    We made reservations, a week ahead of time, for the Prime Rib/Salmon menu for Friday, February 14 (Valentines Day) thinking this would be an excellent meal and in a casual environment.   When we arrived 10 minutes before our reservation the hostess said they could not seat us.  Not at all!!!!  No other explanation other than they had overbooked reservations.  She did say we could order "to go" if we wanted.   In all my years of dining out I have never experienced this kind of treatment.  I can promise you that we will never return to this place and will discourage everyone we know from going.  You lost a loyal customer.

Tried Pork on a Fork 1st time today. Recommended by a friend, work nearby. I ordered the brisket sandwich, the wife got ribs, sides were beans, cole slaw, potato salad & mac salad. Brisket was very good, so were the ribs, crazy js hot bbq sauce good, though not real hot. Slaw was good, potato salad bland, no seasoning, beans were nothing special. Disappointing thing, the portions. I know, your thinking - they were looking to pig out! But seriously for $30  total the brisket sandwich very small, 6 bones on the ribs, sides really small. The styrofoam container for the beans wasn't 1/2 full. We had take out, so maybe dine in is better. Was left hungry!

Not bad, a little on the high priced side, but food overall was good. Hopefully they can get a following, place for the most party was empty at lunch time.  I've noticed any restaurant that goes in that location has a tough time making it.  Had higher hopes for macaroni & cheese, it wasn't overly flavorful, but pork was good, moist & no fat in what I received which was a plus.

Pretty weak sampler plate. About 2 pieces of brisket, few shreds of chicken, half a sausage, and a baby amount of pulled pork. That would've all been okay had it actually been good. It was mediocre as can be. The sauce is solid, but the food leaves a lot to be desired. I do not believe that this food is slow cooked for 14 hours. Has no smoke flavor in it. And it generally tastes like the kind of "bbq" you'd get at a bar.  Try MJ's BBQ in downtown Phoenix for some real stuff. Won't be here again even though it's near my work. Don't let your suburban taste buds fool you. Say no thanks.

I was a little confused about the Friday menu, but got passed that.  My wife ordered the burrito with a mix of pulled pork and beef brisket.  They were out of black beans so they subbed with bake beans.  She thought it was ok, not entirely memorable.  She also got mixed up with the sides and their availability (Friday menu thing again).  I ordered the sampler with the two rib add-on, to hit all the high points.  My meats were a little fatty, but the ribs were good.  Overall, while I'd eat here again, I don't think I'd go out of my way to do so.
Great BBQ.  Definitely worth stopping by.  Better than all other bbqs in the area.  I've been to them all, trust me.

Hands down..the BEST BBQ baby back ribs around. I have had BBQ at Bobby Q's, Bryans Backyard BBQ, Dillons,Big Apple,Toms,Lovejoys,Famous Dave's, Sir Charles, Honeybears and many other places. This place beats them all for bbq ribs. The ribs are tender, not fatty, and full of flavor with the perfect char. I am the type that always leaves something on the bone because the meat is usually fatty or cartlidge. Not these, I cleaned them bare.The BBQ sauces are delicious, but I found you don't need to slather the ribs with them. The meat can stand on its own! I have also had the brisket and pulled pork and those were also delicious. But the ribs- WOW! The sides did not blow me away,They were not bad just did not taste as homemade as I like. I have tried the beans, coleslaw,potato salad,cornbread(thank you for serving REAL butter, not the hydrogenated oil goop) and sweet potato fries. I wish I could have tried the mac n cheese but they were out. Greens would also be a welcome addition so we don't carb overload.A little work on the sides is all they need. And a larger dining area!The service is so friendly and these are down home good Nebraska boys who have their own hog farm in Nebraska. The gal that works there is also very nice. Checking on you to make sure everything is ok. They all know how to get their "Pig" on! Please expand to a larger dining area and extended hours! I love the fact that such a great place is only a 10 min drive from me! Prices are decent as well. I can't believe I did not write a review for them before this!

Ok, I'm an addict.  I wasn't big on BBQ before but love this place and go back.  I do have to repeat myself often of what my order is and I think it's more of the persons attention than rest. noise.  I like the selection of sauces they give you and honestly, I always bring a bag of chips (I put my pulled pork on them to eat it).  I asked at the front one day to make sure it's ok and they said they welcome it and have never once said anything to me about it.  That alone boosts them a star!  They have the Belly ap for frequent guest rewards.  The staff are friendly and welcoming.  The seating area is very clean.  Urgh...now I am craving BBQ for lunch...

Still really like this place but was a bit bummed with part of my lunch order today. I decided to give their sweet potato fries a try & took my order to go. When I got home & opened up the box I found only about 6 sweet potato fries with my meal (see photo). Maybe they were running low & this is not the usual amount they serve, but I feel like I was jiped!

This is a small caf√© t that is strictly for meat lovers. And meat lovers will love Pork on a Fork's meat,  .The valley has a lot of barbecue joints. Many of them are good. Pork on a Fork simply kicks it up a notch. . Those who loved pulled pork will find their day's activities just happen to take them close to Pork on a Fork from anywhere in the Valley, whether they drive there or fly in. Great food, which will keep you going back for more. Just wish they were opened longer.
Some of the best BBQ in Phoenix, good size portions, great side items. A must have !!

Saw this place on Facebook a while ago. Yesterday they posted they were going to have prime rib tonight. So I called them to reserve two plates a day before and set a time I would be there.  I walk into the place and go to the start of the line. Stand there for about 5 minutes before I'm even aknowleged. Finally, after the two girls right in front of me ignore me, someone from the back asks what I would like. I tell them I reserved two prime ribs and they instruct me to go to the cash register. I then checked out and waited in the dining area for my food.  Time goes by, with a server who keeps telling us just a couple minutes guys. At the 60 minute mark from when we sat down a food runner comes and asks us for a recepit because they don't even see or orders back there. 5 minutes later they come out with our order; wrong sides. 65 minutes finally went by before we had our order in front of us!!  The prime rib wasn't done, so it looked like they put it on the grill to speed it up. Overdone outside and a completely rare inside.    First time and I will never go back. Service alone was enough, not to mention food that wasn't cooked correctly.

Went with my mom because we were in the area and saw a sign for them. We got the big boy sampler and a sandwich. Her side portions were much larger than mine. They measure out the meat so that every portion is the same but the sides just go right onto the tray so its not very consistent..  The bbq beans and the coleslaw were great. The potato salad was average but the mac salad just tasted like vinegar.   The meats were about what you'd expect. Was okay. Nothing great, nothing terrible. The sauces were good but I would have preferred a side like fries so I could try out each sauce on something else before putting it on my meat.   The sandwich meal is a good deal but I wouldn't get the big boy again. Not worth the price I paid for it.

This place is a hidden gem. A unique warehouse setting with blues music in the background works well with the amazing BBQ and tasty sides. Friendly and fast service too. We recently moved from Tennessee and have been searching for good BBQ in the Phoenix area, and we gave this place a chance after reading good Yelp reviews. The Midwest Monster was divine and I highly recommend it if you like spicy food.

I have been looking for a great bbq place in the Phoenix area for years.  After my lunch today I have to keep looking.  I was born in Phoenix but have lived in Texas.  While in Texas I was told a couple of tips on finding a great bbq place.  First, if you can't smell bbq when you are in the parking lot, leave asap.  I couldn't smell bbq even when I was walking in the front door, but I still decided to give Pork On A Fork a try.  The second tip I was told was that a great bbq place always has sweet tea or at least decent ice tea, here I found an "Out of Order" sign taped over the ice tea machine!  Yup, a machine!    Still I said I would try this place and I did.  I got the pulled pork sandwich, and sides of bbq beans and  potato salad.  The beans were decent but I would suggest adding some brown sugar to them.  (Hey, my grandmother did that with her bbq beans and they rocked!)  The potato salad was boring and bland.  It didn't help that about half of the potatoes that were cut into small cubes were under cooked.  The pulled pork was a lukewarm mixture, either dry or VERY chewy.  The last piece I had tasted off and left a horrible taste in my mouth,  Also, I picked up a squeeze bottle from another table for some sauce only to find out the entire bottle had sauce all over the outside of it.  I ate in the dining area down the hall from where you order and it has ZERO bbq joint ambiance.  Music was playing but it was Bill Haley and the Comets followed by other 1950's rock and roll songs.  (BBQ joint or Johnny Rockets?)  There were three employees in the place and two of them passed my table several times but said nothing.  There were only four other customers in the place and they were together in a booth across the room.  When I left no one said anything to me.  ("How was it?  Thank you!  Do we suck?", etc.)  Judging from my review and other recent reviews, the owners need to get back in control of this place asap and return it to the great reviews it used to get.
Good BBQ and you can order online! Brisket is a little dry but their pulled pork, sauces, and sides are all really good.
Food is amazing the service has gone dramatically down hill in the last year. They are slow, don't go if you're in a rush!
Great place and food. It's even better after the remodel. Service is always great here. Big and roomy dining area. I will continue to come here for my BBQ needs

I was down for a three day visit  in Phoenix recently and ate the sweet potato fries 2 times a day. I could not get enough of them. They are great. All the other food is great also but the sweet potato fries are to die for.
Amazing food, pretty awful service. Basically walked in and they said "ok what do you want?"

This is a great place for BBQ . Authentic. Smoke flavor . Was informed they use pecan .i ordered the sampler plate   With 3 Meats .   It consisted of Brisket, pulled pork , chicken and sausage . 1st the brisket was very good flavorful and tender . The pulled pork was decent and had a good smoke flavor . Only complaint I have with it just. A little dry not much though .   The chicken was not bad good decent flavor with a hint of smoke . The sausage was also good and flavorful .this plate also came with 2 sides. I got the mac and cheese and potato salad ,No complaints they were both very good .   The staff was very friendly and seemed like they honestly cared about the product they put out . You can tell when a place puts there heart into something , and these guys do . It shows in the food .    Next time I'm back in. Phoenix I will be going back for sure you can count on that .

I've eaten at PoaF plenty of times, sometimes multiple times in a week, and it is always great each visit. Hands down one of the best BBQ joints i have ever had, and i lived in Georgia for a little while. Going to head there this week to pick up a couple bottles of their BBQ sauce for some homemade fathers day ribs!

I called in an order for chicken wings the day before and was eager to try them. When I arrived at the time they had told me, the nice girl working the smoker told me that there had been some kind of mix-up and my wings wouldn't be ready for a while. They were very nice about it and apologized for my inconvenience. While waiting, I ordered some additional items including some of their mustard based sauce. When my order appeared they were very gracious and gave me a 10% discount for my trouble. Unfortunately, the wings were grossly under cooked and they forgot to include the sauce I purchased. The wings were inedible. They tried hard but this will be the last time I order chicken wings from this place. A for effort but s big zero for quality.

last night we made the 20/minute drive to pick up dinner. not our first time, was so looking forward to the brisket and beans. brisket was ok, but way to salty. the beans were just ok too. in the past the beans were a meal by themselves, there was some small pieces t meat in the beans only. Mac and cheese a huge disappointment. BTW fill the to go sides to the top, feel like I only got 3/4 of a pint.

Just catered from POAF for a family birthday for 20 people.  Yelp did not let me down!  I hadn't eaten their bbq before so it was a bit of a gamble, but after reading reviews I decided to give it a try.  Everyone enjoyed the food and I can't wait to eat leftovers tonight.  I ordered pulled pork, pulled chicken, 2 racks of ribs, beans, coleslaw, and small mac&cheese.  The pork and chicken was smokey, tender and moist.  They even delivered on a Sunday when they are closed!  Highly recommend!
Fantastic BBQ, probably the best in the area! Great service too!
Deliciousness.!!! First time here and the customer service was great as well as the food. Ordered it online and it was prepared on time once I showed up.
Can't go wrong with the BBQ burrito!  And to really make sure you are in AZ just get the Spicy BBQ sauce to go with it.
I like the casual atmosphere and the food was decent.  Overpriced for what you get in my opinion

Having sampled ribs from Chicago, St. Lou, KC & Mephis to the Southern & Texas style to say I've been disappointed by what I've found so far in Phx would be an understatement.  Until tonight.   The full rack was smoked to perfection and just enough sauce with just the right combination of sweet & heat.  The pork & beans actually had more meat than you'd find an a typical fast food hamburger and the sauce was mild enough that it didn't over power the taste of the beans.   The coleslaw was fresh with enough dressing to make it moist & tasty without drowning it.   Tucked back in an office/industrial complex the only thing this place needs to be a success is a more visible location.

These guys are awesome! Love that brisket .. Me and my son go in all the time ! I have never had a bad experience.. Top notch service .. Great environment.. And award winning food.. I will be going here for a very long time ! The only issue I have is my 3 year old son seem to think that Wes the owner is his dad. Very awkward when that happens .. But the food is worth the brief confusion ! Go Lions!

I had been dying to try this place for a while now, but it's quite a drive from where I live. I finally decided to make the journey yesterday, and I'm glad that I did. The industrial feel to the dining room is a nice change from the norm, and the staff was very friendly. It took about 40 minutes for the brisket to be ready, but that was just a small hiccup in our experience. Anyway, I had the pulled pork sandwich, macaroni and cheese, and beans. The pork was delicious, especially when I bathed it in the sweet & mild sauce. The mac and cheese was amazing. The beans were my least favorite. They were great, don't get me wrong, but they were a little spicy for my taste. Still searching for the perfect BBQ baked beans...  My hubby had the sampler with pulled pork, chicken, and he got the brisket in place of the sausage for an additional $1.49. The chicken was really good, but the brisket was the star of the show. It was juicy and just overall an amazing chunk of meat. It did have quite a bit of fat on it, but it was still really good. I really liked the overall experience and see myself coming back in the near future. I don't think I'll come often because of the drive, but it's definitely worth some follow up visits!

Can't say enough about how great our experience was at this place.  We had a group of 10 for a family dinner, and sat in their dining area in the back of the restaurant.  They made sure we had everything we needed.  The food was incredible.  Some of the best BBQ we've had in Phoenix.  We tried everything:  ribs, pulled pork, brisket, and smoked sausage.  All were excellent.  Fries and slaw were awesome.  We'll be coming back!

Came in today for lunch with some bros on our lunch break. The immediate smell you get when you step throughout the door is very welcoming. Brisket sandwich was excellent and of good size, Mac and cheese was off the hook! They have 4 different sauces, all unique. Will definitely come again.
Food and service was good. Food was limited due to busy day. Get there early to insure all menu items are available. Extremely fair pricing. We'll be back for the ribs.

This place was recommended to my by a friend. Said it was the best BBQS in the valley. I wasn't too impressed. The best thing I had on the menu was the bbq beans. Those I must say we're very good. The brisket, pulled pork and sausage seemed to be average. My daughter really enjoyed the ribs. And I would not recommend the chicken. The skin was tough and rubbery and the skin is usually my favorite part to eat. I wouldn't recommend it unless you're going strict for ribs and beans.   Not to mention the service wasn't the best either. The server forgot one of our orders.

I'm a BBQ lover. After seeing pork on a fork featured on tv, I had to try it. It is good old fashioned competition style. Just delicious. The beans have bacon in it which is always a plus. My girlfriend loves the BBQ burrito (she can't let go of her Mexican food obsession, even at a BBQ place) the combo platters are where it's at! The sausage is probably my favorite of the meats, however they're all equally tender and savory. They have 4 different sauces and all are delicious. I just wish they were open later! 8pm is way too early! But it's my go to BBQ spot for sure

Back again with a group of friends from work. I can't control myself and got the pulled pork again. Still as good as the last time I was here.   I did get to try the brisket And it was very good and moist. I'd like to see a smoked turkey sandwich as an option.   Great to be back.

I have eaten a lot of BBQ in my life all over the world. The quality and quantity that you get at PoaF is hands down the best I have ever had the pleasure of tasting. I don't often say that BBQ that is available at a restaurant is better than my own backyard, but that is indeed the case here.  The pulled pork literally melts in your mouth, and the selection of BBQ sauces available make it the perfect sandwich, lol.   Sweet potato fries are the best I have ever had, and the baked beans are amazing. I have got brisket tips in there that are a mouthful by themselves!  Waffle fries are, as you might expect, phenomenal.  The only problem I have is that they only offer two sides with the meal, and I want to have all of them. Of course, with the size of portions you get that may prove physically impossible. I usually eat there at 1030 AM and don't eat anything else the rest of the day!

Great BBQ and Mac and cheese.  Had the pulled pork which was so good and not sure what the spice mixture is that they put on the Mac and cheese but it really kicks it up a notch from regular Mac and cheese.  Glad to have found this place.  Will be back.

Best Barbeque in Phx. Great sauce, ribs and pulled pork. People are friendly and service is prompt. Only draw back is location so look for a address not a sign. I have eaten at many BBQ's in Phx. and it's the best followed by Hap's and then Honey Bears. I like the fact that if you fill out a birthday card they will send you a coupon for a treat around your birthday

Not bad, a little pricey, great pork sandwich. The mac and cheese and bake beans sides are better than average. The four different BBQ sauces are also tasty. The burrito BBQ meal is also a great meal. Too bad we're moving, we would be there all the time.

Delicious food - everything was excellent except I wasn't wild about the sauce choices. I prefer a Kansas City style sauce, sort of a cross between their sweet and their smokey. Had the large sampler and all the meats were great. Had baked beans, potato salad, and an extra side of mac and cheese. Beans were very flavorful, mac & cheese was great. Service was beyond excellent -- Darius went the extra mile in service with a smile, even though it was almost closing time. Other staff were friendly too.

Pork on a Fork is bitter-sweet to me. Their staff is attentive, wholesome, and quick, and their service is what keeps me coming back. Although their dining room is in the back, they manage to still keep it clean, even during a heavy lunch rush. I love their macaroni and cheese, and their sauces are to die for. However, it seems that their brisket (which was my FAVORITE) is very inconsistent. One day it's tender, smokey, and delicious, falling right apart and melting in your mouth. Other days, like today, it is tough and flavorless. It is very cool to watch the staff cut and pull the meats right in front of you, but when you can see them struggling to cut tough, fatty, brisket with a dull knife, it doesn't get you very excited to eat. Then, when you do sit down to eat, it feels like you're chewing on rubber. Not pleasant. I wish that every time I go, the food was the same. I don't know what they do different, but I hope they can figure out how to fix it.

It's been so sad to witness the decline of quality and standards at Pork on a Fork. This used to be a go to place that we brought our out of state visitors, after our last visit today, we will no longer be patronizing this place. Usually we go for the pulled pork but this time it tasted like it was just cooked in a crock pot. There wasn't the usual smoky flavor that was associated with the meat. We also ordered the mac and cheese and to our dismay they have changed the recipe. Long gone is the cheesiness that made the mac and cheese good, now it's just a liquefied cream sauce that doesn't taste cheesy at all.  The afternoon that we went into the restaurant, it was utter chaos. There was no direction being given and it seems like everyone was just doing their own thing. The person who pulling the meat kept touching his pants with the gloves on. Luckily for us another girl came up to assist us with clean gloves or I would have walked out right there. When we went to the back the tables were all dirty. No one was seen cleaning up anything. Back in the day when they first opened, POAF really did have great BBQ. Now I think they need to take down the sign that's on the door, because they are definitely not the best of the valley anymore.

Had a great experience with Pork on a Fork this past weekend. I needed some food for a party, sent a message on Yelp and promptly received a reply. I called to place my order and Kylie was very helpful in answering all of my questions. We ended up going with 2 of the extra large family platters. Those are great because you get 4 different meats, so there's something for everyone. All of the meats and sauces were delicious! My guests ate every bite so the food was a huge hit! Great customer service and food, highly recommend!

Our first visit was amazing! We ate at the restaurant. The pulled pork was tender and juicy. We tried all of the barbecue sauces and like each one for its own unique taste. The Mac n cheese was unbeatable! The corn bread was moist. The waffle fries were crisp on the outside and fluffy inside.  Our second visit we ordered take out and ordered the exact same thing as our first visit since it had been so outrageously delicious. When my husband got home they hadn't packed any of the sides. Just our sandwiches. It was too far of a drive to go all of the way back to complete our order. It took 20 minutes on the phone for the girl to figure out a partial refund for the sides, so she ended up doing a full refund which was nice of her.  Our third trip we also did take out. The pulled pork was so dried out that it almost had a cotton like texture. The Mac n cheese tasted like it was a few days old and scraped from the bottom of the pan. The waffle fries were soggy. Maybe they just didn't handle the 15minute trip inside a styrofoam box well. They were out of corn bread and a few other things as well.  So, I'm not sure if this place lacks consistency or the quality had just gone down hill all together. Such a shame, because the first trip had our mouths watering!

I had the beef brisket, pork, and chicken sampler. I had sweet potato fries and coleslaw on the sides. The coleslaw is not something I would order again. The sweet potatoes were good. It is the waffle fries that are full of flavor and they remain crunchy. The beef brisket was my favorite out of all the meats. The one I finished the first as well.. The chicken was second most moist and tasty and lastly the pork. The potato salad was alright .
Get this place ever week  Love it  Delicious  Best BBQ around I highly recommend checking it out  Alittle out of the way  But it's worth finding

Totally underwhelmed, tiny portions of mediocre food for big prices. Read the reviews, thought I'd try it out with my free dinner coupon from Uber Eats.  On the delivery menu the brisket and bbq sampler $13.11, you're prompted to add two meats (pulled pork and sausage for me) and two sides (Mac n cheese and corn bread) the price mysteriously becomes $21.10 plus tax and delivery.  It was free so I figured... Well, I was wrong, tiny portions of brisket and pork, half! of a so-so sausage and tiny boring sides. Save your money, you can do better at home. Never again Pork on a (tiny) Fork, never again.

I purchased a deal from Living Social and I'm sure glad I did. I would have never known about the place and I live in the area. I am not a BBQ "expert judge" i guess but like most people I have had it alot. In my opinion its the best I have had... Cant wait to go back...

I was really excited about going here because we love BBQ. While the food was fine, the atmosphere was really off-putting.   The food: We went around 6:00 on a Friday and they were out of chicken and ribs. I don't know if this is a normal thing, but it was disappointing to not even try the meats we wanted to. We ordered 2 plates - 1) pulled pork, waffle fries and coleslaw 2) brisket, waffle fries and mac and cheese. The meat was served dry, as others have noted, and there are 4 different sauces to try. I didn't love any of the sauces, but the mustard based sauce was interesting enough for me to use on my meat. I think the seasoned waffle fries were the highlight (which is sad, really, as they were probably one of the only things here that comes to the store frozen...). I didn't care for the mac and cheese (tasted only of swiss to me) and the coleslaw was made with a pre-shredded mix and boring dressing. Nothing interesting about it. My husband thought the brisket was good, but didn't care for the chunks it was cut into, as he prefers chopped or thinner slices.   The atmosphere: Although I knew ahead of time that it was in an office-park type setting across from Deer Valley airport, I still felt weird eating here. Maybe it's more of a pick-up place? The restaurant was dirty and worn and the staff was unenthusiastic about being there.   Overall: Head over to Bryan's Black Mountain BBQ in Cave Creek instead. Although they have less side options available, Byran's has a better atmosphere and good food. I'm still waiting to find that knock-your-socks off BBQ in Phoenix, though!

Great prices, great portions, outstanding  taste, great service. This place is is not your conventional dine in restaurant. When you walk in there doesn't seem to be a place for dine in customers but there is actually a nice dining area in the back with plenty of seating and 3 TVs.  If this is your first time here the ordering process can be slightly confusing but once you figure it out it actually works out quite well. Fantastic overall. Only negative is there is only one shared restroom for men and women which looks like it needs more frequent cleaning. But don't let that keep you away from this place.

It's been a lot of years since I've had pork this incredibly tender.  The Polish sausage was also prizeworthy.  The brisket was very good.  The downsides: the hot bbq sauce was good, as was the sweet one, but the "North Carolina" sauce didn't do much for me.  The cornbread muffin was dissapointingly miniscule.

We came in for a late lunch, only a couple diners at the time. So there was little wait. Our party of three ordered two of the midwest monster specials with pork, brisket, coleslaw, and jalapenos and one brisket sandwich with two ribs. We sampled a variety of sides: waffle and sweet potato fries, potato salad and mac n cheese.   We sat in the back and had the area to ourselves. We all agreed we liked that hot BBQ sauce best, so we used it on our sandwiches. The meat here is well smoked and very tasty. The ribs were really impressive. I love how the sauce carmelized the top but the meaty was filled with smokiness. The brisket crumbled into tender pieces, yum! Both variety of fries were good, the potato salad tasted like what you get at Sam's club, the mac n cheese was ok a bit too congealed for my liking. Overall, everything was quite good. Our only complaint was the bun. It's too soft and filmsy to support the sandwiches. Next visit, we'd prefer to order the meat by the pound and avoid the sandwiches all together.

I went here on Saturday May 28th 2016. Drove a long way to try this place out. I had the pulled pork. It wasnt bad. Average I would say. My wife had the ribs and she said they were a bit dried out. As for the bbq sauce, I could feel a slight burn from the seasonings but overall, the sauce had very little taste. And I use a lot of sauce.   For me, the real problem is as follows. As I stated above, we drove a long way to try this place. When we got there they had a sign on the door stating that a "party" was using the dinning room and all others must eat outside.  I work in the heat so the very last thing I want to do is eat in it. But we tried it. I wish we would have just gone somewhere else. The table clothes were stained up and disgusting. And sharing our meal with flies is gross. Never mind the 99 degree temp.  This place is average at best. I honestly dont know how it ever won Best of Phoenix one year.
This is by far the best pulled pork sandwich I have ever had. The macaroni salad and corn bread muffin was awesome also. I highly recommend this restaurant

The folks at Pork on a Fork know how to do BBQ!  Great food - good service - casual environment.  Take-out is set up separately from the dine in area - which makes for a fast get in get out with your order.    Hats off to the boys from Nebraska!

We can here looking for some good BBQ and WOW did we find it here. My dad is very hard to please when it comes to ribs and he was very pleased. I had pulled pork and it was so tender and good it just melted in my mouth. Our friend had the chicken and said the same.

The owners are from Nebraska and so am I so they automatically get points for being super cool like me. Everyone knows the coolest people in the world come from Nebraska and that is a scientific fact!  Now the food here isn't good....Its GREAT! This is by far the best barbecue in town and I've tried it all...Stacy's, Ric's, Honey Bears etc. They got nothin' on this place. In fact, I am going to eat there today. I'm getting the "Smokin' Meal". Its pulled pork, beef brisket and a piece of sausage. It comes with two sides and I recommend the potato salad. This potato salad is ridiculous. It tastes exactly like my Grandma used to make...authentic German potato salad. They have a variety of sauces to choose from which range in flavor and heat.   I don't dole out 5 stars very often but this place has always been very consistent. The quality of the meat and pork is what sets this place apart. I am sort of pissed though because a few weeks ago they made smoked prime rib and I missed out on it. How good does that sound? Mark my words, I will never miss out on that again.  GO BIG RED!
Awesome Pulled Pork and Smoked Sausage.  The ribs are great and I love the Mac and Cheese with Waffle Fire.  We get our BBQ fix a couple times a month at minimum..

The staff is very friendly and helpful, making good suggestions. The pulled pork and coleslaw were excellent (though I wish they had a Carolina style vinegar sauce to go with.) The baked beans tasted as if someone dropped the pepper shaker in by accident. Great if pepper is your favorite spice, but I will not order those next time. Absolutely plan to come back!  Update one year later: stopped in today and didn't realize it was 15 minutes before opening time until I tried the door and it was locked. Disappointed,  but since I had a lot to do today, I headed back towards my car rather than wait. Someone came running out to catch me and said, "Please, come on in!" Made my day!  Got the Midwest Monster to go, and it was incredible as always. Thanks, guys!

Extremely disappointed. When this place first opened and the owner was doing all the cooking it was awesome. Now the owner isn't cooking. The BBQ isn't that great. The prices are higher and the amount of food is less. The Monster for instance was a huge sandwich and a huge hit. Now it's smaller and the meat isn't the same.  The taste is ok BBQ. No longer the BEST.  :-( and we've been going here for about 3 years.

Appearances can be deceiving! This bbq joint is in the middle of an industrial area that I drive by daily! North Phoenix lacks a good bbq joint... Well until today! I tried the bbq platter and for the price I'm quite satisfied. Not a fan of the potato salad but the meat and sauces were good! I'll be trying more items on the menu in the future.
Great BBQ! If your not sure what to get, try a meat sampler. You get to select which meats and side dishes you would like.

Great BBQ. I like their brisket, chicken and pork pulled. The employees were so friendly. They put together a table for seven   even though they were so busy on the Xmas' eve. Definitely not a fancy place to eat in since most customers do carry out.

Well, the food was served cold, the sandwich bread tastes like it was purchased from the local grocery store with the bag left open all morning, and the corn muffins are dry and tasteless. Now that I think about it, the whole meal is dry and tasteless. Maybe I went at the wrong time.
The staff were very friendly!   The beef brisket was excellent! Had the sampler and ribs and brisket sandwich....shared it of course!  Loved the sauces.
I had the bbq chicken sandwich Sunday at the Steel Horse event and it was AWESOME!!!  I can't wait to try again and again.  We even bought a bottle of bbq sauce to enjoy at home.  Truly enjoyed!!
I'm from the Midwest and know my BBQ. This place totally knows what its doing!! super yummy and well priced! Highly recommend it
The ribs are good unless you get some that are old.I've got ribs 4 times 3 times real good 1 one time they were old  and taste bad.

Avoid at all costs until management gets it right...my first time I chalked up to working the kinks out because it was their first week; I give it a few more weeks and it was worse...  For starters the menu is deceiving and doesn't contain enough info to explain what each thing comes with. The service line is disorganized and quite gross - mixing of utensils, dirty service, prep area, and poor temperature control - food borne illness waiting to happen. Upon ordering a brisket sandwich the employee thought it was acceptable to put pieces of nothing but fat in basket to weigh as part of order. When I called him on it, he removed fat out and proceeded to do it again with the end part/trash part of brisket.  People in line behind me were as astounded as I was. After that, I cancelled order and left.   Eat there at your own risk!

Sorry, but I was not impressed.  Pulled pork sandwich was dry.  Waffle fries so oversalted I used my napkin to brush off the excess.  Macaroni was sloppy with way to much ??liquid.  Sausage dry.  Will not return.

When you have BBQ out its because there was no time at home. Or your away from home and need some comfort. If either, you are good here. Your standards are their standards. If you like it a certain way staff will ensure its to your custom. Even had a rib order that was not normal to their quality. After mentioning this to staff. Staff called management and it was pleasantly replaced.

We LOVE this place !!!!  Best barbecue in the valley !!!!  May have a little higher prices than other barbecue places, but it is well worth it !!!  Give it a try !!! My husband keep going back and it never leaves us disappointed !!!!
Here having a birthday meal with my son. So yummy!!!! The staff are funny!! Great costumer service. Will be back for more.

I'd like to update my review after Jake from Pork On A Fork reached out to us.. He definitely made things right and I'm so glad we'll be going back! I'm not sure what happened the day(s) that we originally went but it's very clear that customers are valued at this location, and Jake did more than make it up to us. Everything was ready to go when expected, and the food is awesome. I can't say that I've had BBQ this good in Arizona, everything from the Mac & cheese to the BBQ sauce is wonderful. I'm super excited that we have a new place to go to while we're working, this might be my new fave!

This is one of those places that I wish I could like it more than I do. They have a vast menu and quick service as you move down a Chipotle style line. Problem is I just haven't found any of their meats to be that amazing and their sides, other than the mac & cheese, are all just average. The mac & cheese is yummy though so I would recommend that.  Parking at this location can be a bit of a pain during peak times but there are quite a few 10 minute parking spots directly out front if you're here to grab takeout.  This is a good place if you want some quick BBQ but not where you go to get melt in your mouth 5 star meat.

Hands down best bbq I've ever had. Tracy,Krystal, and Karl gave the best customer service a guest could ask for    Food was really fresh and super tasty. Not to mention they support the troops by giving military discount!!!!!!!   Much love for this restaurant and the staff. They treat you like family. Will be back   Forever new customer!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  Huge shout out to the 3 of them. ( all-star team)!!!!!!!!!

Great BBQ.  Location is odd cuz its in an industrial park.   I ordered the Midwest Monster. Portions were great. Loved the BBQ beans. Huge chunks of bacon. Can't beat that. Cole slaw could use more flavor. Either sweet it up or tang it up. Meats were very tender and juicy.
Midwest monster is what it's all about. Best bbq sandwich I have ever had. Great atmosphere and I love the garage doors in the back

Yummy! Even though their name is pork on a fork (the pork is amazing!) I love love love their brisket, it's super tender and has a great smoke flavor, I love that they leave the sauce on the side, it honestly doesn't need it. If you're torn between sides, try the baked beans!

Went a little after 12 on saturday and got a bit of everything chicken, sausage, ribs & shredded pork. I tried the Mac and cheese and sweet potato fries for my sides. Unfortunately the only hot thing on the plate were those fries.  Don't know if it was a one off but everything else was served at room temp. I have to deduct a star for the cold Mac and cheese.

We came to Pork On a Fork for lunch today. I've been there before and generally enjoyed the experience. However, there are several pros and cons to this place.   I'll start with the pros: The time from when you walk in to when you are eating was pretty quick compared to other BBQ places. They have good enough options to chose from and have a specialty sandwich called "The Midwest Monster". It's a combo of their pulled pork and brisket. If you don't know what to get, get that sandwich. The sides were actually excellent. I had the coleslaw and mac and cheese. Both were very tasty. I managed to escape at $13, which is actually pretty good for BBQ.   Now for the cons: The line situation is very awkward. They ask you to grab your drink first before ordering. This is fine, except the line is always too long and is wrapping around the lobby. People trying to exit the restaurant have to cut through people in line to get out. It also can be very confusing to first time diners. It's easily solved if they give you a cup at the register, and put the drink stand in the dining room. In line, they brought out a new pork shoulder to refill the containers and the server immediately pulled off the bark and threw it in the trash. I died a little on the inside when I saw that. I was going to do the midwest monster, but switched to the brisket when I saw that. That's one of the best parts, right in the trash! For the food, the brisket left much to be desired. It was dry, and overall lacked smoky flavor, but it did pass "the pull test". Sadly, I had to grab some sauce to assist the sandwich, not good. It's similar to other places that use gas/electric "smokers", you'll never get the same flavor as a good, wood fired BBQ pit.   Overall, it was "just ok" BBQ to me. I can't label it "Best" as they do, but its meets the need and I'm sure others will enjoy eating there.

Huge chunk of fat in my pork, which I was told was was the Lean one between  pork and brisket. Potato  salad was cold cold but full of red onion. The beans were still hard, undercooked,  but tasted ok. The pulled chicken  was not hot!  The tops of the bottles on every table table were filty! New place, won't  go back!
This place is crazy good!!!  Awesome Baby Back Ribs !!  The best I have had anywhere.
Food is awesome. Brisket is like butter. Pork is like cotton candy.  Meat comes out smoked without sauce. A variety of sauces are available.

Dammmmmmmm!!!!!!!!! That's some good BBQ. This is going to be my new BBQ spot. The price is right and they're not stingy with the meat. I would definitely recommend this joint to everyone. I will be back. Oh yea, I got to give a shout out to Daniel one of the coolest servers.

This is a very quant place. They have some really classic BBQ and their sauce variety is awesome!! The meat is to die for and they have a nice variety of sides. The brisket was very moist and delicious as well as the pork. This place is definitely one of my favorite BBQ places.

Coming from Texas, I dig some Q!  These guys know some Bar B Q.  The meats were juicy and had a smoke ring.  One of the most important factors.  Had all of the meats and did not experience one bad thing, except I was too full for desert.  Highly recommend my friends here, you will be extremely happy about your choice.

I would say keep driving past this way way over rated BBQ spot .. Ya ya there from the mid west but let me tell you., there not fooling this Iowa boy ! liquid smoke ! Let's just leave it at that .,, my sides where good all give them that..  The lil corn bread mini muffin was a joke !

Best place to get BBQ in AZ! The brisket is so good...great sides-Mac n cheese and waffle fries are a fave! Hubby got the Midwest Monster last time and it was killer! They have a few sauce options that you can choose for yourself once your plate is dished up. Has big room in back and has a warehouse feel. Like the atmosphere. Think it's slightly costly for BBQ but worth it. Kinda nice you can enjoy a beer here too

One of the best pulled pork sandwiches I've found in the valley. A bit pricey, but worth it. Its hard to find good BBQ in Phoenix. I'm very picky when it comes to pulled pork and this is my new favorite.I didn't know what to do when they closed Sir Charles. And have been on the hunt ever since. I work nearby and blew off going here since it opened. Man! What a mistake that was. Its full of Asshole out of towners so I suggest getting it to go. But definitely try them out.

I'll be honest, it saddens me to have to give this place 3 stars for my 2nd review. For 3 years this place was mouth-watering amazing. I don't know what's happened within the last year or so but the last few visits the food has not been consistent. The mac n cheese has been served lukewarm, they've started measuring the meat when in the past it was a handful of incredible meat. Now it's measured to almost an exact weight and the brisket was dry. They've changed the way orders are taken so it really slows things down. They don't have Coke or Pepsi products, just RC cola, tea, Squirt and other non memorable liquids.  Guys from Nebraska: please get this place back on track! You're heads got so big from a visit by Guy and Triple D that I think you're forgetting your roots. I'm giving it one more visit and if it's not back to being yummy, I'm boycotting you.

4 1/2 stars after over 200 reviews? What gives? My wife and I visited Pork on a Fork today and we won't be returning. Not because we spent $40 on lunch. Not because the side of mac and cheese was over cooked and dry. Not because the cowboy beans didn't have any brisket in them. Not because my wife's brisket sandwich was tough and over cooked. The reason is the pork ribs. I ordered a full rack to find out if they could properly smoke and cook pork ribs. They failed. We had to fight hard to get the meat off those ribs. There was little if any moisture left in the meat. Adding some of the various sauces was on no help. My only explanation of the many outstanding reviews is that a lot of people haven't been to places like Coopers pit BBQ in LLano, Texas. Once you've had the gold standard of BBQ, you realize what is possible if you carefully and thoughtfully watch over your pork and beef while it is being slow cooked and smoked. I'm hoping to visit Little Miss BBQ in the coming weeks to test their award winning beef and pork ribs. They are about to open  in Tempe and my wife and I got to try their ribs at a Saturday open market and feel they may be the best hope for BBQ lovers in Phoenix.
Some of the best BBQ in the PHX metro area, if not the whole state. This place holds its own against the likes of Gates BBQ and Arthur Bryant's. Highly recommend it.

This place a gone down hill since my last visit. Purchased the $11.00 sampler and when I got home and looked at it I was extremely disappointed. A spoonful of pulled pork and spoonful of chicken and half link.  Do not order this !!! I they were not so far away I would have taken it back and demanded a refund. See photo.

This restaurant is has pretty decent pork but they have awful customer service and one of the dirtiest restaurant I have been in. I have been in this restaurant several times and in the last 6 months it has gone down so much and the lack of caring in more than noticeable

Been trying places around my work and when here for the first time. Yeah, I'm going to be going back a lot. Their brisket was amazing. Falling apart and flavorful, the macaroni salad was zesty, and the cornbread was gone. This is the BEST BBQ I've been in a while.

Wasn't blown away like I hoped.  Had the pulled pork with beans & coleslaw. The pork was the best part. It was so freaking tender & juicy, it's probably the best in AZ. The rest of the meal sucked. The bun was cheap & added nothing. The BBQ sauce tasted like A-1 thinned out with liquid smoke. The beans were out of a can. The slaw was on par with any you'd find at a grocery store deli. ...I will probably give them another shot, but there's better BBQ to be had in AZ.

I was highly disappointed with Pork on a Fork. I ordered the brisket sandwich and it was very fatty. I had to cut off the inedible fat pieces. The sides were decent but nothing amazing. Besides the food, the ordering was very unorganized. The assembly line and the menu does not flow well and I was cut in line without the cutter even realizing it! I will most likely not return to this establishment.

The barbecue sampler (pork, chicken, sausage) was excellent. The sauces were quite delicious too. We had 3 different sides: potato salad was good, the cole slaw was bland, like it needed salt or vinegar, and the baked beans were not very good. Overall the excellent barbecue meats will have me returning here.
The Sampler is great! Great smoke flavor. The variety of sauces are all good. Mac and cheese is awesome.

OK. Not terrible, but not great. I won't be back.  I had the sampler, as it was my first time and I wanted to try a little of everything. The meats are very juicy, but didn't have much flavor. BBQ is supposed to taste smokey (and sweet/spicy) but I didn't taste like BBQ. It tastes more like it was baked in an oven rather than over coals or a wood fire. In other words, the texture is excellent but the flavor is very lacking.  My sides were Mac n cheese and criss cut fries. Fries probably came from a big bag from Costco, not very good. Mac n cheese was fine.  The restaurant itself is not impressive. Weird layout as you order in front then walk past the kitchen door, two restrooms and into the back where they have tables (and another bathroom in the middle of the wall by the tables) Wobbly condiments table, dirty utensil and napkin dispensers; for a BBQ place I don't care too much about ambiance, but it should at least feel clean.  It is overpriced too. The sampler plate ($1.50 brisket substitute...why?) And a drink came out to $16 and change. I can get a full pound of brisket and a drink at Rudy's for the same price.  Its out of my way anyway but I won't be back.

I used to like (not love) this place.  Tonight I dined in and was served half the portion size I used to get.  Along with the decrease in serving sizes, the price has gone way up.  What was even worse is I paid 1.50 for a mini muffin corn bread.  Totally pathetic.  The young girl at the register said the prices weren't made by her... It's the companies fault.  lol..  Guys... Raising the prices and giving smaller portions will put you out of business for sure.  You're location is bad, the interior is dirty, food sub par and employees young and careless...

Amazing BBQ and amazing sides to go with! This spot is in an industrial building but don't let the location fool you this is high quality. Loved the home made sauces the zippy mustard glaze is my favorite. We got the regular family platter... Defiantly was enough food for us four adults. It was our first time here so this platter was a perfect way to get and try all the meats. I would take a picture to show off the food but it was gone as soon as it hit the table... Amazing! we will defiantly be back!
Excellent brisket and pulled pork. Crazy Jay's BBQ sauce very spicy and very good!!
Food was good. MAC n cheese cold. Cole slaw was grose. Baked beans were good. It wasn't so much the food but the delivery was sloppy. The bar b que sauce spilled all in the bag making quite a mess!!

This is our favorite BBQ place. There's lots of good BBQ places but this one it a little different. The food quality is as good as any and the flavor is the best. Love the sauces. The people and the low prices here take it over the top. Very friendly staff.

OMG! I was craving BBQ and googled BBQ near me... Pork On A Fork popped up, and I was shocked I never seen this place before.... But! That pulled pork sammich I had yesterday was DELICIOUS!!!! Now I have to try the ribs that I am most certainly sure are amazing as well ! Trust I will be back today. #MarkMyWords :) Good job everyone there! Let me add, you will be kept happy while in line. They are cheerful and just happy to be of assistance ! They welcome your upbeat, energized spirits to the fullest ! Thank you again for such great service.

The service was pretty terrible, employees made it feel like it was an inconvenience that they had to get food for a to go order. When I requested for waffle fries the young girl sighed and asked another employee if they had enough for me to order them. Portions were skimpy for the price you pay. The food was good quality, pretty standard for BBQ expectations. Overall, it's worth a try once but I'm not sure if i will be returning.
Delicious.    Tried the sampler platter.    Meat tender and juicy.   Service great.    No complaints.   All positive.

Have not been there in several months. The one thing that stands out most is that the food is overpriced for the meat portion. The side dishes are generous. Ordered one portion of brisket which was not enough to feed one hungry person, got more but of course had to pay additional cost. However, brisket was delicious. Not sure if we will return.

I managed to scoop up two humongazoid pork chops from their booth at the Downtown Phoenix Market. I also got to sample the smoked pull pork. The pork was awesome, perfectly smoked and moist. I took the chops home to grill up and man was I a happy camper. The chops were bone-in, and just perfect. You could taste the quality in the pork, I'll be buying these chops again. Way to go Pork on a fork, you got skills

This is a new location, their second (the first is just south of Dear Valley Airport).  And this was my first visit to either location.  It was very clean, as it should be being brand new.  The brisket was excellent. Good quality meat, nice deep smoke ring, good crust. They were out of pork (how could that be?) so I had a sausage link which was nothing special. The potato salad was quite good. The beans were not up to the quality you get at Honey Bear's, but OK.  On the sign they listed Coke products for fountain drinks, but the fountain actually had Kalil products (RC Cola, for example).  I will go back, if only to find out if the pork is any good.
