The overall meal was great. I had the sampler. The chicken and pork were very good. The brisket dried out before I got it. This is too bad because they do a nice with it. Most day the guys rate a five. The staff enjoys what they do and it shows. Get here early and dine in the back room while your food is hot.

After my last review, I received a response from the owner, Justin. I had my hopes up that he would take the bull by the horns and  things would be much improved. In that spirit, I returned to POAF on 9/28. Mondays, as a rule, aren't too busy. Therefore, it makes sense that the staff would have the time to be diligent.  I was hoping for a brisket sandwich, beans, mac n cheese and a Dr Pepper. This is typical barbecue. At 12:15 pm on a Monday, I was told that they had run out of brisket! I settled for half a rack of babybacks and the aforementioned sides. BTW, POAF's soda dispenser was out of Dr Pepper. I settled for sweet tea.  The babybacks were smoky, a bit chewy and hung on to the bone -- and they were almost room temperature. The beans were good and spicey. There were a couple of scraps of meat in the beans. However, not as much meat as there once was. The mac n cheese was, as usual, very good.  I'm trying to be supportive and understanding. I really am. However, I just don't understand how a barbecue joint runs out of brisket, on a Monday, before any real lunchtime rush. It's these missteps that have become emblematic of my trips to this establishment. I worked my way through college in a hotel kitchen. I watched the prep chef get fired over not having a steamship round ready on time. I'm wondering who was in charge of smoking briskets and if they still have a job....   Management has to solve these problems. One day, there's no meat in the beans. The next time, there is meat in the beans, but not as much as there used to be. Lastly, a failure to adequately prepare enough of one of your signature menu items to get through a Monday lunch is inexcusable. The problems here are a failure of leadership. I don't blame the laborers. I blame management and ownership for this carelessness.   I hate to say it, but it almost seems like POAF is coasting on it's reputation.

Better than other so called smokehouses in the area. First couple times in food was excellent but the smoked meats are starting to lack in smokey flavor. Sides are the same and excellent. BBQ sauce choices are good.  Ambiance could use some help.  Again what happened to the smoke?!!
Excellent food!   Very clean place with friendly staff.   I had the pulled pork and homemade mac n cheese.  Yum!  Highly recommend this place.  I'll be back for sure:)

Place is really good! Love the Mac and cheese and baked beans! The pulled pork sandwich was great also! Too bad it's in the opposite side of town from where I live! I would eat here once a week if I could!
This place ROCKS!!!  I haven't had anything here that wasn't spectacular.  Try the Mac n Cheese!

I've never been impressed with BBQ in Arizona until now. Sure, Lucille's has those amazing biscuits served with apple butter; those things are good.  BobbyQ's has those cute little donuts, and Honey Bears makes a great sweet potato pie.  But until I finally got to eat at POAF I have never been impressed with the meat in this town.  As far as slow smoked meat, forget about it. It really doesn't exist in Arizona as far as I can tell.  But now we have POAF.  POAF is amazing in every regard.  Their large smoker is in the middle of the restaurant (which is more of an industrial warehouse converted into a meat-eating complex) and when you walk in you smell that amazing smoke.  You can see the smoke loft up the vent. It smells sooooo good.  On the window outside it say "Competition Style Barbeque" which really says a mouthful.  First, you gotta have some serious swag to declare that what you're putting out is competition worthy.  You're placing yourself into the category of those artist smokers who dares to compare their wares to other fanatics.  What it really means is that they don't serve their meat with sauce, and you gotta have some real confidence in your product to do that.  When the meat stands alone without the sauce, which POAF's does, then you know you've got something special. You can add your own sauce from a great selection. Let me tell you about the meat.  We had the brisket, which in all honesty is the best brisket I've ever had in my entire life, hands down.  Now I come from a long line of Jews and we know brisket; we eat it pretty much on every holiday.  Take a look at the pics I posted.  The smoke on this brisket is amazing.  They cut it perfectly.  It melts in your mouth with a great texture. The flavor is "wham-bam-thank-you-maam" with or without sauce. In short, it is brisket perfection.  That baby back ribs were also fantastic. The smoke ring can be seen.  This is the dark outer layer on top of the pink meat.  The contrast of the outer smoke ring with the pinker meat makes some people think it's not cooked thru, but that is not the case. These babys are smoked to perfection.  The best part of the baby backs is that they serve them in a puddle of their AMAZING mop sauce. The mop sauce is the best part and I'm told it's made fresh.  The mop sauce is not available in bottles unlike their barbeque sauce.  This mop sauce is thick and sweet and truly my favorite part of these ribs. Mop sauces are usually thinner; this is thick. If you don't order the ribs, ask for some mop sauce to go with whatever you did order.  The baby backs were not the best I've had in my whole life, but probably some of the best in Arizona. They left the membrane on the underside; I prefer to have it removed.  Only true baby back Q'ers will know what I'm talking about regarding this membrane.  The owner told me they usually remove it, but it depends on whose putting the slabs into the smoker.  Again, these are truly smoked and amazing. The best smoked ribs in town.  I am equally impressed with the sides we had. The Mac-and-Cheese was probably the best Mac I've had at any Arizona BBQ place hands down.  The sweet potato fries were thick and piping hot, just how I like them.  The coleslaw was nice and lite; it did not distract from any of the meat, and the corn muffin was just okay (I would go up one size on the muffin - it was kind of small and we BBQ folk like things big!).  The red velvet cupcake was highly respectable.  I am so happy to have amazing smoked meat in Arizona. I LOVE POAF. Oink!

Talk about a disappointment. Good barbecue shouldn't require slathering it with sauce due to all moisture being cooked out of it. We tried the chicken, brisket, and the pulled pork. As someone that makes barbecue this may have been my worst experience in Phoenix. Just felt like I was chewing on leather coated in too much barbecue sauce.   Now, the barbecue beans were good and mac and cheese was ok. Never again.

Highly satisfied with excellent food and service tonight. The camelback location is clean and well taken care of by staff.  First time visit had me blown away. Customer service was exceptional.  Food was very impressive with taste and quality ingredients. Can't wait to visit again! I had the Midwest monster sandwich with waffle fries and the Mac n cheese. The meat has great smoke flavor you don't expect from a small strip mall place however it was phenomenal. The sauce selections will blow your mind. Try the mustard BBQ sauce... The waffle fries are amazing,crisp and fresh. Not to mention the serving is huge.  Mac n cheese is creamy and just the way it should be.  They have draught beer and bottled. So good  Cornbread muffins are to die for!

Have been coming here for the last 3-4 years, quality has been going downhill. I can understand with the popularity that the quality would decline a bit but not like it has. Today was the straw on the camels back and I will not be returning. The girl cutting the meats with glasses was pretty rude to us and the people in front of us were pissed off too. The brisket that was about to be put on my plate was so much fat and not much meat, gross, the people behind me ended up getting that in their lb to go, thanks for asking if I didn't want it (the reason I gave it two stars). I got ribs which were dry as heck, i have jerky that's more tender. They now only give you one bbq sauce per sandwich, i fel like I was getting nuggets at McDonald's. I'm from around the Kansas City area and was so happy I found bbq that reminded me of home, good luck poaf I hope you improve things.

Normally excellent right? Beware of carry out however as there is no notice when they run out of food. The Midwest Monster was more of a monster disappointment as they left off the queso and coleslaw making it.....a $12  sandwich? When we called to ask the reply was they were not willing to refund. Really disappointed more in the lack of service than anything.

I have been coming here for years but have never left a review. I have had mixed feelings over the years. I've tried just about everything but I am going to keep my review to one thing. They used to do prime rib Fridays quite a while back once a month and then discontinued it. It was amazing. We were monthly regulars. The quality of the meat and the flavor you can only get when its been lovingly smoked/roasted for half a day or more. It was a good value with asparagus and a side. I am really happy they have brought this tradition back. It seems they have kicked it up a notch or two as well. Now you get a loaded potato and a side with your 10oz.+ portion of rib. I asked, I noticed them weighing it to make sure the portions were right. This last time I ordered the mac and cheese with my dinner. They must have had an off night on the mac as it was bland as could be and had almost zero flavor of cheese. A dash of the rub they put on top saved it. I also got the beans. Super tasty but I miss having a piece of pork now and then mixed in. But getting back to the star of the show, the prime rib. Although its technically not "prime" rib, but most likely a choice cut, it is still wonderful. As I mentioned before I am no novice to their rib night AND I am a pretty big eater. So I decided to ask for a double order. I had them cut a double thick slice of prime rib and double everything else like it was two orders. If you compare something like this to any big prime rib cut you get at a steak house this is an excellent value and I encourage any big eater to do the same! Kudos PoaF for bring back our favorite!

I had a very good dinner from them! I got the Midwest Monster and it was very flavorful  and I was very happy I got extra BBQ sauce with it for the extra juiciness. Needless to say I will be back for more items on their menu.

Disappointed, we took a chance and went with pork on a fork for dinner, nearly an hour before closing, and we called ahead for our order. The order ended up being cold, we didn't even end up with the meats we selected (our surprise not knowing this until we had already been home) and on top of that all the food was pretty much the leftovers of the day, I know it's an hour before closing but it's no excuse for poor food and service, the Mac and cheese is what held me on with my bad experience last time but even that was awful this go round I'm truly disappointed :(

! had lunch here with a couple of fellow yelpers  and we all had a great lunch.I had the Pulled pork sandwich (good), waffle fries (real good) and the baked beans (great) . Everything was pretty good the only thing I can really complain about is my pulled pork sandwich would have been better if the bun was thrown on the grill for a minute to warm it up and toast the buttered side. That would have gotten them the fifth star. I am sure they will get it the next time I go there because a girl at the next table got B.B.Q. chicken and it looked awesome, I thought I should have ordered that, next time I will try the chicken and I am sure they will get 5 stars.

Strike three for Pork On A Fork last time dried out ribs to no ribs at all this is the second time I've come and they are out of ribs and they made it out to be my fault cause I didn't call in to hold ribs for me. If you ran out at lunch time and I'm coming at dinner time ya think those ribs are gonna be juicy and yummy nope dried out. Sorry but your not worth my families trip there anymore or my co workers off to hunt for another BBQ place.

Oh boy!  An abbreviation like POAF deserves a visit.  I am going to TRY to keep this short and simple due to the amount of people that may check this place out.  We came around 7 pm and the hospitality was great being greeted with a smile and recommendations on entrees and sides.  Therefore, we got the brisket sandwich and half slack of ribs with waffle fries, mac n cheese, cornbread, and the baked beans as sides.  Oh dang, you are getting excited, aren't you?  I believe coming late meant the food was not that fresh.  The food came out immediately and the brisket was chewy and dare I say dry with a little lack of flavor.  Don't hurt me POAF.  I am hoping this was due to the fact it was later in the evening.  As a result, I drenched that extra BBQ sauce on my sandwich.  Extra BBQ sauce?  You got that right, 4 different kinds to satisfy your taste buds!  My wife said the ribs were similar to my brisket.  However, we did enjoy the baked beans that had a meaty flavor with the pork mixed in.  Overall, I will have to try this place again.  Maybe a little earlier.  I am basing my 3 stars that the price is expensive and all the hype.  I looked at a menu at another popular BBQ SIT DOWN restaurant, and POAF was only a bit lower.  Therefore, if I am going to spend this much, it would be at the sit down.  Although, this is to be continued pending my next trip for a fresher experience.  I will see you again POAF!

I ordered takeout from Pork on a Fork thru Grub Hub. The delivery time took almost 90 minutes.  I realize this is most likely the GH drivers fault.  But the food was nothing spectacular, I ordered a 4 meat sampler, with beans and potato salad. The sampler comes with pulled pork, brisket, pulled chicken, and a small piece of hot link. It was all in a ball wrapped in foil and all mixed together so it all tasted the same.  It should be kept separate so one can enjoy the flavors of each individual meat. The baked beans were killer, and the potato salad was ok.

We stopped in for some bbq yesterday- I'm already planning my next trip! The ribs were basic, kind of over cooked. The beans were very meaty, unlike the beans sans meat we ate catered a few weeks ago. The Mac and cheese noodles were turning mushy (not very fresh). The brisket was pretty good. The sauces were darn good. Half pound brisket for $10, Mac and cheese came at a surcharge price for "premium" side, and no corn bread or Texas toast... Rack of baby backs $25.... Pretty steep price. Missing that real bbq experience without cornbread or bread to mop up that sauce! For a bbq joint in a desert strip mall, I'll give it 3 stars. The customer service was 5 stars! The Midwest is alive in that place- love it! We'll be back to try more food and hopefully get a 5 star quality experience.

This place smells like Morbid obesity and happy place dreams.  I was sooooooo impressed with the food!  The pork is flavorful, moist, tender, expertly cooked and seasoned and paired with a delicate bread.  I added Mac n cheese and it was also wonderful!!  I just came from Charlotte and it rivals the best from there!  Don't let the strip mall facade fool you.  If someone gives this place negative good reviews they are stupid....  This they can do better: home brewed sweet tea and lemonade. Get some!  Collard greens done well with fatback!

Thank you Yelp!  It is quite a task to find a good BBQ place in the North Valley and without you guys, we wouldn't have found this place.  Very friendly staff and great pork.    The sauces are not my favorite, but that is just me. Mac and Cheese rocks.  Planning to introduce some friends next weekend.

I was not impressed. I had the pulled pork sandwich with mac & cheese and waffle fries. The pork was dry, bun was soggy and the noodles in the mac & cheese were hard. The waffle fries were good. We will not be back.

Brisket and ribs, brisket and ribs, brisket and ribs.  Did I say brisket and ribs?       As a certified BBQ judge, I am very picky about my BBQ.  That having been said, I have traveled 20 minutes each way many, many times to eat here.  As you might guess my favorites here are the brisket and ribs.  Both have a very nice texture with enough smoke flavor to make any BBQ fan happy.  For the sides I will normally get the mac & cheese and the sweet potato fries.  Both are real palate pleasers.

It's all about the beans for me!  Pork on a Fork has the best baked beans EVER, with great flavor and chock full of smoky meaty bits!  I've been there just once, and had ribs and sweet potato fries in addition to the beans.  Ribs were okay, but a bit over cooked (dried out on the ends). They had several sauce options, all okay, but none made me say "wow". Sweet potato fries were a little underdone and soggy for my taste. Their new schedule is frustrating - when I go for BBQ, I'm generally looking for ribs, but they offer ribs only for 2 hours on Friday evenings.  (What's up with that?!!)  Pork on a Fork is on the opposite side of town from me, but I will drive there again just for the beans.

So, the meat was awesome! We got a big sample platter and I loved it all! Brisket, pulled chicken,  pulled pork,  sausage,  with Cole slaw, and sweet potato fries.  Then we had the mac and cheese and beans on the side. To me, the meat was the best... the sides were good,  but nothing special.  Price was great and service too... only thing I didn't really like was that it felt like I was sitting in a cafeteria. I really miss a restaurant that doesn't feel like a quick in and out atmosphere. A lot of places feel like fast food and this place was really cold feeling and kind of like a high school gymnasium. It doesn't make me want to hang out,  but I'll take some meat to go!

I am an admitted BBQ snob.  I have lived in places that make BBQ an out of body experience...so with that being said this place is AWESOME.  I mean AWESOME.  Me and the bf drove about 20 minutes out of the way to check this place out and so glad we did.    I got the meat plate and the bf got the bbq sandwhich.  He is a very non excitable man and he has not been able to stop raving about this damn BBQ all day.    My experience was quite the same.  With the beans and sweet potato fries as sides (and might I add probably the best sweet potato fries I have ever eaten) this place is top notch.  Why not the 5 stars?  The service is non existent and it's a do it for yourself kinda place.  This place is a MUST TRY!!!!

This is our second time visiting. The food was so-so, but our big complaint was the wait. We stood in line for at least 30 minutes. The servers were extremely slow! Weighing the food doesn't take that long! Bringing new pork from the back-taking the wrapper off was the Biggest ore deal. Not having certain food is crazy as well. That has happened both times we have been there. Honestly, it became comical after this long of waiting.

ABSOLUTELY DISGUSTING! And WAY OVERPRICED I am not trying to be a hater here, I just call 'em like I see "em or in this case see and taste 'em! Now to be fair I have to admit we did arrive there Friday at just a little after noon so they were definitely busy but having to wait over half an hour just for some tattooed twenty something employee to get some pre-cooked food out of the steam table and into a Styrofoam togo box is just a tad excessive! The first 15-20 minutes of the marathon wait I was entertaining myself swatting at the swarm of flies that were buzzing about this fine industrial park establishment. But that charm wore off after awhile and I decided to check on my order as I could clearly see that people who had ordered food after I did, were already served. So when I inquired with the tattooed boy wonder behind the counter he assured me that my order WAS ONLY another five tickets back and should be up in about 5 minutes. Well about 10 minutes later there it was: a Styrofoam box of the most bland, boring and dry BBQ meat I have ever paid $13 for the displeasure of trying to choke it down!!  Not even one of the mundane BBQ sauces they had in pumps could make this arid, dull, flavorless pork, chicken and beef combo come to life. Oh and by the way you pay an extra buck for their dried up brisket!  Really, who cares about the obviously paid for plug from DDD just skip it, you can do better just about anywhere- AND save a few bucks as well!!  THE TRUTH IS OUT THERE

Searching for BBQ, I wasn't expecting much since PHX isn't a BBQ town other than old, fat, retired hogs roasting in the desert.   But I had to try Pork on a Fork, if only to say, "This little piggy is going to Pork on a Fork!"  The $11 Smokin' Sampler included pulled pork, smoked sausage, and chicken with choice of two sides.  The tender pulled pork also came with a warm, soft dinner roll to make yummy mini sliders.   The half smoked sausage link was just that - a smoked sausage link without much excitement for texture or exotic flavors.  The chicken thigh was lightly basted in sweet BBQ sauce - not my preference, but the baste was light, so it was easily masked with the available BBQ dipping sauces (sweet, vinegar-based North Carolina, mustard, or hot).  The delicious mac & cheese had oversized macaroni pasta and was slightly seasoned.  The waffle fries were particularly yummy, even worthy of being a standalone snack.  WIFI and FREE fountain drink with Yelp check-in when ordering.   Great friendly service, as I still got the freebie even though I checked in after ordering, and the staff came out from behind the counter twice to ask how we were doing.  The only downside is the indoor location in a boring business park, as I was expecting a small roadside shack with some picnic tables and the smell of smokey BBQ for miles around.  But that could be a good thing because this fat little piggy wasn't slowly roasting in the Arizona sun while stuffing his face.  OINK OINK.

What a difference! After a being contacted by POAF Mgmt - We gave it another try and....  Excellent! The ribs were back to their meaty and delicious old selves! Racks were evenly cooked and juicy! Mac and cheese was creamy with just a perfect hint of spice. Sauces were great too!  Staff was very friendly and attentive as well.  Yup, it is only our first return visit and time will tell if these high levels are kept up but, we are more than happy to stop by over and over again this summer to make sure the ribs stay crazy good!  Thanks POAF - Welcome Back!!

A review for this place is long over due. I came across POAF reviews by accident just now, but once I saw they had a few bad reviews that we're all kind of the same. Ex. POAF used to be good now it's bad. I wanted to chime in as well.   They are totally coasting now off of regulars, I've been going for a couple years now and it was great at first. Now I totally agree with the other reviews.   First off, they have to be mad profitable. So why all of a sudden are they weighing the meat out. I used to not be able to finish the sampler. Now it's no problem. The pork (which should be a staple of your food line up) is way different now. Dry. Brisket is still always the best. Everyone knows that, but they're stingy with it now. Beans are good, but like the other reviews say, there is no consistency. Sometimes it has  an abundance of meat and sometimes none.   The staff. All are friendly. However, are they overwhelmed or something?? They mess up some easy details. Management should actually simplify the menu believe  it or not. Yes I know it's not a huge menu, but they can't handle the subs on sausage, chicken, ect. They are soooo slow now too. Weighing out meat takes them too much time. Good call management. (Sarcasm) Or phone orders with two tabs; one time I told the employee exactly what I ordered and what I would like to pay for and she charged me for the wrong one. (This was two separate tickets.) I'll still be back, brisket is all I get now. The double barrel of course. The price is always different too. Once again, no consistency.   When I go I always go with the mindset of what will the issue be today? After I eat the food though, I forget about the problems, but still, take some pride in your business. Especially when you have so many loyal customers.

So a cafeteria style bbq place where you place your order on one side & pay at the other. Had the baby back ribs and pulled pork. Both were very tender & the meat almost fell off the ribs without trying. Side salad was basic w/ dressing in small plastic container. Baked berms were average. Lots of black pepper to try and develop flavor. Coleslaw was okay too w/ little dressing to hold together.  The meat is what shines. Was hoping for traditional corn on the cob too but that is not offered. I'd go back but just for the meat. I'd get my sides elsewhere & take out.

This is Seriously some of the best BBQ I've ever had! I used to eat this at least twice a month because I worked around the corner and now I miss it so much! Any BBQ place I eat at I start by having the pulled pork and branch out from there, because if they can't do the basics I don't want to try anything else. The pulled pork here is outstanding and the portions are huge for what you pay. Some good sauces, not the best ever, but definitely presentable. The brisket was moist and flavorful, you can tell it's truly smoked. The sides are so-so, no Mac n cheese, which is weird. Where this place truly shines are their smoked meats, which is what barbecue is all about!

I am a BBQ guy. I have traveled throughout the south and have had some really great BBQ in the Hill country of Texas. That became my threshhold whereby all others would be judged and compared. Having just moved to the Phoenix area I wanted some BBQ and read all the yelp reviews and decided I would try POAF.   I ordered their Smokin Sampler and sub'd for the brisket. First the good: Their smoked pork is really, really good. Some of the best I've ever had. I give that a 5 star. Their brisket is good but not among the best I have tasted = 4 stars. The Polish sausage is a great brand = 5 stars. I was really looking forward to trying their smoked chicken that was included in the sampler plate but they were OUT - in the middle of the dinner rush at 6:30pm???!!! The person who brought out the plate apologized as he handed out the meals and said they ran out so they substituted a Polish sausage instead which is is exactly what I DIDN'T want. I paid an upcharge to have chicken, pork and beef brisket and got a polish sausage? I was not a happy camper so I asked to have some additional brisket to compensate - to which they agreed. The chicken (or the lack thereof) = 1 star. The two sides were baked beans and coleslaw which were bland and mediocre at best = 1 star x 2. The slider buns were not fresh baked and served at room temperature. Just steaming them would have been better = 1 star. The various BBQ sauces (of which I tried them all) were nothing to write home about = 3.   The cleanliness of the dinning room(s) was horrific. Perhaps the smoker was not venting properly?? The walls, ceilings and floors were in desperate need of a deep cleaning. I was afraid to check out the bathroom... = 1 star.   Totall score 2 stars.

My husband and I first visited Pork on a Fork a few months ago and it was amazing. The service wasn't the best but the delicious BBQ made up for it. We have been dying to take my mom so this past Saturday we decided to let her check out this hidden gem. Unfortunately our experience was absolutely HORRIBLE. The individuals working had us repeat our order at LEAST 6 times and then they still didn't get it right. It seemed like some of their friends came in and their focus shifted to their wants/needs. We followed the rules and ordered our french fries at the beginning of our order. When we went to pay, they forgot to charge us and then proceeded to charge us but never made the fries. We had to go back and remind them that we ordered them. A few of the workers didn't know answers to basic menu questions. The food came out and the meat was extremely dry and such a disappointment. It seemed like the pork had been in a crockpot all day and needed to be lathered in sauce. The sides had very little flavor. The overall quality was extremely poor and I am so disappointed. We will definitely not be returning.

Went for lunch. Got a pulled pork sandwich. Service was very friendly. Plenty of meat on my sandwich and I loved the sauces. Meat had a nice flavor but could have been slightly more warm. Fries were great. Corn bread average. Went for the meat and was very happy with it. I will be back. My buddy said the mustard bbq sauce was one of his favorites he has ever eaten. The bathroom was clean and had a great foam soap.
First couple times I went here it was delicious. The last 2 times I went the beef brisket was low quality and real fatty. Has no flavor ever since they switched to lower quality meat

Awesome food at Pork on a Fork!  The pork is so moist and tender.  And the brisket and chicken and ribs are so tasty!  You gotta love this place.  Their customer service is exceptional.  Whoever smokes the meat really knows their craft.  If you want great BBQ...please go to Pork on a Fork!...btw...I loved their bbq sauces too. And Matt Beard  is a very friendly catering mgr.  - Doug Howitt
Great food and great customer service! My favorite BBQ place. The Prime Rib they occasionally have is so delicious. Highly recommended.
First time trying, ordered through Uber Eats. So far so good. And my son inhaled the Mac & Cheese. Fork optional...

This place is average, and quiet honestly overpriced. The big boy platter is small, and stay clear of the beef brisket. The best part was the Mac and cheese and the portion for that is tiny! Hard pass on coming here again. People were cool though.
Best BBQ I have had in Phoenix! I have been many times and have yet to have a bad experience. Everything on the menu is good, the sides are amazing and I can get enough of the BBQ sauces they have.

Pros:  good service tasty meats yummy sauces (love that they are on the table to try) great fries and beans  Cons: dry mac and cheese  out of chicken nuggets (we have four kids, so this was a bit of a sticking point) pricey!  3 kids meals and two adult meals with drinks cost $50.  Honestly, I just don't think it was worth it.  Tasty, but not THAT great.

I want to tell everyone about this place, but then I don't want there to be a line out the door when I go there myself.  Such a dilemma!  I first read about PoAF in the AZ Repub and being a lover of anything BBQ'd and delicious pork, this was on my list of places to try.    My husband and I were out in the Deer Valley Airport area one day and I saw their sandwich board sign on the road and made him turn around and stop.  Didn't matter that it was barely 10am.  I had to try it.  Just getting out of the car, the smell of the BBQ made my mouth water.  Can I get that in an air freshener?  I had the basic pulled pork sandwich - no sauce.   It was amazing.  It was better than amazing.  I did not share it.  Hey, he could have ordered his own!  The sweet potato fries were a great side, adding just enough sweet in between bites of the sandwich.  I was in heaven.  I did share the fries.  Kind of.       The only downside to this place, for me, is that it's a bit of a drive from where I live.  But, since I'm able to buy the pork by the pound, when I'm there I make sure I stock up.  I have tried the sauces.  All of them are really good.  But when the pork is this good, it's really not necessary.
First time here and decided to get the Brisket with 2 sides ( Mac 'n Cheese and BBQ beans) The food was very good but took a Star away as the price was high - $12 n change without a drink!

This place is great! I get the BBQ burrito every time and it's awesome! The portions are huge and include your choice of two sides which are delicious. Mac and cheese is my favorite. This place reminds me of a chipotle where u walk up and order exactly what you want down the line which is great for the fast paced lifestyle or if you just want to sit down and have a nice meal. Also, the sauces are delicious. Try them all.

Came here with the wife on a Saturday for lunch. This location is a little hard to find since it is not facing the street. Good thing they had those sailboat advertising thingies out on the road to help guide my stomach.  Inside and out are pretty industrial. Lots of concrete and unfinished ceilings to look at while eating. The front section is very small with a tiny seating area. The back section is larger and set up with giant TVs and enough area for several families or large groups.  Service was a little confusing. It seemed hard to get answers for what I was asking. Just had a few simple questions. Maybe it was a training day or something. We are not talking rocket science here. Then again it was my first time there also. Maybe I was the one confused. Ha!  The wife wanted a 2 pc Combo Plate but they do not offer one. You have to order the Sampler Plate which is 3 Meats and make 2 of the 3 choices the same. What? I ordered the Midwest Monster Sandwich which was rather large and tasty. Both meals came with 2 choices of sides and there are 4 different sauces at the table as well.  The food was pretty good but seemed a bit average for Q. The brisket which was the real test for me and seemed dry and not very tender. I would have to guess it may have sat in the warmer a little too long. The Pulled Pork was really good and we saw several other people ordering the Bone in Chicken.  Overall they have pretty good food. Still looking for some real TX BBQ or something similar without all the sauces to cover up the flavor of the smoked meats. The meats should stand out on their own and not require much of anything. Maybe I'm just spoiled. Right across from the DV Airport. ROUND THEM UP!  3.75 STARS

I have heard of BBQ places running out of meat, but not cole slaw. The slaw was gone about 1pm. Get there early folks for the slaw...lol. Well in this part of town, this joint seems to control the neighborhood - all of the business' use the place for catering orders and everybody else who doesn't want to eat fast food every day likely ends up here for lunch in this food graveyard part of town. Well, the place was mostly empty on our late lunch arrival except for the several flies that made their way inside the hangar like building to join us for lunch. My brisket was a tad overpriced at 10.50, but they did include two sides, but then again there was no option for anything else (like sandwich only, etc). The brisket was about average, but the young teenager serving the food was kind of a rookie in cutting and serving. If I want teenagers cutting and serving my meal, I will head to a fast food joint. The sides had some potential, but sweet potato fries were served without a dipping sauce and the mac and cheese was an unusual version that was lukewarm on arrival.       The small midwest monster needs a makeover as well. The kid shoves meat in a tiny 4oz plastic cup and pushes it down then it goes on the very small Hawaiian roll and that is 8 bucks (it was supposed to have cole slaw). Two of the sauces were good and those were the smoky sweet and traditional version.   OTHER ISSUES: they Have a door where employees come out and it enters right into the path of people carrying their food to the back room. Poor design as I nearly collided with the busboy as he darted through the door. Not a top 10 BBQ place in the valley, but the folks who live in this part of town will still be loyal until a better selection of food arrives in Deer valley.

My wife & I ordered take out tonight from here we both ordered the BBQ pork burrito with the cornbread as a side.   Upon opening the box the aroma of the BBQ pulled pork permeated the room right away. The burrito was very large with a tortilla that was bulging from the pulled pork inside.   As my wife & I took our first bites we both looked at each other acknowledging our approval of how delicious the burrito was.  My pulled pork was juicy, well seasoned, incredibly moist and tender with a whole lot of awesomeness. It had an amazing Smokey flavor and the extra side if BBQ sauce was really good. Both meals came with cornbread which was the perfect addition to the burrito.   FOOD: Great BBQ - Love the tangy/sweet sauce , The food is incredible. I really enjoyed my meal.  SERVICE:  The staff is always very pleasant. PRICE: The price is entirely on-point.  For the quality of food you receive, which is one of the best BBQ places I've tried in Phoenix. The food is worth every penny...and probably a little bit more.  I have never been disappointed here. CONCLUSION: One of the best BBQ places we have tried.  RETURN FACTOR 100%.         ******************* What does my OVERALL rating mean? ********************  5 stars -Highly recommended.  I would be willing to drive out of my way to this business. It is that good. This place represents their industry or cuisine very well!  4 stars - Highly Recommended. I would frequent this business.  3 stars - Not that good but not that bad. Just average. I wouldn't mind going again.  2 stars - I would not recommend this establishment to friends or family.  1 stars - DO YOURSELF A FAVOR AND DO NOT patronize this business. I would RUN AWAY from this place and you should too! DON'T WAST YOUR HARD EARNED MONEY AT THIS ESTABLISH

Have been here several times and living in North Glendale, this has become my go to for good pulled pork sandwich.  Have been to Dillon's and Thee Pitt's on Bell Road and 55th "ish" and this place is better than both.  Only place I like better in the valley is Honey Bears but it is too far away from my home.  Though it looks good, skip the rocky road brownie.  Not as good as it looks.

So many BBQ spots opening up in the area it's almost hard to choose.  I got the sampler platter... My favorite part was the beef brisket. It was AMAZING!!! Everything else was just okay. I'd go here again but just order the brisket. I had to tell them to keep the fat on cuts of meat though.   The lunch line can get crowded but I think they just need a better way of taking orders.   The dining room set-up is a bit interesting as it looks like an old warehouse and its in the back of the space. I like that they are reusing the space without having t o do too much. I came back here twice in one month... that says a lot!
Great catering....food and service outstanding. We will use them again

I find it harder to come back each time I visit.  The quality of food has slowing gone downhill as operations grow.  Tried the Prime rib for the first time, it was way over cooked and very dry.  Frankly I would have been embarrassed serve it.  Wish the quality would return to way it was in the beginning.

Wohooooo!!! Just moved to Phoenix from LA and my company just got Pork On A Fork catered today!!!! Man best brisket ever..... Baked beans, corn bread, chicken all great flavors...  Thank you Pork on a Fork.
This place was incredibly tasty!!  Its a little pricey, but you get what you pay for!  The quality was A+!  Can't wait to eat here again!!

highlights:  1. the meat was really well cooked. we had pulled pork and the brisket. both were tender. moist. smokey. (not a bbq salt lick) 2. the sides were great. the beans were flavorful. the rice was soft and the coleslaw was cold and not overly dressed.  3. the staff was awesome! we went in at 8:45 (they close at 9) and received friendly service and good attitudes.  4. THIS IS FAST FOOD AND FAST SERVICE! having a good quality bbq meal fast and delicious requires a good review.   would we go back? HECK YAH! it's the only close bbq joint in town that ACTUALLY tastes like great bbq.

Best BBQ in town!!  I've had the chicken, pork, and brisket and all are super tender and moist.  You get your choice of sandwich, salad or burrito or bowls.  All are top quality as are the sides. The staff is very friendly and helpful. While super casual the dining area is super clean.
Good BBQ, not sure their claim of valley's best holds up though. Good if you're in the neighborhood but not really worth a special trip.

This was our first time here and there are a lot of choices and a menu that can be a bit I overwhelming in my opinion.  I had a brisket sandwhich with two sides and was stuffed. The main reason I did not give  it stars was due to the service. They were not rude nor were they friendly. We were clearly taking some trying to understand the menu as fisrt timers and they did not seem very thrilled about is doing so. The food was excellent though.
Pulled pork sandwich was awesome. Next time had the brisket and two meat sampler. Very good BBQ. Ubereats turned me on to this place.

There's something about the smell as you walk in the door.  Its the wonderful smell of the smoker.   This smell will haunt you all day.  Its soooo delicious.   This is about the only place I eat meat at, Pork On A Fork is a great little hidden place near just opposite Deer Valley Airport.  The food is fantastic, the meat is so tender, moist, not fatty and the smoked tasted is fantastic.    Their sauces really compliment the meats and sweet potato fries! I wonder if they will ever jar up the sauce... but i am sure it wouldn't be the same without the tender juicy smoked meats.     One of these days I would like to try the salmon, i am sure thats great.   HEY THEY HAVE LOOOOOOADS of seating space now!! plenty of room. Fast service, friendly staff GREAT FOOD!.

I was lucky enough to be part of the Groupon deal (thanks Christina P.) and picked up a Premium Pork Package at the Ahwatukee Farmers Market on Sunday.  The $50 package includes 2 pkgs (4 chops @ 1 inch thick) of Pork Chops, 1 pkg of Ham Steaks (or sliced for sandwiches), 1 pkg of smoked pulled pork, 1 pkg of bacon (choice of Regular, Peppercorn or Cottage).  Seeing as how patience is a virtue that I do not have much of, that same afternoon, we made B.E.L.T.'s using the peppercorn bacon.  Wow-wee, was that peppery (i.e. not for the weaklings) but it sure was tasty!!   A few days later we had pulled pork sandwiches for dinner.  Just as easy as the guy made it sound; defrost, warm, serve.  Quick and delicious, perfect for a weeknight dinner.    Up next the ham and the pork chops.  I can't wait!  Next time, I'll have to try some of the bratwurst (flavors include original, jalapeno, pineapple, garlic, and tomato basil).  Or maybe the breakfast sausage . . .   Local products + fresh food = money well spent, even if it is a little more expensive.  In the end that makes me slow down and appreciate my food a little more, which is another good thing!   This is win-win-win-win situation!   Well, maybe not so much for the pig.  :-(

Yumm!! I was so excited to find this hidden gem. Really cool atmosphere. The food is delicious. It's set up kind of like Chipotle, so once you walk in the door you'll have food in your hands within minutes if not seconds. Their sauce selection is excellent and caters to all different taste pallets. Good pricing and great food! Will definitely go here on the regular. OH, and did I mention the great selection of local brews on tap!?

If you're looking for authentic, great tasting barbecue, you've found it! The Midwest Monster is my personal favorite and the sides are made fresh and have fantastic flavors. Add more flavor with one of their delicious sauces and you're set! I like the Sweet and Mild sauce!!

If there was a category of "Where Not to Eat in Phoenix," this place is in the Top 5.  SAVE YOURSELF AND YOUR MONEY AND GO TO "NAKED BBQ"   Stayed away for over three years and thought I would roll the dice and try again. Wrong.  Terrible, there is no way on this planet anyone in their life their sane mind would say this place is any good.  Sauce sucks, meat sucks... No flavor, no body... Dry brisket... Lame sauce.  Messed up every single to go order. The guy opened every bag three times and still messed up everyone's. It would be faster to wait in line than order online. My coworkers say this happens every time.  This may seem like an petty but as a former customer service manager for a Fortune 50 company, this is the type of odd stuff that keeps people away......So a to go order get two sauce cups or you pay for additional..... Dine in and use all you want.  Makes me want to dine in and just pour bottle after bottle on my plate. They also should quadruple or more the exhaust and fresh air exchange so pe people don't smell like BBQ going back to the office, it's just a courtesy to your clients.  Save your money and go get a bunch of Dollar Menu items at McDonald's or go to Naked BBQ down the street or Little Miss BBQ down south.  Sorry no pics, the place isn't worth the effort.

So glad to see other great reviews for this place - we discovered this place because my husband's company used to get delivery from there - we have lived in the area for 5 years and never even knew it was there - in fact that is both it's biggest downfall and part of the draw for those "in the know".  If you didn't know it was there, you would probably never know - but once you go - you'll be SOOOOOO happy!  The staff is really friendly, the menu is easy to understand, the food is hot, fresh and oh so yummy.  The waffle fries are awesome!  So...  find it, try it, love it!
Wow! Some of the best barbecue in the state!! The pulled pork and the BBQ Baked Beans are a must try!!!

WOW are their drinks expensive!  Just got home from POAF and was surprised at the price of their drinks.  I ordered a large Midwest Monster and a drink.  The total with tax was $17.53 the Midwest Monster is $11.49, the tax should have been $1.39 which would put the drink at a WHOPPING $4.65.  Next time I think I will just get water which is free.

Amazing BBQ!!!!   My favorite thing about this place is that it allows you to choose your meat (brisket, chicken, pork, sausage, etc) and then they have a variety of different sauces on the table to sample with the meats til you found out which one you like best!   They have several different combo options if you want a lot of different kinds of protein. They also offer sandwiches and bowls. The sides are really awesome as well. I got the waffles fries and charred corn and I'm excited to try more!  Looking forward to coming back!

WOW what an unexpected hidden pleasure in a Industrial complex.  Good BBQ, good service, good location and when you put it all together you get great.  Kodda helped us with suggestions and he was right on, the sampler was the best. We had never enjoyed good chicken at a BBQ place till now, brisket so tender you could cut it with a spoon and melt in your mouth.  Shout out to Paige the Manager she knows what she is doing. Excellent choice of sauces, reasonable prices all this makes you want to leave a great tip.  Keep up the good work!!!!!!!!!!
The food is homestyle and delicious.  They are wise and do few things and do those few things well.  The environment is laid back,  open and comfortable. A great place for kids.

Smokin! Thats how I'd describe this place. The food is smokin' good...and it also is smokey inside. I left smelling like I was preparing the meat myself.  Because of that, and the fact that the sauce selection's "Hot" was more like "mild" can I only give the place four stars.   After reading some reviews and blog posts about the place...and learning it was just down the road..I had to try them out. I suggested going there with a PR colleague of mine for a lunch meeting. Luckily, there was a place to sit. If this place gets super busy, you probably will have to stand or take your food to go. I think there were only six 4-tops of tables in the place.  Pork on a Fork is in a business complex and not easy to find from Deer Valley Rd. Drive slowly as you go down the road and hopefully they'll have a little sign out to designate where to turn in or you'll probably miss it. The food is GOOD! I ordered the brisket sandwich with sweet potato fries and potato salad. Our food came out in a few minutes and was really good. The brisket was in big chunks...it had some burnt areas around the fat, which was fine with me. It was a nice helping of brisket on the bun, and some fell out as I ate it.  The sauces, which I mentioned above are not that exciting. The "hot" sauce wasn't spicy...I have sinus issues right now and the sauce didn't clear them at all.  The sweet potato fries were hot and crispy and just a light salt on them. The potato salad was your typical mayo-based potato salad with big celery pieces in it. Creamy and yummy.  The staff was friendly and nice. One of the workers saw us as we were disposing of our trash and asked if we liked our food. They also offer breakfast...no dinner yet. I'll be back. For sure. Just maybe before I shower for the day.

Went here this week with my coworkers who chose to have lunch here. I was excited about going here because I love BBQ. When we first got here, it was probably about 1145 or so, and the line was pretty long. They only have one cashier who takes your order, and that  coupled with the long line made even getting my order in take pretty darn long. The food itself? I had the baby back ribs and mac salad and potato salad. My thoughts? Meh. The salads were just mediocre and the ribs only a step above the kind you can buy in the package at costco and heat up. Dissappointing to spend $22 and get that, and the servings of the salads were also fairly small. The worst part though? The flies in the dining area. I was constantly having to waive away flies! Unacceptable! I mean maybe it was because of it being the rush hour with people constantly opening the doors but man, it wasnt like I was eating outside, I was eating INSIDE. So in summary, the food was just average, the portions of the sides small, the cost high, and the dining experience, terrible. I  would give it 0 stars if I could. Hopefully they will get these issues addressed.  Not sure how this place can average 4.5 stars,. My visit was just awful.

I am eating this fab BBQ right now!! My husband works near them but didn't even know until a client took him out to lunch. He was so impressed that he went back after work to get us both dinner!! Great ribs, smoke ring, tender but not falling apart... great slaw and tater salad as good as mine!! Wow... what a find. My ex was a competition BBQ man and until today, nothing could beat his ribs...now, I have had better...wonderful stuff.  Chef Jill Ames Miranda, Ames to Please Catering
Not the best in any town. Went for dinner and everything was in foil on warmers. Will not return.

My girlfriend and I had a Groupon for here that we used several months ago. We went for a late lunch/early dinner on a Saturday.  Location: A bit out of the way and in an odd strip next to the Deer Valley Airport. Inside was a bit small and noisy. Location and bathrooms were clean.  Food: I had the pulled pork, brisket, and smoked sausage with coleslaw and bbq beans. The pulled pork was pretty good. Decent balance of flavor from the meat, seasoning, and smoke. The brisket is the best I've had outside of Texas. It was a bit dry but had a nice crust, a good smoky flavor, and went well with the sauces. I regretted making the sausage part of my sampler, as I felt I was gypped because there wasn't much of it. It was pretty standard restaurant sausage: better than what you buy at the grocery store but I've had better. The coleslaw was okay. The bbq beans seemed like they were canned beans that had been dressed up a bit but still tasted like they needed something added. With the addition of my favorite of their sauces to the mix, I thought the beans were pretty good. I can't recall much about their variety of sauces anymore but do recall my gf and I had a couple we both liked.  My girlfriend had the pulled pork, ribs, and chicken thigh with mac n' cheese and cornbread. She thought the pulled pork and ribs were pretty good. I ended up eating her chicken thigh because she was full and felt it was too smokey. I was actually pretty impressed with it. It wasn't dried out like a lot of smoked chicken and, while the smoke was the predominant flavor, I felt it suited the meat well. She really enjoyed her mac n' cheese and cornbread.  Staff: Friendly and helpful.   Summary: So far, this is my favorite barbecue place in the Phoenix-area. I haven't been back yet, but I do plan on going again in the near future and I always recommend it whenever anybody inquires about a good barbecue place in the valley.

This place is bomb.com. I even got my food to go and it was still poppin. I got the Mac n cheese and it had some type of Cajun seasoning, it tasted delicious. I even had sweet potato fries to go and they were not soggy when I got home. The fries with sweet and salty and a tad crispy. I got the BBQ chicken sandwich and it was also delicious. I will definitely come back here.
This place is great, just not as consistent in their delivery as some of the other BBQ places in the area. They were the first to bring BBQ to Deer Valley so I have to give them props for that.
Metaphorical back to back to back orgasms in my mouth every time. I literally cry when my food is brought out. Mac and cheese is bomb. Sweet potato fries with honey mustard is fire

Had never heard of this place before today. But I won't soon forget! A rep took me here for lunch today. It was truly amazing. Then eat was so tender. Delicious! I had the 3 meat deluxe and while I appreciate her using her hands to pull apart the meats rolling it between her fingers, it was bothersome to me. A bit barbaric at first. But omg it was so good. Love that they weigh the meat. The place is so unique. Smart and niche. I love this place. Can't wait to take my carnivore 15 year old son! Wait I can't wait to go again too!

Really good pulled pork and chicken! I mean really good!!! Solid potato salad and tasty waffle fries. I tried the burrito today which disappointed as they use baked beans in it, which was kinda weird and standard store bought tortillas. I would suggest that they use super large premium local made tortillas and also include quesadillas on the menu. If you stick with the pulled pork sandwich...you will not be disappointed. This is really close to work and I will come back a few times a month.

Yum-E, Great BBQ Joint.. Went today to the restaurant for lunch. I had purchased a Groupon for a discount and thought it sounded to good to pass up.  The restaurant is kinda hidden in a business building area, but just look for the signs near the road it's not terribly hard to find.  Hours are limited Mon-Fri closing at 3pm so unfortunately you can't stop by for dinner.      I walked into the place and it was filled with the sweet smells of smoking meat.  With my mouth watering  I ordered the smokin' deal.  It had a smoked sausage, a pulled pork sandwich, and a brisket cut on a bun, which came with two sides.  For $10 bucks for lunch not a bad deal for all that.  The food came out pretty fast and while I was waiting bumped into a fellow yelper who was proud of this restaurant find.  Myself I couldn't wait to dig in.  It was very tender and fresh tasting.  I'm very glad this place isn't very far from my home, but I must find out where these farmer markets they go to on the weekend are. A+ place

After many years of searching the Peoria Glendale area....we have found our place. Our high bar is Dreamland Ribs in Tuscaloosa Alabama....so we feel pretty confident we can identify good BBQ  Meat was stellar. We had the brisket and the pulled P. the 4 sauces offer anyone something from super sweet to tangy.  Atmosphere was good.....cool little back room with a few plasmas. This place gives you what you need, good BBQ. Not heavy on the frills which is fine with me to keep the prices down. It has a very southern/Midwestern  feel and evidently the guy is a Husker fan. College football fans are almost always GREAT people  ;)  Friendly service. Price was reasonable for a family of 5 and a 1/2 lbs. of brisket.  Baked beans were a little weird tasting. Slaw is good with.   mac and cheese was actually not that big of a hit with the kids. Wife liked it.   This is a MUST go to if you like BBQ...... After our last run to fmsDvs.....and a sandwich that was half fat....we were at a loss.   Go....

Best brisket! Smoked chicken and pulled pork were delicious as well. Good sides and a decent price for BBQ - which can actually get kinda expensive. Atmosphere was kinda meh - I would definitely recommend grabbing and going.

Great food, excellent service. I rarely get out to this area so luckily I was able to get in minutes before they closed.  I ordered the sampler but with brisket and extra pulled pork instead.  Half an hour later I get home and find that half of the portions was pure fat.  I guess I got the dregs of the day.  The parts I did get were amazing, just wished I had more meat than fat.  If I were eating in I could have said something but I guess the moral of the story is don't go in moments before closing.  I've eaten BBQ at various small operations around the country and they do have some very good stuff so I give them props for having some great BBQ.

Very disappointed which I guess isn't the norm here but my meal was not very good. Maybe they had a bad day but not a good experience despite everyone recommending this place.  I ordered the sampler platter, hot link sausage, pulled pork, chicken, and added 4 baby backs.   Chicken-Excellent Cole Slaw-Good but nothing special Waffle Fries-Seasoned so not very good Sauces-The Mustard was the best and very favorable, the others aren't bad but nothing special. Ribs-Major disappointment, they were over cooked, very dry, and nowhere near "Fall of the Bone".  Hot Link-The was good and it's about third of a hot dog size wise. Pulled Pork-portion was big but also very dry. Corn Bread-Did not eat because a fly landed on it twice. Price-pretty overpriced too  Unfortunately I won't be back on my next trip to the area and drove down from my hotel in Anthem.

Great restaurant! Very clean! Very knowledgeable staff, locally owned . The food is fresh fast and huge portions . Really great flavor foods. Brisket sandwich is awesome!! Barbecue at its finest. This place is addicting.
The best BBQ in Phoenix! My family and I loved the food, we were all so full and happy with delicious meats. Definitely coming back again!

This is twice  we've used this location with the same result.   I have no problem charging and taking the order over the phone. When we go to pick it up, huge problem.  They can't find the order... Have no idea what we're talking about... Even though I can show them the charge on the bank app  from the day we place the order, this still does not get the order moving any quicker.   20 minutes of wasted time before they finally find it in  some archived system,  even though the order is only two days old.   The food is ok, but seriously I just can't recommend these guys

We wanted to try this place after watching it on Diners Drive ins and Dives with Guy Fieri. Upon arriving the place was empty even though we stopped by a hour before they closed or the foods sells out, that's what the sign said. We got the Sampler plate with  four Meats( Pulled Pork,Chicken,Beef, Sausage) and you can add Baby Back Ribs to your order. Our sides Mac n Cheese Potatoe Salad and Baked Beans. All the meats were dry, the ribs were tuff, to tuff to finish, It didn't taste like they were cooked long enough and the Mac n Cheese was old, the other sides were ok. Customer service was fine. We had high hopes for this place, we left disappointed.

Holy crap this is some good BBQ.    My wife and I love BBQ and are always looking to try new places.  When we saw this place was just down the street from us we decided to give it a try.  My wife and I both got the smokin' meal, which comes with brisket, pulled pork, sausage and two sides.  The meats were each equally fantastic and the BBQ sauce was really, really good.  I also really enjoyed the baked beans and cornbread I got with my meal.    The price was pretty reasonable and we got our food super quick.  The place is located in kind of a weird place but it's worth looking for if you have to.  Seriously, some of the best BBQ in town.

Someone else used the words "salt bomb" in their review - that sums it up perfectly!  I was in on a Saturday afternoon for a late lunch. I wanted to get a feel for the offerings, so I decided to order the two meat and two sides platter. I requested pork and brisket (they were out of pork, so I switched to chicken) as the meats, and the potato salad and beans for the sides. The employees behind the counter were great. Friendly, able to answer questions, and in good moods. The place is kept clean, and given the "off" time I visited, plenty of table space to choose from. The meats are served without sauce - and there are four sauces on the table to choose from. (Mild, sweet, mustard based, and hot.) The potato salad was nice. Maybe a little heavy on the red onion - but I happen to like onion, so I didn't mind. The beans were bland, and somehow, the pork in the beans was completely dry and tough. I can't figure out how that's possible - as there's so much liquid in the beans - any meat in there should positively be tender. Then comes the salt bomb! The chicken was so salty, I could barely taste any of the sauces other than the hot, which tasted like a BBQ salt lick. Tasting it without the sauce, I could barely discern any chicken OR smoke, only salt. The brisket (also seen in another review) was almost like a beef jerky. It was so dry and tough - and when tasting without the sauce - I could taste the meat and smoke - but mostly - no surprise here - salt! In the time it took me to eat the potato salad, half the beans and half the meat, I went through three cups of iced tea, and filled my cup a fourth time on my way out - and was still thirsty). I ended up throwing away over half the meat and leaving still hungry - I just can't handle all that salt. There are several options for decent BBQ in the area - I won't be coming back here at all.

We came with high expectations because of the Yelp reviews but I must say that we were pretty disappointed. The place was not very clean at all. 80% of the tables were dirty, the restrooms weren't kept up, the overflow compartment at the bottom of the soda machine was completely clogged and dripping water on the floor. There were no clean cups so we had to get our drinks in to-go cups.  I ordered the sampler and added brisket. The pork and chicken had a great smoke ring appearance but not flavorful at all and the brisket was really dry. I chose bbq rice and Mac and cheese as my sides. The bbq rice had absolutely no flavor other than being spicy but the Mac and cheese was really good. I really wanted to like this place and always want to support independent restaurants because I know how tough owning a restaurant is and how hard the owners probably work but it just wasn't as good as I'd hoped.

We had brisket with no bun. Brisket was excellent and could be cut with fork. No knife necessary. Sides were good and BBQ sauce was good. Fun industrial feel. They do have a good selection of bottled beer. Tvs in dining area and kid friendly

I've been here three times and have had terrific food each time.  The meat is incredible and their sauces are amazing.  Portion sizes are generous and the mac & cheese is delicious!  This is what BBQ is all about, definitely one of the best in Phoenix and we're lucky to have it here in the NW valley!
Great food, great access and great people. Thrilled to have a BBQ place this good in the Valley!

Spent 120.00 on a huge feast to go. Picked up order and requested all of the sauces to be included. We  didn't get one. By the time we got the food and realized we didn't have any sauce we were annoyed and no one wanted to drive back. Meat was ok, probably would have been good with sauce. What a waste of 120.00.

Let me start off by saying, please dont go here when you're starving because the smell when you walk into order will cause you to order everything on the menu. I ordered the deluxe bbq sampler with sausage sub'd for the chicken. I chose the coleslaw, mac and cheese, and an added cornbread muffin for my sides. All of the sides looked very good and this was a hard choice to make. Driving home was torture and it took all of will power to not dive into it one-handed and cause a wreck on the 17. The pulled pork was great! Very moist and flavorful. The sausage was a letdown as it wasn't spicy at all and tasted like a plain johnsonville sausage. The brisket was moist and very smokey. In fact the smoke flavor was all I could taste.  As for the sides, the cornbread was by far the best of the 3 I bought. It was sweet and light. A bit crumbly but in a good way. I loved this muffin. I'm not ashamed to say that I scraped the wrapper to get every bit of it that I could. The coleslaw really lets the cabbage be in the spotlight. The sauce is slightly sweet and is inly barely coated on the cabbage. It disappointed me at first but was actually a nice break from the otherwise heavy meal. The mac and cheese was also good. Very cheesy with the main cheese being cheddar. They add a spice mix to the top that added a smokey/salty touch. I'd probably eat here again as there aren't very many bbq places to choose from in the north valley. The pulled pork will probably be my go to. I wonder if they'll serve it to me on cornbread muffins????
We used them for catering for a party at our house and everything was amazing and got rave reviews from our guests !

This place is very good. The pork ribs were not fall off the bone, but they were very flavorful.   The brisket is juicy and flavorful. make sure you get it fresh cut from their smoker, the meat out of the single portion trays where they plate the combinations was pretty dry.

Good call Yelpers, good call.  Full disclosure, I've had barbecue at some pretty famous establishments in Austin and Kansas City.  While this place doesn't have the history or the reputation of some of barbecue bastions of the world, this is definitely among the best barbecue joints I've been to in the valley.  Perhaps that might not be a high bar to clear, but its definitely worth a try.  As with so many barbecue joints I've been to, this location seems to have a goofy disposition.  This particular establishment is located in a row of storage warehouses right across the street from Deer Valley Airport.  You really have to be looking for this place as the exterior blends in with all the other businesses in the complex.  Once inside though, the story changes entirely.  I was warmly greeted by a gal at the register as the lunch crowd came streaming in.  Their meat smoker is right behind the register filled with slabs of brisket, ribs, pork, and sausages.  The smell wafting into the front counter is heavenly.  Theres a tiny amount of seating up front, but there's a bunch more around the corner in back.  The back is basically an industrial garage thats been turned into a sports lounge of sorts with multiple TVs showing ESPN channels, a bunch of booths as well as table seating in the middle.  Not fancy or pretentious at all, but very relaxed.  If it had a bar, it'd be perfect.  Being that this was my first trip, I grab a sampler plate.  You get pulled pork, smoked chicken, and smoked sausage along with two sides.  For a little extra you can substitute a meat for brisket.  Being that brisket is their calling card, I exchanged brisket for chicken this time.  I got BBQ beans and waffle fries as my sides.  And got a couple of soft rolls to make sandwiches with my meats.  I grabbed a booth seat in back since the front was already getting crowded.  So let's get to the verdicts on their food.  And for the record, I typically like to eat my BBQ without sauce as the best barbecue doesn't need it.  For starters, excellent brisket.  Nice smokey flavor with a pronounced smoke ring to match, tender and juicy, and a nice portion.  The sausage's smokey flavor was a little less pronounced, but plenty juicy and flavorful as well.  The pulled pork was also good, though perhaps a little on the dry side.  The beans were a little bit of a bust as I didn't taste any BBQ flavor in those.  I actually got the waffle fries so I could try their four sauces which are provided at the table.  Of the four, I actually like their mustard flavored sauce best.  The mustard gives it a little tangy zip that adds to the flavor without being too spicy.  They also have a sweet & mild sauce, a smoked tangy sauce, and a hot & spicy sauce (it wasn't all that hot in my opinion).  I applied a little of the mustard sauce to the meat which was great, though as I said great smoked BBQ doesn't need sauce.  Total for the sampler plate (including the brisket substitute and two sides), 2 rolls, and fountain drink was $15.  Good lunch portions that left me satisfied without feeling uncomfortably full.  I was in and out in less than 30 minutes.  The place was really getting busy as I left so the average time spent here might be a little longer than that.    After eating here I still give a slight edge to Bobby Q's as the best in the valley, but POAF can certainly hold their own, especially on the brisket.  In the end, its not Bryant's, or Franklin's, or Salt Lick.  But if the Phoenix area is going to get into the barbecue sweepstakes going forward, it will be competition style BBQ joints like Pork On A Fork that will be forging that path.

Normally Pork on a Fork is my go to for lunch and tonight I decided to get it for take out for dinner for me and my husband. I regret this decision as this is by far one of the worst meals I have ever had.   For $30, I got a Beef Briskit meal and a Briskit BBQ bowl. They gave about half of the portions of both meat and sides then they do during Lunch hours, which is a mixed blessing as the flavor was severely lacking. My BBQ bowl was more than 50% potato salad. This normally would not be a big deal as I usually love POAF's potato salad, but tonight it was a gloopy, watery, odd tasting mess. It is pretty gross and I tried separating out as much edible food as I could. My husband took one bite of his potato salad and scraped the rest into the garbage.   The meat in my husband's meal was very fatty. He did like the flavor, and was satisfied with the cornbread muffin, paltry as it was. Most of what I brought home ended up being thrown away. If I lived closer I would have taken it back. Instead this was a very expensive lesson: avoid Pork on a Fork after 2pm.

Boy - used to love PoaF...but since they've expanded their operations, it's just not the same. The smoker isn't sitting right behind the servers any more (I think I missed the smell right off the bat).  The Po Boy sandwich isn't on the menu anymore (though they made up something close to it when I asked - close, but not the way it was).  Just seems a lot more like the other BBQ joints now.  :-(

I got a BBQ bowl. You choice of filing. Rice beans or Mac and cheese. Your choice of meat and your choice of toppings. I did cilantro rice, brisket, Cole slaw, and corn. The brisket had good flavor but on the drier side. Overall okay if your in north Phoenix and want some BBQ. A little pricey.  For a 24 oz drink and the BBQ now the total was 17 bucks.  The guys behind the counter were slow. The contents of the bowl were not consistent with two other people who were in my party.
The pulled pork was absolutely fantastic. The only downside is seating is very limited so be prepared that you may need take-out but the food is fantastic

Let me add to the 5 star reviews here!  My husband and I got the sampler plates and oh man....we are so glad we found this place. Best BBQ ever. Brisket was tender & flavorful, pulled pork was juicy and tender and smokey, sausage was perfect, sauces were amazing....  The sides were all great (get the beans!)
My friend told me about this place, I've been back twice now.  Great barbecue and a ton of seating in the rear

We got the family feast for 5 its nicely portioned it could even feed maybe 6 depending on how hungry your group is. I am bummed out that they didn't have any cornbread left when i visited, however i will be back soon.  The employees are very friendly and they keep the establishment clean.

The BBQ is incredible but I personally fid it a bit overpriced.  Even so I would go more often but the deal killer for me is the drinks.  Coke vs Pepsi - i don't care, but these guys are serving RC cola.  Yuck!

Tried this place for the 1st time this year.  Had the bbq pork sandwich with waffle fries and potato salad. My sis had the Midwest monster with Cole slaw and mac and cheese. The pork was good and the sides were generously portioned. The place was super busy even for a lunch on a Sunday. It's nice you have many sauces to chose from. The RC cola was a cool soda option.  Would go back again for sure.

Been twice. Probably the best BBQ in North Phoenix.  I like the following things in BBQ. #1) Smokey flavor - I want to know it spent lots of time in smoke. #2) Moist #3) Great sauce Ordered the side of two ribs and a pulled pork sandwich. Fail on #1 for both. Smoke flavor was not what I consider smokey.  They nailed #2 and #3. Little lacking in the smokey flavor for my taste, but it is what I expect when I go out for BBQ, Beans with the burnt ends are pretty darn good. Potato salad was good. Sweet potato fries and waffle fries are good.  Staff is friendly and the place is kept very clean.  I'll go back for sure.
I normally get the pulled pork and that is absolutely delicious I also recommend the macaroni salad that is very good. This is a great every day barbecue place

Ok first you will pass it at least once, don't give up it is worth it. I saw this place on food network and was like hmmmm let me give it a go... Glad I did! Are you tired of the same old BBQ place, you know the ones don't smell of smoke and the stainless steel is way too clean, and when you taste it the food yep tastes like it was oven cooked! I know, I know we have a few good places but most are not on the north side of town. Well this place smells like the BBQ pits of NC, you know the ones that have wood outback and you walk in and can taste the Que before you taste the meal. Not saying this is NC style but that is where this transports me.  So let's talk staff since they are the heart and soul.. and let me tell you, for the most part these are young folks and maybe first or second job, but they care about this place! They walk you through everything and will make sure they make the best deal for you. You want the fatty piece of brisket you got it, you want the darker piece of sausage you got.   Now the food!! If you get nothing else or you are looking for your last meal get the brisket. It is the best I have and I have it just about everywhere they are known for it. Maybe you don't like brisket, fore shame, but they have you covered with pulled pork, some of the best pulled chicken and smoked sausage. They have great beans, Mac and cheese and corn bread. All around it is top notch.  We order for all adults a family of 6 and we spend less than we do at any fast food and we are full.   Have them cater your next event I am sure you won't be disappointed!!   This is the longest post I have ever written but that is how impressed I am with this place.

It's 1030am right now and I'm drooling for some Pork on a Fork as I write this.  Walk into the restaurant and you are assaulted with the smell of bbq, and like Pavlov's dogs... IMMEDIATELY start drooling.  I just couldn't help but be shocked at how good this place smelled.  I am one of those customers that is led by her nose and these guys had me at hello.  A coworker and I went for lunch during the week... walked in around 1130ish and it was pretty empty for the moment, but there are only five tables in there.  Those tables filled up while we were there.  I ordered the pulled pork sandwich... and fell in love.  I swear, I went to this place on Friday, and it's now Sunday... and I'm considering going back already.  The meat just fell apart.  The pork was so moist and juicy... toss some of the sweet bbq on top and BLAM! You have yourself an excellent lunch. (possibly dinner too, depending on how big your stomach is)  It came with two sides... I got the bbq beans and the sweet potato fries.  The beans are just as high quality as the pork!  They have bits of meat in them...   Hold on... I need a napkin to wipe my mouth as I write this....   *wipe* Ok.  We're good.  Anyway.  The sweet potato fries are thick and moist as well... very sweet, which is excellent.  My coworker had the beef brisket, which was drier, but that's to be expected with brisket.  It was definitely tasty tho.  So I guess these guys are at some farmers markets and stuff... I would check out their website and see if they are anywhere near you, since they are in the north valley.  But you GOTTA try this stuff.  It's off the hook! (pun intended... Guy Fieri has visited here)

I'm from Kansas City and I can tell you this is the best BBQ in town hands down. I've tried just about every BBQ place in the valley the last 10 years that I've lived here and nothing comes close. There beans, bbq sauce and meats are all top notch, but their pulled pork stands out above them all!

An edit from my previous review. This place was probably in the midst of some growing pains where their food quality suffered. But they have made a great turn around since and this is back to being one of the top bbq hole in the walls in north phoenix

The Short: A restaurant that boasts having 'The Valley's best BBQ' but only serves up an uninspired, 'meh.'  The Pros: - It tastes ...... alright. - The back room dining area is clean, comfy, and features three large-screen TVs.  - Orders are brought out pretty fast.  The Cons: - Brisket is as dry as the Phoenix desert.  - No real smoke flavor or spices. - Customer service is often dismal. - Sides don't complement main dishes.  - Majority of meats have a bland mass-produced flavor.   The Best Item(s):  - Coca-cola  - Interesting Fact: BBQs used to be the politician's venue of choice to speak with their constituents. Back in the day, talking with your senator was always accompanied with free food! (Source: BBQ: The History of an American Institution, Robert F. Moss)  _____________________________________________________________  The Story:  I consider myself a BBQ aficionado. I've feasted at several of America's most cherished BBQ Pits from coast to coast and roast to roast. Congress has passed legislation that requires BBQ festival patrons to address me as 'your majesty.' Cows and pigs are afraid to make eye contact with me!  So believe me when I tell you, I know the difference between a good and bad brisket.   Because of such, I take it serious when a restaurant claims to have the best BBQ of a particular locale. Unfortunately, more times than not, these claims are a mix of bravado and marketing. Pork on a Fork happens to be an quintessential example of this phenomenon.   I've been to this outer-beltway Deer Valley location twice and both times ultimately led to me feeling like Mick Jagger (cause I can't get not satisfaction).
