The customer service was not just disengaged with the task at hand, but seemed to have no interest in the customer being there at all. I have tried their pork, brisket, and ribs. All three had the same mass-produced bland flavor that was more reminiscent of fast food than it was masterful BBQ. The brisket was the worst offender, possiblely due to the entire top fat cut off before smoking. The end result, regardless of the reason, was a BBQ sandwich that had the same succulence as a bucket of sand. There are bags of charcoal scattered throughout the restaurant, and I'm sure they're actually used, but a disconnect exists somewhere because it's almost impossible to make anything with such promising beginnings this insipid.  Pork on a Fork has great reviews overall. I find this mind boggling based on my experience but sometimes that's just how it goes. There's always the possibility they were having a bad day during my visits. Cooking is more of an art than a science.  If you're looking for some quick and easy BBQ, stop by. Otherwise it's probably best to go somewhere else.
I believe many of the folks doing reviews on here need to take a trip to Texas to try real barbecue. Their portions are also small here for what you pay.

My advice is to go online and sign up for their reward program (rewardmebaby.com/porkonafork) before you go in to eat, because you will be back!  We went today at an off hour, so there was no waiting. We both sampled the brisket and loved it so that's what we ordered. The meat is hand sliced and weighed right in front of you and it's very moist and tender. For sides I had the mac and cheese and waffle fries and my husband had cole slaw and something else. The mac and cheese was worth ordering again and the fries were good for holding the sauce. There are 3 sauces on the table and the sweet and smoky one was my favorite - i'm a big fan of smoke. Everyone working today was friendly and seemed happy to be there.

Pork on a Fork is easily the best BBQ you can get in the northwest valley. The restaurant is in an unassuming building but the scent of smoked meats lets you know you are in the right place. When you walk in you are met with the meat counter and the easy to read menu board. I would highly recommend getting a sampler which has 3 meats and 2 sides so you can get a good taste of everything the place has to offer. This time around I got the one that features pulled chicken, pulled pork, and a half sausage link. The chicken is by far the best bbq chicken I have ever had and the zippy mustard glaze is the perfect complement to it. The mac and cheese is my favorite side. They top it with some kind of house seasoning that takes it over the top. My meal was just a shade under $12 and will kept me fed all day long.

Unfortunately, it's time once again to drop my rating of what used to be one of my favourite restaurants. If this happened at any other place I'd give it a 1 star and permanently avoid on principle, but because PoaF have pretty much the best barbecue I've ever tasted it'll get a flat 3, accompanied by a giant frown of annoyance.  So what happened? Did the prices increase like they did at Loving Hut? No. Food quality dropped? No. Still cramped as a sardine tin inside with less than a snowball's chance in hell of getting a seat at lunchtime? Well, yes, but that isn't the reason. This time it's due to false advertising. Several weeks ago they came up with the idea of a loyalty card. Buy 5 meals, the sixth is free. Here's my photo of it (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/825nC-s-cQG6Hsul5Gm2cA?select=sSvKMJtwYvgp3PuNafyBsA). Seems pretty obvious how it works, right? Well, last time I was there I reached the free meal marker. I usually get their "Smokin' Meal" menu item - two types of meat, plus two sides and half a sausage. However when I tried to claim the free meal the counter girl informed me that they don't give that particular meal out as free because, quote unquote, "there's so much meat in it". Which equates to about two fistfuls of meat, half a sausage like I said, plus maybe eight ounces in canned baked beans and sweet potato fries. She then tells me that I can get any of the other items on the menu for free, or else she could give me a free drink OR, "say.. three dollars discount". The card didn't say "excludes Smokin' Meal". They brought me there six times and told me the card was frickin next to worthless. Get another menu item for $7 for free, or get $3 off my smokin' meal which is only a couple of bucks more than the items they classify as free? Wow.  I'd have been happy to show up here forever and pay their asking price for a meal. But the fact that they pushed off a loyalty card on me then told me to GFY when I tried to claim on it is rank as hell. Fail, lose two stars, Seacrest out. Oh, Seacrest back in for another ten seconds. Went there today, bought the usual, girl didn't offer me another card or mention the concept at all, left. Still delicious; still pissed at them. Seacrest out again.

I'd seen Pork on a Fork pop up on check-in's for some time now and had been meaning to check it out since I work fairly close by.  The first time I went I had trouble finding the place (even with the warning that it is tucked away).  Heck I came back a week later and had trouble finding it again!  3rd time might be the charm...  I ordered the pulled pork sandwich seeing as that was what was raved about in most reviews (and coming from the name of the restaurant).  The pork was juicy, and the tangy bbq sauce complimented it well.  For sides I got the sweet potato fries and cornbread muffin.  The fries were great, but the muffin was small and tasted more like a vanilla cupcake with a hint of corn.  Next time I swapped the muffin out for the mac n cheese (on recommendation) and wasn't disappointed.  The total for a meal came out to around $10, but you definitely get your money's worth.  After eating here for lunch, eating dinner didn't really seem necessary either time.  In addition to the food sticking with you, I noticed the smell of bbq was ingrained in my clothing for the remainder of the day.  That may come from sitting in the primary seating area that is right by the cookers, maybe sitting in the "overflow" area would prevent that.  Either way, I'll be back!

Yummy.  I stopped in here on my way from Los Angeles to Sedona.  The restaurant is in a small office park near an airport.    -Ordered a mixed sampler plate for about $11.  -pulled pork and brisket were both very good.  As others have noted, they don't put a bunch of sauce on the meat allowing one to really taste the smoky flavor (rather than a sauce).   They do have a nice selection of sauces on the side that you can add yourself. -the meat quality seemed very good. -sweet potato fries are a winner. -checked in on yelp for a free drink.   All in all.. a nice place to stop for lunch.  I'd come back.

Came in for lunch. Moderate line. Staff was friendly and helpful.  Ordered the brisket bowl. Just the right amount of meat. Tender and fall apart. Mac and cheese was delicious. Only issue was it was lukewarm.  Would prefer a tad hotter. Wife had the pork bowl with Mac and cheese and cole slaw. Luckily there was bbq sauce, because the pork was dry.  Not sure if it's the best in the valley, but worth a try.

Brisket and chicken on point. Loved the Mac n cheese too and spicy sauce. Bbq beans were too sweet for my liking and the waffle fries were too heavy like they had breading. I'd love to see a little spice in the beans. Awesome spot - love the chipotle style setup and quick check out.

Stopped by after an appointment in the Northern part of Phoenix. When I first walked in I wasn't sure if it was take out only or more of a butcher place. After reading the sign and peering around the corner to see seating is in back, I decided to order.   The young man serving was very friendly. He suggested the combo so I could try several different items. He also recommended the baked beans and Mac n cheese. His recommendation was spot on. I'm not a huge Mac n cheese fan, but loved theirs - good cheese flavor. Beans were good too.   The combo comes with pork, sausage and chicken. Enjoyed all of them and was thrilled they had watermelon tea. It's rare to find but I love it. There's not a lot of ambiance but the people are friendly and the food is tasty.

The meats are always taste really good and their sauces are exceptional. However the meats always tend to taste a bit dry and almost NEED the sauce... the best BBQ I've ever had was from MA and you had to wait almost an hour for your order. I think the problem here is their Chiptole style setup where they allow the meats to air dry...

I've been craving BBQ for a very long time, saw the awesome reviews & made the drive over here.  Simple menu which I love, helps me narrow my decision down faster ;) I got the chicken sandwich with waffle fries & cornbread, hubby got pulled pork sandwich with waffle fries & macaroni salad.  These are definitely the kind of sandwiches you don't even need sauce on! So flavorful & tender.  Fries were fresh & very crispy but my cornbread was way too sweet, it was almost like dessert to me, eh no biggie.  We will definitely be coming back here soon to try some other meats!

The food was pretty good. It just wasn't HOT enough. This never sits right with me. I also waited 10 minutes looking for help for someone to come from the back to give me a take out box. I was the only customer in store at the time, but they were inattentive. The peach cobbler was NOT good. No real crust, just dry crumble and it was like gelatin thickened peach filling. No thanks. You shouldn't offer subpar desserts. It's better to have none at all. Not in a rush to return.

Too Bad I can only choose a 5 Star!  This place Rocks the Great AMERICAN SPIRIT.. I ordered the Pulled Pork meal and my tummy loved it.  The staff is friendly and they have a cool place out back to eat at with music and TV'S.  I will be back for sure. I noticed other great foods available that I will explore soon enough.   I highly recommend this place to anyone looking for great quality meat.

Not too bad, sort of like a Chipotle but for BBQ, food is very good, service was a tad slow, prices are a tad high. Had the Salad with chicken on top, pretty good but they didn't seem to know what to put on it besides lettuce and chicken. Soft drink prices are insane, $2.25 and RC, no pepsi, no coke, I'll pass, at least they gave me a full size cup for water. Atmosphere is decent . I'll be back...4 stars.

Came here to test out for work as a potential catering option. Had such high hopes, maybe it was a fluke. Co-worker had told me how delicious, moist & tasty the food was when he had it at a wedding-sadly I was let down. Ordered the BBQ Sampler-Deluxe (pulled chicken, pulled pork & brisket). The pulled chicken was dark meat & very tasty to my surprise. The brisket & pulled pork both was dry & bland. With all the meat a dinner roll would have been nice, but no. Baked beans were yummy & peppery. Mac&Cheese was a bit grainy. Workers were really nice, but a bit slow for the lunch time crowd.

Seriously one of the best BBQ places I've eaten at in AZ. Every single one of their meats is money. Used to go for the Midwest Monster (pulled pork, brisket, pepper jack cheese, coleslaw, and crazy js spicy BBQ sauce, delicious) Recently I've changed and started getting their sampler platter. It comes with pulled pork, roasted chicken, and sausage, with 2 sides(for 1.49 you can sub brisket for one of the meats, which I always sub for sausage) and then ask them for some slider rolls to build my own sandwich. Portions are ALWAYS HUGE. Which is perfect for leftovers. Honestly their meats are so flavorful and tender to eat on their own, which I definitely do. But still like alternating with sauce as well.   And what's a BBQ joint without sides? Thy have Some of the best Mac n cheese. Half the reason I go there is because I get a craving for that alone. Which they top off with the base of their secret rub. Their potato and macaroni salad are money, which get the same sprinkling. Baked beans are on point, and their cornbread muffins are amazing. Can't remember the others they have. I usually go with Mac n cheese and potato salad. And I always get a cornbread muffin and happily pay extra for it. I don't say this lightly, but their cornbread is the best I've ever had, period (sorry grandma)   On top of some of the best food out there, the staff is awesome. They are very knowledgeable about their products and happy to suggest things or accommodate any special request, which is rare in food service. Just went in, and the guy at the counter recommended trying their "zippy mustard glaze" I was hesitant since I had never tried mustard anything on BBQ, and their crazy js spicy BBQ sauce is so good. But I told him I'd try it, and can honestly say I'm glad I did. Because as  of right now, I'm currently alternating dipping between the two. So good.   Top it all off, throw in a celebrity chef endorsement by Guy Fieri and you got yourself a winning combination ;)
The place is filthy dirty. All surfaces, floors, walls and condiment bottles a mess.  Pork OK, but sides flavorless. No recommendation here and won't be back.

After a little hiatus, Foodie Friday resumed yesterday and BBQ was the pick and it was delicious! My friend and I shared the platter where we could try 4 types of meat. Chicken, brisket, sausage and pulled pork. As for sides we tried potato salad, macaroni salad, mac n cheese and cornbread. My favorite was the brisket and mac n cheese. Delicious and worth a repeat visit!
Amazing food, huge portions, amazing staff and kids eat free on Mondays. What else can you ask for!?!?

I stopped by to pick up some lunch to bring home for the family. The experience was good but not quite as good as I remembered. They were out of pork. When the item is in your name, you should probably make more of an effort. I bought some corn breads which were roundly criticized by my family. The guy who helped me could not answer some pretty basic questions and did not seem particularly well-trained. Chicken was excellent and brisket was okay (C+). Mostly I feel like this place is a closed club for guys. There is very little direction or help. Seems like they only want their regulars and by that I mean men who are there all the time and know the drill.

Yummy!!! Hubby and I tried the monster sampler plate with mac & cheese and baked beans, beans had a spicy flavor in them...awesome!!! Pork was out of this world with great smoked flavor, brisket was perfect!! There wasn't a negative thing about our experience honestly everyone working there was so friendly- even bought one of their tshirts!! Must try it's worth the drive!!!

Couldn't tell you how the bbq is as they were out of ribs at 6:30p when they close at 8. But hey they will have ONE rack available in 30min if you're in the area. Looks like the other reviews were right, I'll stick to naked bbq.
Oooh sweet lord baby jeezus I love this bbq! And omg the mac and cheese my mouth is watering as I type!

First time trying. Great portion of pulled pork - tender and juicy. The BBQ Beans are VERY good. The potato salad was bland but not awful. I wasn't impressed with their sauces but mixing the spicy with the smokey gave me something acceptable. The mustard based glaze was good but I'll have to try that one something else next time.  And there will be a next time. The staff was great. The hole-in-the-wall places are usually good. Oh yeah, bring your own plastic spoon! You'll want it to get every drop of those beans!

I'm a bit gluten sensitive, so stayed away from the sandwiches and wraps. Decided on the Big Boy Sampler: Brisket, Pulled Pork, Pulled Chicken and Sausage. All were great, but the Chicken and Sausage was extra-ordinary! Staying away from the gluten and heavy carbs, I went with the slaw. Only good, but I'll probably get it again.   Taking a star away... the ecologist in me doesn't like all the paper containers used to measure the meat out. Styrofoam and plastic take-out (and dine in) containers - I wish there was something else.

I went to the farmer's market in Old Town with a friend this morning.  I wanted to bring home something for husband to eat and he really loves pulled pork so I went with POAF.  The gentleman running the stand was really friendly and helpful.  I got a pulled pork sandwich a bag of chips and water for $7.  I got him a side of the spicy BBQ sauce to go with it.  He LOVED it.  At first he was kind of unhappy I woke up him at 10:00 am but after he saw what I brought him he changed his tune!  He said it was one of the best pulled pork sandwiches he'd ever had and the BBQ sauce was delicious.  The pork was juicy and had a nice smoke flavor, it wasn't overpowering it was just right.  We will be going to the restaurant to check out the full menu.
Everything here is so delicious. I would highly recommend the Midwest sandwich paired with any side. I personally like the macaroni salad and beans.  Expect a wait at almost any time of the day.

I tried Pork on a Fork at the ASU Tempe farmers market. Beef brisket and pulled pork sandwiches were sold there in a small tent.  My sandwich (brisket) was very tasty, albeit a little plain (just meat and bread). There were three great BBQ sauces available - sweet/mild, tart, and spicy. I used a lot of all three, but spicy was the best. I felt like I could drink those sauces!  At $6-8, the sandwiches are a little pricey, but they are filling and taste excellent. It would be nice if they came with some corn, beans, or the like to round out the meal.

I ordered food for my friend and I online 5/9/18 and we had been talking about dining here for months now. That said, I placed a carry out order and she picked it up Wednesday (last night). We both ordered ribs and a couple sides. The ribs were inedible. They claim to have the "best bbq in the valley", this is far from best. I should have taken it back.
This place is wonderful. It has a different feel then the deer valley location but both locations are equally awesome.
Fantastic! My favorite is the pork with extra pickles, waffle fries, and mac n cheese! I would recommend this place to anyone. Meat is always cooked to perfection.

I went for the first time this week and enjoyed the food. The brisket was a bit dry (normal for brisket) by delicious with bbq sauce! The chicken was mediocre, not bad just not great. It had a strong chicken flavor to it and not much else. The pulled pork was delicious! I was disappointed in the size of the cornbread vs the other sides. The mac and cheese was an appropriate portion and delicious. My girlfriend loved the macaroni salad. She orders a sandwich with two meats. Unfortunately, the girls forgot to put the bread in! Not the worst mistake in the world but very disappointing when you want a sandwich. We will likely give them a try again. Next time I would probably try the ribs and get more brisket/pulled pork.

You can tell these guys like what they do. Food is prepared nicely and they are a fast casual type of place. The lunch crowd fills this place pretty regularly but I want to come in at night to try a rack of ribs next. I had the brisket sandwich and it did not disappoint!

I have eaten their food before at special events and decided to give their restaurant a try. I have lived in Texas and eaten at plenty of BBQ places as I travel for work. I would say the POAF is really good BBQ. I usually judge BBQ by their brisket because it is either good or bad with nothing in between. The brisket was very tender with a nicely spiced thick bark. The pulled pork was good but a bit on the dry side. Sausage and chicken were also very good.I would recommend them as one of the best BBQ places in Phoenix.
Best BBQ in North Phoenix.  Sauce isn't the best  but the pork, brisket, and chicken are Wonderful without any.  The mac n cheese is a must get side.  Baked beans are good too.  Love this place

Stopped in Saturday afternoon and ordered the BBQ bowl with pork, mac & cheese and cole slaw.  Such a great combination...warm, cold, soft, crunchy.  I added their mustard-based sauce on top.  Also ordered a smoked sausage..just the right amount of spice and snap.  The place looks great and the staff was very friendly.  They also brew a variety of iced teas....loved the watermelon tea.
Wow, that is some great BBQ.  Probably the best I have had in Arizona.  The pork was great as were the BBQ beans.  I will be there again and again!

I am the odd man out in that I am not a big meat fan. Had heard about POAF on Yelp and had driven by a lot of times before. I was getting pretty excited thinking about BBQ chicken though.   I had no problem finding it because they have a little sign at the entrance to the complex. There isn't much parking though. I took forever to decide what to order but finally got the sampler for hubby with pork, sausage, and brisket. I ordered the chicken sandwich myself. We got cornbread, Mac n' cheese, beans, and cole slaw for our sides. I took samples of three sauces to go.   My favorite ended up being the brisket, and I don't even like red meat! Hubby actually loved my chicken the most. I was pretty impressed with their Mac n'cheese. I would eat it and I am super picky about Mac n'cheese.   You come for the BBQ though, and it doesn't disappoint. We had to go back the next night it was so good. That brisket with its deeply smokey flavor and its perfect smoke ring! Definitely the best BBQ I have ever had.

What a meal, definitely a stick to your ribs ( no pun intended) kind of meal. Had the mac and cheese base w/ corn, bbq beans. Then topped it off with the brisket and cole slaw. The brisket was tender and smoky and delish. Could only eat half of my bowl, so a good deal for alot of food!!! Well done "Pork on a Fork", see you soon!!!!
I came here because someone reportedly said that this place has the best man n cheese in the valley. That claim has been confirmed.
The food is awesome--all of it. We ordered for 20 people and got 2 family meals, and salads--it was plenty!! Hot and delicious!
Excellent ribs, great sauce, sides were good too.  Located in a storefront, nothing fancy, but excellent food. We will return.

I walked in and didn't have a clue what I wanted, but the guy behind the counter recommended the brisket and walked me through the options (bowl, burrito, sandwich, etc). I went with the brisket burrito, and when he cut the brisket I could see the juices pouring off it. It was the most tender and juicy piece of brisket I've ever had. I want to try the pork, chicken, and polish dog too, but it'll be hard to pass up the brisket.  The layout of the place is a little unconventional because it's in a business park, but the seating area was clean and they had the Dbacks game on (always a bonus).

Came here with my family and friends. It's been along time since I have eaten here. The rest of my family has not been here so I wanted to show them how good it was. The place was clean inside unlike other reports and food was very good as it has been in the past. We will be back again also I want to let it be known that the service and all the staff were very nice, caring and out going.

Excellent BBQ. I got the sampler and the meats were tender and moist, especially the brisket. Sweet & Mild sauce was my favorite of the sauces. Mac & Cheese was particularly good too. This place is comparable to the authentic Texas BBQ I'm used to and I will definitely be back. Employee Ashley was very friendly and helpful in explaining the menu and helping me decide what to try.
My brisket and ribs were as dry as a bone! Needed to was every bite down with my drink.
Been a couple times and besides it being packed at lunch the food and people were great!

Tried this place for the first time. The guy who took my order was rude and slow. The place looks dirty and all employees grossed me out. Meat was fatty and Cole slaw had zero flavor. Only reason I gave it two stars instead of one is the Mac and cheese was good. Don't bother visiting.

My brother introduced me to POTF couple of weeks ago. I was hooked. Took my friend there last week now he is hooked. Food is truly out of this world and BBQ is not even my favorite food .. Pizza is. Will go here again and bring more friends with me next time.

What shall  I tell you first? Another great strip mall non descript place hidden in an industrial area. I do have to say they did a great job making the restauarant look clean , inviting and very functional for a very small space.  I definitely will be back ...love the smoky flavor of the meat, sweet and throughly washing the meat with flavor  and the sweet pink ring  that makes the meat  and you know its the real  smoky deal. they have lots of choices of sauces but it was juicy and flavorful enough that I could have eaten it without sauce. The flavors were great  all around even my daughter's waffle fries was really tasty. We loved the smoky sweet white BBQ beans. Our friends Paul and Paula ( see Paul I mentioned you ...now write your own darn review)  had brisket and a tasty smoked sausage which looked great and the bites I had were delicious.   Prices are very reasonable and the service was perfect.    Look for them at local farmers markets , Friday night dinners (prime and ribs mmm)  and hopefully a bigger site s I can bring my friends.

I've been here a few times. The beef brisket and a drink costs $12. The taste is average at best. I would suggest serving this dish without the bun and put the bbq sauce on the meat. Instead of letting the customer squeeze some sauce out of a bottle.  The bratwurst is ok and the pulled pork is average, nothing that really blows you away. The seating at lunch is crowded and somehow needs to be re-configured with maybe a couple of dueces instead of all 4 seat tables. That way the single diners don't take up all the 4 spots.

You can't see this place from the road since it's hidden in a business mall across from the Deer Valley Airport. This is a very casual order at the counter kind of place and your food quickly gets ran to you.  I tried the smoked chicken and was expecting it to be pulled BBQ Chicken but instead it was two chicken thighs. The chicken was very moist and tender with a careful gentle light smoke flavor. I thought it was very good and didn't really need any sauce but I had to try one of the assorted sauces on the table for fun. This plate comes with two sides I tried the cole slaw and it seemed very fresh, was sort of sweet but it was drip free so I thought that was good. I also tried the macaroni and cheese, it was seasoned nicely and was familiar like what you eat at a picnic.  My husband tried the Monster that was described to us as brisket and pulled pork with two sides. It however is a sandwich of the two meats together topped with coleslaw. Like the smoked chicken I had the meat in this sandwich isn't all sauced up but you can use the assorted sauces on the table if you care too. My husband did like the sandwich and said it was very good but would order something different next time because he's been here before and liked the regular plates better. He said the beans here are very porky.   The staff thanked us for coming as we were leaving.

Unassuming business park location knocks it out of the park with competition style BBQ.    You may ask yourself "What does competition style BBQ really mean?", you won't find ribs that fall off the bone, dainty plating or complex flavor profiles BUT what you will find is high grade meat, cooked to perfection with a down home side dishes and menu options using fresh alternatives.  This BBQ Joint brings a wicked burrito stuffed with beans, cheese and whatever kind of meat you want (Pork, Beer or Chicken) or go with the Midwest Monster, a BBQ sandwich piled high.  For those looking for more traditional BBQ fare, order the Pulled Pork or Brisket Sandwiches or just go with a half-rack of the killer pork ribs.  Ambiance in straight forward as the space is a converted business park location, but that doesn't mean it doesn't feel good.  Lots of BBQ posters, farm pictures and contest memorabilia let you know these guys take their food seriously.  Ample seating in the back room and the staff is friendly, knowledgeable and very approachable. Great value for the amount of food you get per order, but the best is buying bulk pounds either take-out or eat picnic style at your table.  Good mixture of POAF branded sauces which add another layer to the wonderful taste of fresh BBQ and quality meats..  Keep up the great work guys and gals!

Had their brisket for lunch.  It was very tender and had good flavor.  My friend had the pork sandwich.  It was lean and good portions too.  I really like their sauces, though their meat doesn't really need it.    PRO:  great BBQ, good portions, good selection of sides, friendly service  CON: It's a little on the expensive side.  $12 for lunch? Really?  Meh, it was worth it :-)  Can't wait to go back and try something else on the menu.

Only tried their lunch menu so far.  $11.47 for Brisket sandwich, 2 sides and their smallest soda(size=large) + tax.   Great brisket, fair prices, and generous portions.  Very tasty and stands well without the sauce.  I found the Smokey sauce the best flavor of the three offered but it also tastes a bit too salty.  I found I enjoyed lunch without the sauce and that is exactly how it is served - saucless.  My two sides were the Sweet Potatoe Fries and Potato Salad.  Both were 2 thumbs up but you get more fries than potato salad.  If quantity counts, then weigh that in.  Lunch was a bit crowded and seating was tough to come by.  Every server there seemed concerned that we would enjoy our visit.  Bottom line: I'll be back and it is worth seeking out.  Really want to try their Pork next!  PS - Gotta pay attention to find it.  Look for the coffee shop facing Deer Valley Road, with the Green sign that mimics Starbucks. PoF is located adjacent and behind that.

My coworkers went here for lunch. Last time they went they said the food was great. This time, we all agreed it was disappointing. I had the bbq bowl and the Mac n cheese was awfully bland. It was more like Mac and a touch of butter. The lemonade was super watery as well. I'm sure it can be better than this, but if I'm paying $10+ for my meal, it shouldn't be a hit or miss experience.

When this place first opened, the food was "off the charts" good. Slowly over the years though, it has slid considerably. Really is too bad, They had some amazing food... Recently, I've had a couple bad experiences and I'm just no longer a fan. My family and I love good BBQ and are disappointed by what's happening.

Just writing a review about Pork on a Fork makes my mouth water. Best BBQ I've had in years and hands down best since moving to Arizona. The food is absolutely amazing and service seems to be pretty good as well (have only ordered take out but they resolved an issue quickly and painlessly when something was left out of our order). Only complaint I have is the online ordering isn't 100% clear and doesn't mirror the menu online but the amazing food made me forget all about that. If you're getting take out on a Friday night, order early. Wait has ranged from one to two  hours - 100% worth the wait.

Sigh...I'm bummed I have to rate a local business 3 stars.  Was looking for BBQ off the highway as we were headed on a road trip and came across this place. I tried to order online but couldn't complete the order for whatever reason. So, I called and was greeted by a friendly employee who took my order. She initially said it would take 15-20 min, but said 10 when she heard we were coming up the highway. (Didn't request faster service, but it was a nice gesture).   I get there a few minutes after the time and they hadn't started on the food. Okay...well, maybe they had a weird rush at 3:30 on a Tuesday.   Then, one of the employees informed me that one of the sides (salad) was several days past its expiration. It was the only one they had. Boo, but yay! that they actually pay attention to their expiration dates. But it does seem kind of odd that it wasn't just yesterday it expired, that they ran out,  and hadn't replenished. But...oh well, not meant to be healthy today.   We get our order around the 20 min mark (which is the length the employee initially said it would take) and hit the road. However, once we dig in (BBQ burritos is an awesome travel idea!) we see that they didn't get our order right, the mac and cheese noodles seemed...hard, and the fries didn't seem fresh.   If we give this place a second chance and it turns out great, I absolutely will update the rating. But for now, 3 is all I can give.
I absolutely love the brisket sandwich & Mac & cheese & Cornbread. Always order the same thing!

I love this place but we could not get any food! The assembly line sucks. The lady responsible for serving the meat is very slow . We waited in line for almost 30 minutes and the cashiers had to wait for people as we waited for the meat lady to serve the food. We had to leave because we had 8 people in front of us and the line had not moved. it was 12:30 we left at 1:00. Management needs to review there process. other BBQ restaurants have the concept down ... it's not the size of your kitchen it's your set up. you have so many employees watching one person serve meat.. we saw 3 plus the 2 cashiers. Food is amazing ..... your line set up is all wrong.

... good place to get good BBQ.  Our daughter is in the "don't feed me anything but mac and cheese" phase and she looooves their Mac and cheese! Location is rough since it's placed in more of an industrial type facility. Worth looking for.

Brace yourself for the most "Texas" tasting Bbq in town!! 4 different types of sauce to top it all off. Our family has just adopted the sweetest manager Jake as he whipped out a quarter to satisfy our 5 year olds "dessert" treat as a finale of the best dinner ever event!! Yeehaw hubbie from Houston is Finally satisfied!! Ps mac n cheese is a kid pleaser.  We'll be regulars no doubt.  Sounds  like they are going to be growing too hooray!! Thanks so much boys for the great smiles and warm service.

The food was very good! I really enjoyed the pulled pork and beef brisket! I would have to say that it was absolutely finger lickin' goodness! All of the valley must try, it was well worth a 35 mile drive!!! Best in the valley! The Mac-n-cheese was cheesy heaven too! Great staff and wonderful customer service! Tatiana was extremely helpful in assisting me in my meal choices! YUMMY!!!

Although the food is pretty good, I can't get over how slow service is and it makes me wonder if they have the right people working behind the counter.  I stopped in today to get my lunch to go. I figured it would be an in and out type deal. WRONG. I stood in line for about 20 minutes (there was 3 or so people in front of me) while the first guy behind the counter who loads the meat on to the plate seemed to move slower than a sloth. Not to mention that his hair was completely covering his face making it next to impossible for him to see. He kept swinging and flipping all his hair around trying to make it so he could at least see a little something (don't think it helped). I sat there and watched him do it, dreading the fact I'll probably be seeing a hair of his in my food... I feel like he was the hold up for the entire line...everyone else seemed to be a bit quicker. Maybe they need to rethink having that guy there at the front.
We orders two salads, $10 a piece expected some thing pretty hearty. It was like a dinner salad with a little meat on it. Total waste of money. If your hungry go somewhere else.

Writing this after my second visit:   Food is pretty good, but the service needs attention! Hoping the owners and/or mgmt read and address the following. I live within walking distance, and bbq is one of my favorite foods.  My 3rd visit will be make or break for this place.    1st visit, March 2016: They were open approx 2-3 weeks, we had a party of 5 adults and 2 young kids.  I think our bill was around $70.  After leaving, we all agreed the staff was the worst part of the visit: lack of attention, lackadaisical attitude toward customers, less-than-professional counter attendents, we were generally not impressed.  When we ordered, 3 of us ordered mac-n-cheese for our sides.  The kid behind the counter said "We've run out, we're making another batch now and it will be ready in 5 minutes".  That's understandable, no big deal.  We sat down.  There were approximately 3 other tables of customers there, so not busy by any means, and we were the largest group at that time.  We sat within sight of the cash register.  20 minutes later, as I was finishing up my Pulled Pork sandwich, I decided to get up and ask the guy if our mac-n-cheese sides were ready yet.  He said "Oh yes" and asked how many I needed, to which I replied "3", and he handed them right over.   Why didn't they bring them to our table when they were ready?  Did he really forget how many orders were needed for the item that they were out of?  Wouldn't this be a priority for them?   Anyway, at least we thought our food was tasty.  We chalked up the oversight to new employees and a new restaurant.    2nd visit:  3 months later.  We arrived at 11:20am, they open at 11.  Guy 1 stood behind the cash register, I'm not sure what he was doing, but he had no customers at that moment.  There was one table of customers already seated and eating.  Guy 2 was putting together an order right in front of the 3 of us.  We were looking at the menu for a minute or so, but about 4 to 5 minutes passed before anyone acknowledged us.  We saw the line cook throw a large bag of frozen waffle fries from the cold storage to the countertop (fresh - never frozen?).  Finally Guy 2 took our order.  Then Guy 1 rang us up.  Bill was $48 including the 15% tip I left (which sort of irks me - because nobody brings your meal to the table or waits on you - the staff does nothing more than a McDonalds employee does. I'm happy to leave (and usually at least) a 20% tip when wait staff does what they're supposed to do.)  These guys were nice enough, but both acted like they'd rather be somewhere else.  I then went to get my drink - and the floor between the soda fountain and the tea was completely sticky as if some kid had spilled a soda... but there were no kids inside and they had only been open 20 minutes.  Kinda gross... and inattentive especially considering Guy 1 wasn't doing anything for the first 4-5 minutes we were in the store, not to mention he was standing only 4 feet from the sticky mess.  ??  I might expect that at Peter Piper... but not at a place like this.  Anyway, again, our food was at least tasty.  And then my buddy (who I was taking to lunch), unprovoked, made a comment at the table to the effect of "the staff sure isn't helping this place at all".  Which is my entire point... there are too many restaurants in this area to choose from to spend that sort of money and feel like the staff could care less if you were even there.  I was hoping they'd have the staff ironed out 3 months into being opened.  I'll try again next month I guess.     Bottom line: good food, lousy staff.  Pork on a fork - you're soooo close to being my "go-to".

Food is great. We have eating here for about 3 yrs. a little disappointed, they charge extra now for some of their sides they call "premium " like their mac-n-cheese (which is fabulous) and they have reduced the size of their sides. A bit expensive for what you get. You won't be disappointed in the food.

Gonna try the pulled pork, It was probably the best thing on the menu! Although i didn't anything else.   Had lunch here with some co-workers. One had the full rack baby back ribs. It looked good, other had the ultimate lunch (it came with a little bit of everything). They said the pulled pork was the best thing. I had the pulled pork. The pork was good. The BBQ sauce was a little weak, wish they had something more spicey. But i would go again just to have the pulled pork sandwich.

Pretty good barbecue  Overall, Pork on a Fork was exactly what I would expect. The food was good and everyone left happy.  Pork on a fork offers five different sauces, from mild and sweet to smoky and spicy, including a mustard-based sauce, which was pretty good. On this visit find lunch Companions and I I had the pulled pork sandwich, a brisket burrito, chicken, coleslaw, cornbread, and macaroni and cheese.  All of our entrees were  tasty and I really had no complaints, other than I'm really not a fan of bbq.  The sauce selection was good, the cole slaw was not overly sweet though underseasoned, the macaroni and cheese , waffle fries, were all okay.  If you're in the area, and enjoy bbq, check out pork on a fork you won't be disappointed.
Great store and staff good job Camelback store !!! Great bbq the staff was awesome! Reminds me of Texas BBq!!! Good job guys! And gals!
Enjoyed the bbq pork sandwich and the ambience of the place. Staff are friendly and is a clean, Neat place, good food... I'll be back

Great sandwich with a choice of 4 different sauces on the table.....the side orders included were well sized and very tasty!  The mac and cheese was my favorite.  I didn't notice any desserts.......they need something to compliment the bbq like a key lime pie or something.

Stopped in for dinner. Got the mix combination brisket, chicken, and pork. Brisket and chicken were good. Pork was ok, nothing special. The sides were mac and cheese and corn bread. I would recommend not using corn bread as a side. You get 1 small muffin and it was dry. My opinion you pay more and get less not only on quantity but taste as well. The bbq sauces stood out the most in my meal. Vinegar based. Tangy and spice.

So disappointing. The most disappointing part was the service. It was fine that they didn't have ribs, but the cashier was deliberately unhelpful and unfriendly. It turns out the ribs were about 15 minutes way from being finished. Sure wish they would have mentioned that because we would have waited. Then they failed to clarify whether we wanted a plate or sandwich. When the brisket came out chopped up on a terrible, soggy, cold bun, I was so bummed out. Apparently I'm not the only one to have had this problem. Right before I was about to send mine back, another customer took hers back to the counter saying she had wanted a plate and not a sandwich. They dumped the meat off the bun onto the plate, threw away the bun, and handed her back the plate. God.  The coleslaw was watery, the Mac and Cheese was dried out and the sauce was broken. The waffle fries were fine.   I would have gone back to this place, but the service was intolerable. What a waste of a meal and money.
Stopped in Christmas Eve while I was doing last minute shopping. So happy to see they have beer now! Everything was still really good, and the staff was friendly too.

Still love their product, but their online ordering process just doesn't work.  First time, my order was sent to the wrong market.  Second time, I was shorted a package of chops.  I checked the bag before I left the market, so it was only a minor inconvenience.  Third time I ordered bacon, which was listed as available on the web site, and then contacted and advised it was not and may not be available for a few weeks.  Since I paid upon ordering, I had to go through the hassle of waiting for a refund.  I've also noticed inconsistency in portion size which is a problem considering you pay by product, rather than pound.  Boneless chops should be roughly 6-oz each, yet I've received 4-oz chops at times, resulting in 50% less product for the same price.  Not a deal breaker for me, but something to consider.  I continue to purchase from these guys regularly, but no longer try to order ahead.  And I do wish they would have bacon available more often!

This place is all about the smoked meat.  The rating is for that AND the stellar service from friendly people who clearly love serving up the best dang smoked meat in the city and take a lot of pride in it.  (Amanda really went out of her way to welcome us and share her fantastic special, which was chicken taquitos).  The atmosphere is not dirty or smelly so I can't really call it a "dive."  But, it isn't glamorous (see my first sentence).  You are coming here for the smoked meat that your brother-in-law believes he makes (but can't).  Just get in here and bring your appetite because this beef brisket is ridiculously good.  The chicken, pulled chicken, and sausage were all amazing -even without sauce - but, make sure you get the brisket!

Had an amazing experience tonight! Food was outstanding! Great service by Tracy and Raul. And I love the hot barbeque sauce! The pork didn't stay on my fork for very long, I kept shoveling it in my mouth!!
Awesome.  Pick your meat, sides.  4 awesome sauces at the table.  Got the deluxe sampler. Chicken, pork and brisket. BBQ beans are good and some great potato salad.

I've been coming this place for the last year and I've generally liked it but the last time was probably my last time going there my son and I went my son had the pulled pork sandwich I had the Midwest monster and I'm not sure if it was the girl behind the counter whoever made it not sure but the girl behind the counter seemed very new kind of didn't know what she was doing and when I got home after spending 13 dollars my sandwich alone it was all fat complete fat so I will never go back. Hate giving certain barbecue place has bad reviews but that topped the cake
Meat was very greasy and fatty. Sides were very small and forgettable.

The customer service was very good. The food LOOKED amazing and SMELLED amazing but the flavor was just meh.   The food was pretty bland and the pulled pork and brisket were dry. The smoked sausage looked and tasted overcooked. The macaroni and cheese could have benefited from a better blend of cheeses and the sprinkling of red pepper on top was unnecessary. The sweet potato fries were awesome, but it's pretty hard to mess up sweet potato fries.   Compared to BBQ that I've had in the past (Jim n' Nicks, Famous Dave's, Rudy's and Slick Pig (in Murfreesboro, TN)) this is definitely the lowest on the totem pole to me.

Awesome friendly service and delicious food.  The waffle fries are great and pulled pork is lean and tasty! My side salad was crisp and fresh. They have 4 different bbq sauces. I Highly recommend this place!

Most of the places that I have gone to using a groupon are either okay to horrible.  That is probably why they are on groupon.  So I tend to stay away from groupon, except if they advertise for a place I have been wanting to try.  Groupon worked out in this case.    Hubby had the pulled pork and I had the brisket sandwich.  Both came with a side of mac n cheese, waffles fries, and corn bread.  Everything was very good except the cornbread.  The pulled pork was a tad dry but it was still tasty.  The price for everything was actually kinda expensive without a groupon.  Location is very unassuming.  Its hidden in a industrial area near the Deer Valley airport.  When you walk in, it looks like there is no seating except for 3 small tables, but if you walk to the back past the bathrooms, there is more.  I most likely will be back with or without a groupon.

The meat was very well cooked but I couldn't really tell the pork from the chicken. I was rather disappointed with the barbecue sauces. This is not the place to come if you expect your barbecue to come off the grill.  The sides we chose were good -side salads (two choices for dressing), Cole slaw,  baked beans. The service was on the slow side. It was clean, and not too noisy. Overall, other than trying something new, I probably won't return here in the foreseeable future.

i will admit i am not a total bbq connoisseur or anything but have had some great bbq in texas. this place had REALLY good ribs and sausage. the rest, i wasn't super crazy about, but that probably doesn't mean anything since it's not like i really know what good brisket should taste like. i thought the pulled pork needed sauce. i don't remember much about the chicken. i did like the bbq sauce choices though. and the sides were solid. i 100% will be going back for some ribs - YUM!!

Without Yelp and GPS, you'd probably never find this place. It's hidden behind a coffee bar in an industrial office park. They clearly have a strict sign ordinance in Phoenix, because there is no visible signage to this place.   The best & biggest pulled pork sandwich I've ever had is from 2-Paul's in Lafayette, Louisiana. Pork on a Fork is a close second. If 2-Paul's is a 10 for flavor, PoF is an 8.5. For size, 2-Paul's being a 10, PoF is an 11. 2-Paul's PP sandwich is huge...but at PoF, I watched the guy plop a load onto the sandwich that would have been the limit at most places, and then he proceeded to drop an even bigger load on top of that. This thing was monstrous. I also ordered 2 ribs (for 3 bucks extra). They were about 1/3 the size of 2-Paul's ribs, but tasty none the less.  I tried 3 different sauces: sweet & mild, hot, and crazy j's (the guy loading the sandwich said it was his favorite). Well, I'm glad I took the recommendation, because it was the best of the 3 sauces.  Now that I've eaten all that stuff, I'm going to have to go to sleep. I'll have to sleep on my back, though. I'll pop if I roll over.

The brisket was worth the trip! It was flavorful and had a nice smoke ring to it. There was not much fat on it, and they were nice thick cuts. The pork was very moist, but I just wasn't tasting all the flavor I was expecting.  The restaurant itself was low key, but I really liked the seating area in the back. It is set up in a garage area, and is just something different. Their barbeque  sauce selection has everything you could want. I found that a mixture of the sweet with the smokey was the flavor for me.    The only thing I would have liked would have been to order a quarter pound of one of the meats instead of having to get a half or whole pound. I was hoping to try a couple of different things but I didn't want to have to order another half pound of meet.  Overall I it was good and I will be going back there at some point.

I've had a hankering for Pulled pork a lot recently and had never tried this restaurant so I decided to stop in for sandwiches to go.  The location is a little hard to find and could use a bit more signage coming from the east on Deer Valley. As I walked in what struck me were the floors, I know I won't be eating off them but the concrete looked dirty and stained and it set a tone for me.   The sides were average, and they have a nice selection of good barbecue sauces. The pulled pork sandwiches were good, but fairly pricey. It's not my go-to spot, but is a great little place with friendly employees and a good location.

We enjoyed really good barbecue today. Hubby said that it made his top ten. Shared ribs and brisket and Mac n' Cheese, Potato Salad, Mac Salad and Coleslaw. 3 choices of sauce: Hot, Smokey and Sweet. I was not happy that when cutting my brisket the server got to the crusty heel, paused knowing that he shouldn't serve the piece but did so anyway. And yes I did ask for and receive a new portion.  Dine in is located in what would be the warehouse and shop of this industrial suite and this is where I knock off stars. Not because of the location but because of the "amenities". Long tables with dried on sauce, filthy dispensers for plastic forks and knives, a sloppy, disgusting garbage can, and one smelly bathroom.   I think the owners need to spend some time acting like they are customers so that they can realize our experience. Your hands are sticky with sauce and your only option is to wait for the one bathroom to clear, get knocked in the face with the fumes from the person before you (who for some reason left the seat up) just so you can wash your hands. Even the door is filthy. Clean all of the bathroom and provide wet wipes would be a great place to start.

OMG! I'm no BBQ expert, but this place is by far the best BBQ I've had in Phoenix. Beans cooked with the burnt meat ends in them? Oh! they are the bomb!!!!! The only disappointing thing was the lemonade. When I asked about it, they directed me to the drink fountain. If all you serve is Minutemaid Lemonade, don't put that as a separate item on your menu. Come on man!

I have tried as many different places for BBQ as I could, looking for something that would do the trick. I was sorely disappointed for several years until FINALLY, Pork on a Fork popped up and around the corner from work, no less. This is BY FAR the best BBQ in the Valley. HANDS DOWN. Don't go anywhere else because you'll just be wasting your time and taste buds.  No matter where you live in the Valley, it is def worth the drive to come eat here. Just look out for the little flag on Deer Valley because you can easily miss it, being in the industrial park where it is. Over the past year, I tried everything on the menu and was never disappointed. Literally, everything is great! Tender meat, delicious sauces (I would bathe in the Crazy J's sauce), and awesome sides. Now that I no longer live in AZ, I miss this place dearly, so I had to come on here to show some love.   Why haven't you gotten in your car to head over already?! Seriously, go there NOW! You won't be disappointed.

I would describe this place as like the Great Value brand of Rudy's. Yummy barbecue and southern vibe to it. The macaroni salad and potato salad is AWESOME. The best I've had in the north Valley. Portions are filling and there are like six different choices of barbecue sauce, all deliciois. This is a fun place to stop with family and friends. Brisket and shredded pork is juicy and full of flavor, I recommend it!

Friendly staff, clean decent atmosphere but I'm from Texas and the food did not meet my standards for good BBQ. Not to say it's bad. The meat was tender but I'd prefer Dickey's over this place. The favors were off. The sauces were too sweet for me, the Mac and cheese had pasty cheese, and the rice was a bit too dry and bland.

We were looking forward to trying this place, were bummed to be disappointed. I found three LARGE chunks of sharp bone in my pulled pork sandwich. Got pork sliders off the kids menu for my son and most of the pork was a few cuts of super fatty pork, so thick I could barely cut it with the plastic fork. When we let them know about the bone they replaced their pork shoulder and offered us another sandwich and sides. The guy was very apologetic. Not sure if we'll give it another go or not. Appreciate he tried to make it better.

Loved the boneless pork chop too! They are small, but appropriate serving size (a little bit bigger than a deck of cards when cooked). I just lathered with Trader Joe's garlic mustard aoli and grilled for a few minutes. It was delicious tender and juicy!

"I can't just give you free food" My wife told me how amazing your food is. Her work has it catered often. My first visit to Pork on a fork was amazing due to the quality of their food. The chicken, pork, sausage and beef sampler was amazing. I tried the zesty and mild sauces and both were delicious. My wife placed an online order for the Deluxe Big Boy. We get to the location and Paige let's us know that the double sides are actually only single and we'd have to pay for additional sides. I make the comment that I just want what I paid for and she quickly responded with "I can't just give you free food" in a very defensive tone. Why didn't management just fix this glitch? So Paige tells us the sides are $1.50 so we pay an additional $3.24 to complete our already paid for order. My wife and I finally get away on a staycation and I refused to let something like this get to me. Any other day I would have asked for management and walked out with my double sides as mentioned online without an additional charge! This glitch prints out on the receipt too!!! Get with the web designer. Easy, hassle free fix!

It is very hard to find decent BBQ in Phoenix. We heard about this place from some friends so we thought we would check it out. I had the Pulled Pork sandwich with Mac 'n Slaw. BBQ staples in my opinion. If you cant get that right then don't  bother. I was very pleased with the result. The Pork was cooked to perfection. The Mac 'n Slaw were both excellent. Only thing we did not care for was the restaurant itself. It is in a business park and looks like it used to be a mechanics shop or something. But the ambiance is the only reason for 4 stars instead of 5. We would go back for sure.

Main Dish: Pulled Pork sandwich  Sides: Mac & cheese & sweet potato fries Drink: Sweet Tea   Pulled pork was bigger pieces than most pulled pork that is stringy. Bread for sandwich was amazing & fluffy. Comes with no sauce, you can add the one you like from the tables. Cooked just right.   Sides were amazing! Everyone does Mac and cheese different & I loved this one. They even shake some seasoning on it as they serve it which adds great flavor. SP Fries were perfection....seasoned and cooked just right!   Sweet tea was still warm so melted the ice but had good flavor!  I will be back next time I am in AZ! Keep up the great BBQ! Ps you know when cops and paramedics are eating there that it's good & they were ;)

Great food.  The cuts are good and the meat is tender.  Great cornbread.  Beans good as well.  But the sauce is the boss as they offer 3 different types.  Relaxed location nice place to watch the game and enjoy some pork on a fork.

Was visiting Phoenix and so glad we found this place! We got their bowl and burrito with brisket in both. Everything was delicious! Their brisket, mac n cheese, and waffle fries were amazing. We were full from our meal but ended up ordering a sampler to-go because it was that good! Would love to see this place in Southern Cali one day. Service was friendly and the place was clean.

We just got back from trying Pork on a Fork's baby back ribs and here's my thoughts:  The good: 1) The ribs were EXCELLENT! Exactly the way I like them! The pulled pork was also good and served WITHOUT any sauce, so you can pick which sauce you prefer. 2) Four different home made BBQ sauces - Sweet and Mild, Smoky and Tangy, Hot and zippy mustard glaze and they have just made them available to purchase by the bottle, as well. 3) Very friendly and helpful staff. 4) Reasonable prices, quick service, clean restrooms,  5) You can order the food already smoked and cooked, but served cold in a foil baking tray to heat up at your own home at a later time or day. They recommend consuming it within 7 to 10 days which is more than reasonable and the ribs may be even better as they sit and soak up the sauce and become more tender. 6) Mac and cheese side dish is delicious!  The bad: 1) Hard to find the restaurant - its located in an industrial park. 2) Waffle fries don't taste as good as they look. I'm guessing these are not home made, but frozen from a mass manufacturer like Oreida or some such... 3) Different prices on some of the same dishes on Friday's only as well as other sides available on Fridays only from 4pm to 7pm. Its a bit confusing to have a Friday Menu that has many of the same items as the regular menu at a slightly higher price. I understand items like Smoked Salmon are only available on the Friday menu, but why is the regular menu disregarded on Fridays and the prices different? 4) Closes early (7pm Mon - Fri) and 3pm on Saturday.  Summary - This is our new favorite place for baby backs and pulled pork. Will try the beef brisket in the near future. Highly recommended!! And ,they accept debit and credit cards where many other small BBQ restaurants are cash only, which I find inconvenient. So that's a plus, as well.
Great BBQ! They always have fresh smoked meat and the sauce is amazing. A must try if you like BBQ.

My Husband and I decided to give this place a try tonight and take my parents along with us. The staff was friendly and helpful. The pork was great, the brisket was perfect (and not fatty!), the waffle fries were tasty and the mac and cheese was awesome and those who ordered them, liked the beans. My Husband liked his Midwest Monster and tore that sandwich up! Even the kid ate the pork slider and we can't get him to eat much of anything these days! Needless to say, we will definitely be coming back for more! The only thing I thought they could improve on are the buns. They were cold, not very tasty or toasted.

My wife and I catered this for our wedding, that should tell you how delicious it is. The pulled chicken is by far my favorite meat here. They are reasonably priced and very homey place. Their service is impeccable and I highly recommend them.
This place is really good. Awesome BBQ. A little pricey though.

So excited they opened their second location on 20th Street and Camelback Road. I've been going to their original location on Deer Valley Rd for years. Just like the original, the ribs are incredible, the pulled pork is smoked to perfection and the Mac and cheese is simply addictive. Can't wait to have them cater my next event. And what makes them even better... they are locally owned and operated. Simply the best BBQ in the valley.
I got food by carry out. Great pulled pork and sausages!  Will be a repeat customer. A must try

Not a hit!  I would like to think I am a BBQ Connoisseur which is why my wife went out of her way to get a gift card for us to visit. Very small place located just South of the Deer Valley Airpark.   Food:  I had a brisket sandwich with coleslaw and corn bread.  Brisket was not warm and bland.  The coleslaw wasn't terrible however finding the black hair halfway through didn't sit well with my stomach.  I did notice that NON of the employees were wearing hats or hairnets so that is a possible reason why.  The cornbread was a premium side which didn't make sense because of how small it was.  It was like a mini muffin which was cold to the point that the cool butter that was placed inside didn't melt.  The bottom half was completely stale and inedible.  My wife had the pork sandwich in which she agreed that it wasn't a very enjoyable.  She had coleslaw as well as the baked beans.  Nothing amazing to comment on here.    Service:  The service was brief because food was served out of chauffeurs.  Similar to a quick serve the food clearly wasn't made fresh.  Nice people I am sure but there is no engagement other than ordering.  I would not recommend pork on a fork because I have enjoyed many other BBQ Places around the valley.  If I wasn't given a gift card I wouldn't of visited and overall I was disappointed.

This place is hands down the best in the valley!! I have had Barbecue all over the country and the brisket is the best I have ever had. Ribs are awesome as well.  I have both dined in and used them to cater my son's end of year baseball party.  Everyone at my party was so happy and we had plenty of food. Check them out as soon as you can!
Love this place!!! Great portions and super friendly staff.  Last time I was in the owners came by my table and said hello! Nice small business feeling.

The boys from Nebraska have been busy. They are slowly taking over N Phx with their smelly pits.   The pork was a little dry and had a slight hint of smoke, enough to know it's there, but not enough for me. The portion was prefect. The waffle fries were hot and good.   The staff was cool, a little small talk, a little jokes etc.   The sauces were all good. I like the Smokey and Tangy mixed with the hot for the pork. I like the mustard fir the fries.   The seating area and tables could use a cleaning. You can tell the staff cleans on the surface but not in-depth.   In general it is still a great place for bbq.   Support your local community... eat local.
Pulled pork, bbq beans and potato salad. And of course, all the sauces. Slap yo grandmama good!!!

Eat here all the time for lunch. All of the employees are very friendly. The food is fantastic. I've ate plenty of great midwestern BBQ and this place ranks up there with the top. Keep up the good work.

Get off of my fork Get into my mouth Get off of that grill Get into some sauce (BBQ) Get into my belly yum yum, yeah  Get outta my mind Get into my life Oooooooooh Oh I said hey (Hey) you (You) Get into my belly (Lyrics - Billy Ocean - Get Into My Car)  Pork on a Fork was showcased on Drive-In, Dives, and Diners with Guy Fieri not too long ago.  From there they've became a hit and won numerous awards, plus rave reviews both on Yelp and from Foodies around the valley.  Needless to say, this place is pretty darn good wouldn't you say!    My office is close by so whenever I get a chance I try to hit the Fork.  Their Pulled Pork Sandwich is what I would consider the quintessential pulled pork meal. With sides of fingerling potatoes and coleslaw.  Good'o boys meal I guess, but man the pork and soft and tender; add some spicy bbq and finger licking good -- YUMMY!  Portions here are modest I think so you won't over eat in my opinion.    The place itself started in modest fashion.  When I first came there was maybe 6 tables max, but now they have an entire huge patio in the back.  Let's just after having a meal here you'll need more room - wink!  Again, this place is a dive so take the boys out and leave the dating scene out! - Enjoy!

It's been almost a year since my last review and thought it was time to share an update with my fellow Yelpers :^)  ======Smoky Goodness Alert========  Be prepared to smell smoky goodness upon entry of Pork on a Fork!!  It is highly addictive in intoxicating, so dinners beware!    Pork on a Fork has the BEST PULLED PORK sandwich in Phoenix and maybe even the best in the entire Universe!!  Sure their might be a few other places that have better BBQ Ribs, Brisket and/or Smoked Sausages, but Pork on a Fork is as good or better than most at these and the are the BEST at Pulled Pork!    You can not beat their Pulled Pork Sandwich, which is HUMONGOUS~ almost enough for two people!  It's so moist, tender and with a nice aroma of smokiness you'll want it for for yourself! It comes with two sides.  I recommend their tasty seasoned waffle fries and their BBQ Beans!  These BBQ Beans are cooked in Heaven ~ sent by angels down to earth and given to Pork on a Fork to sell to their customers!  :^)  Well, maybe that's a stretch but their BBQ Beans are soooo tasty full of bacon and brisket burnt ends with a great balance of seasoning.   If you have tried Pork on the Fork yet, you don't know what you're missing.  Once you've tried them for lunch, you'll find yourself wanting more and caan't wait for your next visit!  I hope to see you there.

Been going here for about 6 months now and was not real excited at first but the food kept getting better.   Try the brisket plate or pork sandwich, am sure you will be pleased!  Also they have "Prime Rib Fridays" and its very good as well!   Also they have a LARGE room in back for groups or extra people and a big screen TV for games and such!

Went in on the 5th around 4:00 pm.  I know it is a new location but the service was awful!  The lady at the register was rude to us & told us we had to order before we get to the register.  Went back to the food line to order & after waiting a few minutes with 4 employees ignoring us my husband asked if this is where we were to order.  We were told yes and were continued to be ignored.  We waited a while longer and our order was finally taken.  We get to the register to pay & they give our food to the lady in front of us.  We told them it was our order and not hers and they argued with us and told us that she ordered online so she gets her order first.  We argued again that it shouldn't matter - that was our order (not even the same thing she ordered) & they bagged it up for her anyway.  The lady at the register asked if it was our order and we said yes, but that is fine, we can order it again.  Then they pulled her order out of her bag and gave it to us where we again argued that it was her order and she had our order.  The manager lady did look very busy trying to train everyone but there was only one person in front of us.  There was no way the service should have been this bad.  My husband said the brisket was not good - I had the pork sandwich and it was ok.  They were out of cornbread so we had mac & cheese - nothing special & my son wouldn't even eat his.  Not sure we will be back after the service as there are a lot of other better BBQ joints around but the price was good and they are close so we may give them one more chance once they are open for a while.  Hopefully I will be able to update with more stars.
I finally was able to try this place!!! My sister got me sausage and brisket with Mac n cheese.. so delicious. Prices are affordable, and food is filling. I can't wait to be back!

Casual joint with incredibly good food!  Their ribs are my favorite EVER.  The meat is so tender and flavorful that I hardly use any sauce.  In fact, I appreciate how they don't drown their meat in sauce, but give you the option to slather it on or not.  Brisket is good too.  It's hard to find a place that does brisket well and doesn't smother it in sauce, but POAF gets it right.  Sides are decent.  We like the mac n cheese, potato salad, and mac salad.  My husband loves their pulled pork.  He's from Syracuse, NY, where the delicious Dinosaur BBQ is king....but has recently admitted that POAF pulled pork is superior.  How's that for a recommendation?!?!  (Note:  He prefers Dinosaur BBQ sauce over POAF's sauce.)  Self-serve drinks.  Counter service.  They changed the ordering set up so it's now almost cafeteria-line style, and you walk down the line.  It seemed to expedite the food prep.  Our plates were ready right after we paid, and we walked to table food-in-hand.  I do wish there had been a tray to make carrying the food plates easier.  (although it's possible there were trays that I didn't see??)  Last time I was there, they ran food to the table.  Not sure if this depends on how busy it is.  Takeout entrance is around the corner.  Bottom line: Great food.  Our fave BBQ.

I was introduced to Pork on a Fork when I attended the Best of the Biltmore event this year.  (Or was it Best of New Times?)   Oh, well.   Best of something event.  I LOVE smoked meat -- as long as it's melt in one's mouth tender and has a very smokey flavor, and the BBQ sauce has a zingy taste.   And this place fits the bill.   After going back numerous times to the booth during the event, I decided to check out the store -- especially since they gave us a coupon for buying something and getting something off.  I got the pulled pork, the links, and a bottle of hot BBQ sauce, all of it to go.   I must admit, I didn't quite make it out of the store without sampling some of the pork and links.   I wanted to see if one of the other four BBQ flavors they had on the table was something I should buy.   Nope.   The hot BBQ sauce was the best.    As far as I'm concerned, I don't think the meat really needs to have the sauce.   I eat it plain or added to whatever dish I feel in the mood.     I've continued to go back.   Buying a pound of the pork actually goes a long ways.   I've also tried their mac and cheese, but I wasn't particularly impressed.

Took my whole family here on a Saturday afternoon. The Food was cold, really dry. Seemed to be prepared days before. Ribs were way overcooked. Dining area was not clean and there were no customers at the time of my visit, so busy is not an excuse. Poor selection of fountain beverages. NO corn on the cob! Yep, that's right a bar B que restaurant  with no corn on the cob!

So I've been a customer of pork on a fork for 2 years now.  I always get pulledpork, mac n cheese and beans.  I'm from Kansas City and love BBQ.  The last two visits here I've noticed they have completely changed the BBQ beans(my favorite).  The new beans suck.  So much I think I stop supporting pork on a fork.  I just so happen to wearing a pork on a fork shirt while writing this review.  I gave the place a 3 star because I do like the atmosphere and all of the workers are very pleasant.  But I don't get why u would change something that's soo good.  Are you going to change the rub on the meat now???   If it's not broke don't fix or ruin it in this case.  Hope u bring back the beans but from here on out I will not be eating here.

This review is based on the pork products I picked up at the Mesa Farmers Market.  I understand they have a restaurant opening soon, and I'll for sure have to check it out.  For $12 you get a bag of frozen smoked pulled pork that is so easy to fix at home!  Just put it in a pan - I added a little (very little) of my favorite bbq sauce - and heat until hot.  Great smoke flavor, no fatty pieces and very tender.  The pulled pork is as good as any I've had from a bbq place here or anywhere.  I also tried the ham steaks and they were tasty, not fatty and much better than any ham steak I've bought at the grocery store.    I'm a repeat customer and that says it all!

Good but certainly not the best in the valley (that title IMHO goes to Naked, hands down). The sausage was the tastiest followed by the pulled chicken then the brisket. All could be helped by some BBQ sauce (several varieties available) and the pulled pork almost REQUIRED it. The meats overall were pretty average. The sides were the standout however. The mac and cheese was addictively delicious. The potato salad and cornbread (the latter of which really shouldn't count as a side) were also very good.

Ok...so after a few minutes of trying to find this place, we stepped into heaven.  There is no lighted sign or really any lights outside to tell you where it is, but we found it.  We walked in to a very busy place.  The bff and I stood there trying to figure out what we wanted and couldn't decide.  We thought we had figured it all out when we decided one of us would get the pulled pork sandwich and the other would get the brisket...only to find out they were all out of pork!  Must be good and that just means we will have to make the journey out there again!  We each got the brisket and WOW! It was tender and very flavorful.  They have several sauces to choose from.  I went with the mustard bbq and the Crazy (something or other...I can't remember the name).  The mustard bbq sauce was perfect for the brisket.  Just the right amount of tang and spice.  For my two sides I chose the mac n cheese and waffle fries...starch much?  The fries were good and the mac n cheese was really tasty...nothing froo froo or fancy about it.  Just straight up mac n cheese!   The menu isn't huge, but the smell is intoxicating enough to lead you to confusion that will mess with you and your decision making abilities!    I didn't mean to be a nosey-rosey but I did look at other patrons' plates and everything in the place looks delicious...the ribs, the chicken...I can't wait to go back and try some more!  Thanks to Yelp, I got a free drink!  Oh and as for the name...when I was finished with my meal, you could have put a fork in me and I would have been "pork on a fork!"  I don't regret it and don't judge me...it's the holidays! Screw the diets!
We down right ordered the family XL meal. Outstanding!! 6 adults 2 kids. One extra side because we are undecisive folk.  Again outstanding.  *Only thing to watch for is ribs although tasty are fatty.

its hard to give 3 stars sin e i think its a 2 1/2 place but rouding up.  i compare all bbq against my home state of tennessee.  i got the original sampler platter  chicken - actually moist and pretty decent sausage - pretty good. pulled pork - not bad but doeant hold a candle to tennessee pulled port beans - nasty one of the worst ive ever had mac salad - decent rendition  all in all not the worst place for bbq in arizona but not great.    ps your bbq sauces need major work.  could you introduce on with actual spice?  or a vinegar based sauce?

This place is a hidden gem! If you're not paying attention you can easily miss this spot because it's in a commercial building, but don't let that fool you this place is great. Walking in and just smelling the food lets you know that this place is legit.  This was my first time here and I came based on the suggestions of my fellow Yelpers. Prior to ordering my food I checked in and was given a free drink just for checking in. Not sure if that is an all the time thing, but it let you know that they care about their customers.  I ordered the pull pork sandwich with a side of waffle fries. The sandwich was excellent and the pork was moist and seasoned perfectly to allow the flavor of the meat to shine. The fries were just as good and I was happy with my choice. Plus you couldn't beat the price for the quality of food...just $9.  This place was clean inside and the staff was friendly. I will definitely be back.

I've been here 4 times now, twice for lunch and twice for dinner.   I've had the pulled pork with beans and Mac and cheese each time for lunch. Pork is incredibly tender and juicy. It doesn't come with sauce, but there's a handful of different choices to add to the sandwich. Beans are excellent.  First time we came for dinner, they were out of chicken. My wife not being a BBQ person wasn't feeling trying something, so unfortunately we left. The 2nd time for dinner she ordered the chicken sandwich and I went for the ribs. As my ribs were ready, they leaned over the counted and told us they were out of chicken!  We've already paid at this point, so no where to go.  They offered to make her a cold chicken salad, which she said was good. My ribs were good, great flavor but didn't pull away from the bone like in would have expected. I'll probably go back to the pulled pork and try the beef next time though.   As we left, no offer to comp the salad or any effort to make up for her not getting what she ordered.  Great food, disappointing in the service and fulfillment side though.

Awesome! I'd never seen this place before, but we went with friends. Some of the best BBQ I've ever had. We had a restaurant.com gift certificate so ordered a ton of food since we had to hit $35 with just 2 of us. Pretty much everything we ordered was good except a few things that I didn't like but my hubby did. The baked beans had awesome flavor but were a bit spicy for me. The ribs were out of this world- perfectly done and great flavor. Same for the pulled pork, waffle fries, sweet potato fries, and cornbread muffins. The BBQ sauces were a perfect compliment to the foods- I loved the tangy flavors and hubby liked the mustard and spicy sauces.  They were all out of beef brisket and mac and cheese, but we'll definitely try those next time. I also wanted to try the grilled ham and cheese sandwich, but we were already well beyond stuffed full. Prices here are really reasonable, and the portions are generous without being overwhelming.

Blasted into town for a business day trip at the Deer Valley Airport, checked Yelp for nearby lunch options, this place looked good, had lots of positive reviews, and was close, and man were we happy we did!   Checked in, so we got the free pork slider, had the pulled pork sandwich combo and the beef brisket combo, both with sweet potato fries and beans.  The food was fantastic and quite filling, and the 3 different BBQ sauces available were delicious with just the right amount of kick.  This is a great place to eat if your in the area
