My husband and I wanted to try a new place for lunch. I found this place on yelp. We arrived and the place was not busy. It was pretty dark inside but we were getting ours to go. Even if we wanted to stay there are only two tables from what I saw. I ordered the 4 sample plate and sides my husband ordered the half a rack of ribs and sides. We were pretty disappointed in the amount of food or lack their of. One sausage. A scoop of pork. A half a scoop or chicken and barely two slices of brisket. My husband and I wanted to share this and ribs and that was a challenge since it was basically for one person. We have gone to other bbq establishments around the valley who gave more meat in their portions. The meats were good and juicy. My husband did say the ribs were slightly tough. The sides- he had baked beans and loved them. I had mac and cheese which was great and the waffle fries which seemed to be full of oil and undercooked. Their sauce is amazing I will say that much but otherwise it's basic bbq.

Good food but poor service. I stood at the counter for several minutes just waiting for someone to take my order. I was surprised the credit card tried to give the person ringing up the order a tip. Why do I need to tip if I have to wait in line to order, then pick up my food at the counter when it is ready and throw it away when I'm done?  Why not just have a touch screen we can order from?

Ummmm, YUUUUM. Like, drooling yum. And dangit, this is a dangerous location. Right next to the frys I go to at least once a week. Im in trouble. SO good. Went here for the first time this past weekend, did the chicken sandwich with sides of potato salad and baked beans. I apparently missed the memo that the mac and cheese is to die for, so now I must return just for that! Not the cheapest, but I suppose same price range as somewhere such as chipotle. Not fast food, but not a full on site down fancy restaurant. Meat was very good. Wasn't a huge fan of the potato salad, not sure what it was about it. Not terrible, but will not get it again. Cute d√©cor, friendly staff, and a little too good of a location. I shall return.

There are many places in Phoenix to go to for so-so BBQ, but there aren't that many that are as memorable ... and delicious!... as Pork on a Fork. This place is inconspicuously tucked away from the road near Deer Valley airport, with a sign that says, "Valley's Best BBQ" and an arrow directing traffic. Well, that is an understatement! The first time my boyfriend and I stopped in, we were warmly greeted by the staff. We chose our entree and sides (he got the beef brisket and I got the chicken ... and we both got macaroni salad -yum!) and took our plates to the back, where it opens up to a clean, brightly-colored room. From there, we had an assortment of BBQ sauces to choose from. (My personal favorite is the Sweet and Mild.) Since then, we've been back several times and now go at least once a week. We're so appreciative that this little gem is near our house...it's not only the best BBQ in north Phoenix, but possibly the Southwest. The meat is smoked, juicy and absolutely mouth-watering. The price is right, and the employees are friendly and accommodating. If you like good BBQ...and not the mediocre kind served by most chains around town...try Pork on a Fork...you won't just like it...you will LOVE it!
This is the best BBQ! The atmosphere is laid-back and comfortable. Awesome lunch spot!

The smoked brisket was amazing. The char was so tasty! Generous portions and nice variety with really good pricing. The sauce was flavorful and zesty. The coleslaw was fresh! Pulled pork sandwich was huge and enough for two meals. I wanted a salad but they ran out of lettuce. Next time. I would definitely go back! People friendly too! Good spot.

This place just keeps getting better! The portion of meat is perfect. My wife and I got the 3 meat platter and both had enough leftover for lunch the next day. The only somewhat negative thing about this place is the small sides.
Good food, surprisingly dirty tables on a slow Tuesday night.

The staff was kind and food served quickly.  Quirky location in a concrete tilt up building.  Not a complaint - just an observation.  Several sauces are available for you  - try 'em!  Will return for sure.

This is very good BBQ; not the best I've had, but certainly one of the best.  The service was quick and friendly (you order at the counter).  Prices are about typical.  The "restaurant" is a simple arrangement in an industrial complex.  Don't expect ambiance here, it's just a place to eat really good BBQ.  They have a good assortment of tasty BBQ sauces at each table.  Try them all!
I've since been back multiple times and have been happy each time. Love their BBQ burrito and their waffle fries.

Yum! I am not a huge BBQ person but this place is fantastic. We have been here several times and tried everything but the shining star is obviously the babyback ribs. So stinkin' good. If you like ribs and have to share, go ahead and order a full rack. I also really enjoy their sides. The waffle fries are great but if you are taking them home, make sure to tear a whole in that foam container so they don't get all soggified. But if that happens, go ahead and pop them in the toaster oven for a few, voila! I love their mac and cheese, its so good and cheesy! The hubs loves their baked beans because they have chunks of meat in them. Their side BBQ sauces are great! They just overall have great food. This place is awesome!

Pork on a Fork is an unexpected awesome BBQ place in the north valley.  If you're from Nebraska like me you may appreciate the Cornhuskers "N" on the smoker and picture of windmills & farmers in the dining area.  To me, those are a few of the reasons why I left that terrible place.  No points lost though.  I have only been here during lunch and they usually have a line at the door, come early.  Their brisket, BBQ pork, beans and waffle fries are hot, tasty and fresh. PoaF's meat is awesome. The cornbread is good too. The portions are big too, I typically have to fight the afternoon food coma but it's worth it.  Their sauces aren't anything fantastic, but I enjoy the spicy sauce. The dining areas have flat screen TV's and aren't bad, but the chairs and tables are picnic quality.

My youngest step son requested ribs for his birthday dinner and we were out by Tom's thumb, but they ribs weren't out of the smoker for another two hours, so we headed back to our side of town, and went to POAF instead.  I really appreciated the super nice customer service.  I didn't enjoy the food very much though.  The mac and cheese was the best part, it really was super yummy, but the meats were cold and the ribs were dry.  I wouldn't hesitate to come back, but I can't call this my fav BBQ spot...

Pork on a fork catered an event at my wife's work recently, and the food was pretty good. The pulled pork was flavorful and their hot bbq was really good. The beans were tasty and had a little heat to them. The brownies were ok, but not amazing, and the mac and cheese was a little bland. I give a little more leeway for catering, so overall it was a good experience.

Great BBQ in Phoenix! Hard to find though, it's in a commercial complex don't worry you didn't drive by it, it's there and worth the couple of u-turns you'll have to pull to find it. Food came out fast and the sauces were dynamite.

Stopped in there this morning with the idea of getting some more sausage gravy on biscuits which I thought were really good the first time I had them.  It appears the week after my last breakfast there they stopped serving breakfast and now open at 10 instead of 8.  I had even brought my cooler with me in case they had bacon in stock.  I am surprised he didn't mention the upcoming change when I asked about being able to pick up some items while I got breakfast.  On my last visit I had their breakfast bowl thing and that was good too.  Now that they are not open early I guess I won't be back because it is out of my way except for early on Thursdays and I don't get around to the farmers markets.

Recently had Pork On A Fork cater a family party.  We had ribs, brisket, and pulled chicken.  Everything was delicious.  Ariana brought everything and set up.  We also got beans, mac and cheese, potato salad and coleslaw.  We decimated the meats.  Everything had a great smoke taste along with 3 choices of BBQ sauce.  Would highly recommend for catering.  Nice job POAF.

WOW!!!! I found this place by using my YELP mobile app searching for nearby places to eat next to my home.  I had NO idea this hidden gem was literally a few miles up the road from me across from Deer Valley Airport.   It turns out this place has almost a 5 star yelp rating, was featured on Guy Fieri's Diner's, Drive-In, & Dives (love me some Triple D!), AND has a $20 for $10 GROUPON!!!   So, my date and I decided to check it out for the first time this past Friday night.  I could smell the bbq before we even pulled in the parking lot.  I had a HUGE smile on my face walking in the doors! The menu is on a flat screen tv in front of the register.  You place your order there rather than sitting at a table and ordering from a server.    We both got the MONSTER which is a sandwich with Beef Brisket and Pork, jalapenos, slaw, pepper jack cheese (I think I got that right).  You pick 2 sides and I chose the mac n cheese and the baked beans.  OMG I am so in love with this food right now! The bbq was simply delicious, the mac n cheese was phenom, and those were the BEST baked beans I have ever eaten in my life.... and I'm a Southern Girl!   I will be back many times... probably later today.  I can't wait to eat my way through the menu.  Thank you YELP!!!!

Came in around 5-6pm for dinner it was not busy but when we seated with our party of six. The first couple got their orders pretty quick while the rest of us waited and the my boyfriend and I got ours before the couple before us to find out that the staff lost their ordering ticket.   Now For my order. The pulled pork sandwich was perfect not dry and not drenched in sauce, the buns went great with the flavor of the pork and sauce. The Macaroni salad was not that great at all and the cole slaw was bad.

The best bbq I've had in Phoenix.  I had the beef brisket bbq burrito and choose what I wanted in it.  Tons of choices, I had pickles, coleslaw, and others I can't remember.  Then I got to choose two sides, I had the beans and coleslaw.  The beans were delicious with big chunks of bacon.  The slaw was decent.  Staff is very helpful navigating the menu and how it works.  I can't wait to try something new the next time!

This is EXCELLENT!!!! I love BBQ and am I blown away by how good it was.  I never heard of it and will be back VERY soon.  My boys loved everything.  The BBQ burrito was amazing and the BBQ sauce even better.  I would cater from here in a hot minute!!!

I love the food here- when I can actually order it. 3 of my last 4 visits have been horrendous. I have let management know the disappointment, and yet nothing has changed. The good experience I had of those 4 was when I ordered take out online and then picked it up. My card was charged 3 times, and I had $90.00 pending on it for 4 days, and that was STILL better than trying to dine in. There is absolutely no customer service. The employees that work here could not care less that they are at work, and it shows. Two nights ago (Thurs)- I walk in at 7:35, they close at 8:00, I do not think that is unreasonable for me to want food and service. I stand at the "Order Here" counter for about two minutes- and I can not see a single worker. I can hear them, all talking and laughing behind the kitchen equipment. Finally someone comes up and says "Do you need something?". Well I would like to order some food, he replies "Takeout Order" and I said "no". He said he would have to find someone to help me. Now three more employees come around the corner, laughing and joking with what I can only assume are their friends, and then 4 more employees appear from behind the equipment. So now I have 8 employees standing around in my view, but still NONE of them can "help me". Finally a 9th employee comes up, and puts gloves on and asks me what I want. I ordered brisket. He opens the drawer, makes a face, calls someone else over to look at it, she made a disgusted face and then whispers to him "We can't serve that to people, just tell her we are out." I can totally hear them mind you. So then he just looks at me and says..."ummmm, yea, so we are out of brisket- sorry." I was pretty pissed so I just walked out. Seriously Pork on a Fork- get your act together. You all have great food and not a lot of competition- this does not give you the right to treat your customers like crap and not prepare food. This was the better experience of my bad ones... but you can see why I am close to giving up on you all. I have reached out to management before and not received a response. Maybe a Yelp review will actually get their attention. I would rather drive 15 miles farther just because of the service, which is what I did Thursday night. Get it together! Customer Service goes a long way- these employees could really embrace that concept.
Generous portions of smoked meat. Tender and juicy! The Mac n chess's side was delicious!

Great BBQ, all the meat is excellent. Brisket is my favorite. A bit strange that they don't include a bread or cornbread, apparently it's a side, potato salad not that great. Customer service is hit or miss. Very strange that they weigh the meat. Great food though!

Amazing BBQ and it's just up the street from my house! The staff is pretty amazing and helpful as well. I always get the food to go and they are pretty quick with the food prep. Gotta love the small local business!

We used to love this place but it's taken a nose dive in quality.   Came here for lunch and it was almost completely empty. The food quality has decreased drastically. The meat was dry and cold. The sides were cold. Everything was just weak.   The food was really just awful....after a dozen visits we'll probably never come back.

This place is just around the corner from my house. so I thought I would try it. I have been there twice and I am done... I will admit that I am not a big fan of smoked meats but thought I would see what the fuss was all about. the first time I got the Burrito/Wrap and after spending $10 I was presented with something that I would be embarrassed to serve. the Burrito had a small amount of brisket and they were out of Black  Beans so I go about a tablespoon . this Burrito was small and not worth the price. The sides I got were the Cole slaw and waffle fries. they were both good.  The smoked meat was good however the smoke lasted all day and in to the evening where I was then forced to eat a few TUMS.  so why go back ... Well I thought  since they just opened I would give them another chance. I went back with some co-workers and got the meat sampler with a drink for $13.   it is very small location and they have a few tables inside so we HAD  to take it to go. When I opened the container this was definitely a sampler as there was a small amount of brisket of which a Hugh piece of fat (I refuse to eat a chuck of fat) resided on. There was half of sausage link and a small pile of pulled pork. the brisket and pork were put on 2 small slider buns. also I did not realize that they had all the different BBQ sauces and they didn't even offer or tell me to get some when they handed me my order so when I eat this I had no sauce to combine with.  for the sides this time I got the sweet potato fries and the Cole slaw. I liked the fries.  I have to say that all the meats tasted the same. The smoke flavor to me was so overpowering that the only way to know what you're eating if you close your eyes is by the texture of the meat. I probably don't need to add that once again I ran for the TUMS that evening. Also I pulled the fat off with a fork in one hand and my fingers on my other. The smell of smoke permeated my fingers and it took all day to get rid of that smoke.    My feeling is that the portions were not worth the price I paid both in money and indigestion.  overall I realize that I can't do the smoked meats any more as I get older. I am sure there are lots of people who will love and enjoy this place just remember your pepsid or Tums.

This will be my first review for this place.  I didn't get to go to the actual restaurant.  I found it insanely weird that a restaurant wasn't open on the weekends.  I am assuming that the area over in Deer Valley just doesn't get busy on the weekends?  So we arrived at their restaurant and they had a sign on the door saying they are closed and will be at a farmers market.  So I found out which market and had to drive 20 minutes south.  The booth didn't have a sign on it big enough to see it and we walked by it and had to walk around again.  I am pretty sure we looked like lost tourists!  Sad.  We ordered the one thing they had, a pork sandwich.. it was SOOOOOO good!  The pork melted in my mouth and the bbq sauce was perfectly spicy and complimented the sandwich so wonderfully!  My taste buds were thanking me.  It was amazing and it wasn't even hot (heat) and I ate it at a farmers market.  That says something!  So we will be making another trip to their actual restaurant soon so we can get a real experience.  I can't wait!

Easily the best BBQ in the valley and possibly the best in the southwest.  The staff is terrible - slow, cares very little about the fact they move like sloths, and not a smile in the place (we went on a weekend).  The food is otherworldly. The bark and smoky flavor to the THICK slices of brisket are done right. The sauces are fantastic. The mustard base BBQ sauce was one of the most unique flavors I've ever had works well on everything. The Mac and Cheese is up there with the best, as well are the beans. The potato salad left a lot to be desired.   Even with a terrible ordering and purchasing experience, I have to give this place 5 stars. The food is that good. AND they have RC Cola on fountain!

I used to think Pork on a Fork was one of the best BBQ joints around.  Our last two visits have disproved this theory.  We used a Groupon here a week ago and it was not tasty like it used to be.  I had a bone in my pulled pork sandwich that was about the size of a quarter and could have broken one of my teeth in two.  I realize that there is always the possibility of bone in BBQ, but this piece was so large they should have caught it.  The meat really didn't have any flavor without the sauce.  My husband was not thrilled by the lukewarm beer he was given or the brisket.  The amount of flies in the dining area was disgusting!

We were so excited to find this little gem as we've not had any good BBQ in Phoenix.   The friendly staff hand shredded our pork sammies and served them with delicious Mac and cheese and baked beans. All were delicious options.  We also ordered cole slaw and it was not zingy.   They have ample other side options and the traditional BBQ meat options including brisket and sausage.   Will definitely add this place to our must haves list.

We ordered take out here last night. My husband got the sampler and I got the brisket. All of the meats were over cooked and extremely dry. The sauces weren't to great either. It's so hard finding a good BBQ restaurant here in az. Ricks smokehouse down the way was even better then this. How it won az best who knows?

It smells fantastic when you walk in but that was the only good thing about the place. The service is terrible. I had to ask for sauce for my bbq bowl 3 times, finally getting it after my entire order was bagged up. I watched a server sweeping scraps of meat onto the floor behind the counter. No one seems to know how to do their job.   If the food was good, I might consider going back but I found it fairly bland. It certainly wasn't good enough to make up for the horrible customer service. You lost me as a customer after my very first visit.

We got there at closing time so take out was our choice. We got platters - 3 or 4 meats with 2 sides. Brisket was good but dry-ish. The pulled chicken was delish. Good sausage, full of spice and juicy. We tried baked beans, Cole slaw, corn off the cob. A generic dinner roll is invluded. No butter or anything. It was ok. The Cole Slaw was juicy and crunchy fresh. We were offered s variety of sauces which highlights the flavor of the bbq. Good value, great flavor. I should ordered some ribs but there was more than I good finish as is.

Saw the great reviews on yelp so since I work very close by I thought I would try it.   First impression.. This place is situated in an industrial park and probably caters mainly to the businesses nearby.. I dropped in around 4..was pretty empty since they tend to get a busy lunch crowd.   Staff was super friendly and knew the food.. I tried the Midwest special which was a mix of 3 types of slow cooked meat topped with coleslaw and jalape√±os.    Food was fresh and delicious, got potato salad and macaroni salad as sides and were super tasty as well.  Great little down home bbq restaurant.. Will definitely be back
Best pulled pork ever. The ribs werre done to perfection. The sides were not an after thought . Beans were seasoned just right and the cheese and mac, creamy deliciousness.

Great little BBQ joint right near Deer Valley Airport. We just happen to be driving in the area (avoiding the freeway traffic) and got a little hungry. Stumbled upon this spot and we are glad that we did. The wife loved it, as did I. We will be stopping by much more in the future!

Ordered catering for a company lunch. Justin showed up 10 minutes early which was greatly appreciated, not to mention he was very friendly. The food was packaged well and came with all the utensils we needed. Ordered the two meat option from the catering menu - pulled pork, pulled chicken and two sides, mac and cheese and coleslaw. Came with three types of BBQ sauce. Everything was delicious - it was a big hit in the office and a welcome break from the typical sandwich platters. Would most definitely recommend Pork on a Fork and will be using for future lunches! (Side note: order extra mac n' cheese because it is amazing and will disappear quickly!)

Had my first Pork on a Fork experience last night and it was amazing! I had the pulled pork with the sweet potato fries and it was delicious. The pork was moist and flavorful and the fries were awesome.  This place has found something the Valley is missing... Great BBQ! I haven't had BBQ this great since I left the Midwest 10 years ago.  Looking forward to going back and trying some of the other items on their menu.

Used to love this place! Now the long lines are a bust. Waited 30 plus minutes to get o the front to see someone has a take out which only makes people in line wait longer. Not a fan of the new ordering system or watching people handle your food. Probably best  to have a second station during peak periods in order to cut time down. Most people have a quick lunch. Food is great, but sometime not worth the wait!
Jesus, I don't even know where to begin. The most deelish bbq west of Memphis. Quality and quantity above all else. Next time I go to Phoenix I will move next to this place.
Definitely a diamond in the rough. I could probably eat here every day. I already have  my next choice picked out. Definitely a go-to place

Very disappointing, I was craving bbq and this was the closest place to me. I saw that they had 4 stars, so I figured it would be good. I was really dissatisfied, the brisket was dry and the pulled pork had almost no flavor. Their sides are subpar and the baked beans taste like it came from the can and heated. If your looking for good bbq try little miss bbq or naked bbq.

I was raised on southern pit Bar-B-Q.  As a displaced Texan, I'm still searching for a good meal.  Heard Pork on a Fork was pretty good so I hunted them down one evening.  You will need a good GPS to find the location in an industrial strip center near Deer Valley airport.  They serve real smoked Bar-B-Q which is better than many local BBQ joints.  You can see the smoke ring on the brisket without needing a magnifier.  But, it falls far short of the perfect BBQ from south Texas.  Only 12 hours in a slow smoker produces brisket that meets the back home standard.    Pretty good Bar-B-Q.  I'm still looking for awesome.
Good eats... Food was solid... Great selections on plates and platters.. Sides are awesome and not a bad price on getting a good amount of food.

In town for work and thought we'd try it out based on the name alone! It did NOT disappoint! Great food, nice atmosphere, and helpful employees. I would definitely come back and recommend this to anyone who hasn't tried it!! Thanks for a great lunch!

This Kansas girl is always on the lookout for quality bbq and Pork on a Fork did not disappoint. The key to identifying a good bbq joint is their brisket. Theirs was perfectly smoked, great smoke ring just enough fat remaining to seal in the juices. The sausage chicken and pulled pork was just as perfect. Finally if you are a sauce person definitely try what they have to offer. Now what about the sides? Those too were made to perfection, don't miss the Mac and cheese and when they ask if you want seasoning on it say YES. If you are anywhere near one of their locations in Phoenix stop in!

Amazing food! Everything is good and very difficult to chose. Even the Mac and cheese was delicious. You must get a side of potato salad and the macaroni salad. Be sure to ask for extra bbq sauce. I will definitely be going back for more. My son, who is very picky about his food, even loved the Mac and cheese.

Hidden inside of several other office building, this location can be easily overlooked.  However, it was obvious from the number of cars at 6 p.m. on a weekday, that this place is a local hot spot despite its hidden venue. There was a visible line of patrons when we pulled up to park, which to us, was a good sign.  We walked in and waited in the line (about 5 groups back from the cashiers) and it took about 15 minutes to reach the front to order. I let the cashier know that we had a Groupon and she asked if we had it ready to go, which we did on the mobile app. She was a touch abrupt with her manner and said that the line was really long and that we should have it ready to keep the wait down. This statement confused me, since I let her know already that we had it out, which we showed her, and we just waited in the line, so we were well aware of the wait...luckily this was the only real sore spot in the whole experience! We will write that off to the hectic wait and that she was pretty obviously stressed about it.  They were out of chicken, so we were offered the brisket as a replacement for no additional charge on the sampler plate. For my sides I had the macaroni salad and the beans, which were both really good. He had the potato salad and beans.    As for the meats, I would have to say that I enjoyed the sausage the most, the pulled pork second, and the brisket the least of the three, although it wasn't bad at all - just placed last in comparison overall! There is a sauce bar so that you can add the BBQ sauce that fits your liking.  The sweet sauce was my pick and it was a good one!  Towards the end of the meal one of the staff stopped by to ask if all had gone well and cleared our plates for us.    Overall: A A hidden local gem that is a must try if you are in the area.  Keep an eye out for Groupon deals!

O. M. G. I don't know why this place wasn't just overflowing with people. Not enough good things to say about this place. First of all, I live right down the street and I have no idea why it took so long to finally try it out! Amazing amazing amazing food!!! Great prices and definitely not stingy when it comes to serving sizes! They give you so much food! Hubby and I both ate for a little over 20 bucks. Can't beat it!! Especially for bbq. Can't wait to go back and try everything! Definitely bringing all my family and friends too.

Family loved it!  One of our favorite places for barbecue.  The only negative is that it is in a business park.   But if we want good food, go here.    We got the sampler which fed both of us.  We eat less than your average American.  Pork is moist and tender.  The Mac and cheese is killer and the coleslaw is light.

I had their pulled pork with spicy bbq sauce. I was impressed. Probably my favorite bbq place in Phoenix. I didn't give it 5 stars because the place is dirty inside. Flies are EVERYWHERE...Their food is excellent but they really need to clean this place up a bit. I will definitely go back, I can't get enough of that spicy bbq sauce. I'm glad I found this place since it's so close to me :) "bbq tastes so good it makes you wanna slap your momma"

I will preface this review by saying that this is my first one on Yelp; although I use (and appreciate) reviews on it frequently.  My partner and I eat out several times a week and like to try new places once in a while. We went here on a Sunday night (just got home from eating there) and there was one small family there. The girl who took our order didn't greet us and seemed quite apathetic. My partner has a Groupon, but was unable to download it on his phone. He asked the cashier, who we found out was also the manager, for the WiFi password. She said that the owner has it and she doesn't know it. No apologies, nothing. So my partner made a comment about the fact that she obviously didn't care. So, we figured we'd use the Groupon a next time (see where this is going?). My partner ordered waffle fries as a side. The girl who took our order called back for waffle fries, as none were available.   My cole slaw and mac 'n cheese were pretty good. My pulled pork sandwich was pretty good too, except for the chunk of bone that I bit into. The sandwich was lukewarm at best and a bit on the dry side. But like I said, pretty good. So we were halfway through our meal and still no waffle fries. The acoustics are pretty good in the restaurant and we heard the "manager" and the girl who took our order talking about us. They mentioned something about calling the owner regarding the WiFi. My partner went to the counter to inquire about his fries. The girl who took his order asked "waffle fries or sweet potato fries?" Umm, she took our order about 15 minutes ago. So no waffles fries were put in the deep fryer. We cancelled the fries, as our meal was almost over.   So, decent food, but horrible service. Oh and there were dirty napkins on the floor and food scraps on some tables - with only a few customers in the place. We'll get a refund on that Groupon and move on...
Top Notch Bar B Que. Food is very tasty. Great bang for your buck. Plenty of space to relax and enjoy your meal. My second favorite spot for Que.

I can't believe I'm giving 5 stars to a BBQ place, but this place is damn good.  I normally don't get excited about BBQ.  I had the pulled pork sandwich, macaroni salad and baked beans.  Everything was excellent, the meat, the sauce, the bun, the mac salad, and definitely the beans.  Seriously, this place was tasty.  It was even reasonably priced.    One guy at my table got this crazy sausage-on-a-bun with pork and sweet potato fires on it.  Seriously, don't eat this on a first date, but it looked like an adventure.  His waffle fries looked great, too.  To finish things off, I left my cellphone on the table and the girl behind the counter chased me down in the parking lot and gave it to me.  I'm excited to try something else, but I wouldn't be surprised if my usual order is exactly what I had today.
Great BBQ. They always use gloves when touching any food. Get the sweet potato fries and beans as a side. They go great together.

Great BBQ!  This place is easy to miss, as it is in an odd location. But it's worth the search. Some coworkers told me about this place and I love it now.   Pork, brisket, bbq baked beans, and cornbread muffins. All just amazing.   You can also get "gift certificates" (they work more like coupons really) on Restaurant.com for POAF that can take a healthy 30% off your total experience after everything is said and done (make sure you find a coupon code before buying the certificate though, there is always a promo code, just use google)  I would have to recommend taking a big party and getting the family feast deal, it's $89.99 but it feeds 8 no problem.  I will definitely be returning, if I had any complaint it would be that they close way too early. But I'm sure that has to do with their location. If they opened a new, larger place and began serving beer, they would get that 5th star from be in a heartbeat.  But still, great work!
Best BBQ place I've been to in town.  Great sauces and huge portions.  Check this place out!!!

First time there and enjoyed the food immensely. Had the brisket plate at lunch and the place was packed. Lots of local workers come her to grab a quick lunch and they were in and out in a matter of minutes. The brisket plate was delicious and I had cole slaw with macaroni salad. Both sides were very fresh and good eats. My husband had the cornbread which was excellent in the muffin form. Great portions, good selections, and excellent food. Their sauces are delicious as well. Highly recommend this BBQ joint for everyone.
For some reason honey loves this place. We always get the beef brisket sandwich and share the big boy sampler. I like their honey mustard bbq flavored sauce.

Hidden gem, so not sure I want to share how yummy this food was, they also have different sauces on the table that you can try. I had chicken bowl and chilli cheese fries. Coleslaw was good. They have home made cornbread that is a must try. Some of the kids had the pulled apart pork and others tried the beef... all were satisfied. We stopped in to celebrate my son enlisting in the US Navy.
Bbq and beer!!!  The brisket was amazing and definitely try the mustard sauce.  Great job!

Although this place came highly recommended from my sister, I was pretty  disappointed. We placed a take out order for a family meal to be picked up 45 minutes later. I arrived at the pickup time and had to wait 20 minutes for the food because of understaffing. The meats were all dry without BBQ sauce and there was no BBQ sauce in an extra container. The sausage was tasty, but slightly burnt. As for the sides, the pork-n-beans were good, the Mac-n-cheese average and the side salad fresh but very small. Pretty disappointing overall, but I guess Phoenix isn't really known for BBQ.

Peg and I are always on the lookout for small (as in not a chain of more than a handful) places to eat. Throw in BBQ as a main attraction, and we are ALL in.  Last week, we checked out this place. Almost everytime I go to a BBQ place, I check out the chicken/turkey as you can tell the kind of care that is taken to not overdo. Not only was the chicken wonderfully moist, the pulled pork and brisket was VERY good. A choice of sauces tableside complemented the meal. Side dishes, which have a tendency to be relegated to second class in a lot of BBQ places, were equally tasty and didn't taste like a #10 can of anything. The beans were well simmered with chunks of brisket and the potatoes were roasted and flavorfully seasoned. We would recommend highly...and will be back!  Dr. B
Fresh and delicious each time we go! Beans and Mac n cheese are amazing and the staff are happy and friendly

So Good!  We had our small company Christmas party st the Camelback location and order frequently at the Deer Valley location not only because it is close to home but we also order the Family style and deliver it businesses as a thank you for their business   Great quality, my wife's favorite is the brisket  and I love the ribs!
Tried it Tonight with the family in N Phx location- Picked Up and took home- DELISH!!!  Will be at Camelback location on Friday- awesome!

Ate here tonight because we were shopping at the RV dealer.  It's our second time.  The line was very long and we waited a very long time to order.  However, the prep guy was very friendly, apologizing for the wait and trying to make the best of it.  It was also super hot in the line, we were hot and hungry standing there.  I ordered a half pound of chicken and added pickles and jalepenos on it with mac and cheese salad and potato salad.  Everything tasted great.  The side salads were really really good and the chicken, although the bone/connector joint thingys kept getting in my way, the sauces kept me happy.  All of the sauces made the chicken sing harmonies in my mouth.  It was pricey but I had leftovers for later.  Boyfriend got the brisket and raved about it being juicy and delicious.  My only complaint is the wait in line.  They need more help.

The first time I went, the service and the bbq was awesome!! I went again last night, and the bbq was very good, however, the service was terrible. I guess you need to go before 4pm. I arrived there at 6:15pm and was treated like I was a being an inconvenience for ordering food. The sides are good, but to small especially for a rack of ribs. I also would prefer to be able to order pulled pork, or smoked sausage without a bun or in a sandwich. I still might go back for the great food, but I am very disappointed in the service.

We were craving bbq and i wanted to try some place we have never went to. Usually we just go to Bobby-Q. So Pork on a Fork is definitely a hidden gem is you want some bbq that isn't fine dining . It's a hole in the wall spot that seems to be mixed in with some industrial buildings. You will pass this place if you don't look for the sign that says "bbq".  Now what can I say about this bbq spot. It kind of reminds me of Dickey's bbq but not fast food tasting. Only bc it's a walk up order they put it on a plate for you. This place is actually delicious. The meat super fresh you can tell they take their time with seasoning and cooking. The sides are pretty tasty full of flavor not greasy at all. Super yummy bbq we will totally be back for some more!!
Great BBQ... Was a little skeptical due to the location but this place is a hidden gem!

Fantastic food! Brisket was full of smoke flavor, moist, tender and no sauce needed. The pulled pork was also full of flavor. Mine was a little dry, but my husband said his wasn't and he's a picky BBQ eater being from Texas. I had the beans and coleslaw as my sides and I enjoyed both of them. I wasn't in love with the sauces. I thought they were a little thin. Each sauce had its own distinct flavor. I liked them best when I mixed all three.

It had been awhile since I have been to POAF. I always thought they delivered a good product with friendly consistent service. Unfortunately this is not what we experienced tonight.   When we arrived my wife and I both ordered the same thing, a three meet sampler platter. We were asked what 2 meats we wanted to substitute for brisket. After trying to figure out what they meant and several times being asked the same question we were handed off to another worker. Turns out they were out of chicken and wanted to know what other meet we wanted. Why wouldn't you just say "we are out of chicken, what would you like to substitute". This would have been far less confusing. We both chose sausage as our substitute. The help in general seemed like they didn't care and seemed like they were more distracted than focused on helping us.   Then the employee portioned our meat by weighing it. This was different than what I had experienced before. I can understand that it is important to size your portions but does everything need to be weighed. If that is the case then why not just list the item by weight on the menu. I was curious on how much they gave us so I weighed it when I got home on my digital scale. 4.3 oz of pork, 4.5 oz of brisket for me, 4.6 oz of pork, 4.7 oz of brisket for my wife. If your going to weigh out the portion then you should be consistent. Is the goal to just be under 5oz? The 3rd meat was sausage for both of us. I was given a half link while my wife was given a whole one. Again, not being consistent. We both chose mac and cheese for our side which was really good. The portions are smaller now and put in little portable containers for the hot stuff. I was a little disappointed by the size. I got potato salad as the second side and it was good. My wife got the baked beans. These beans should have been called half baked as they were still hard. The flavor was there but definitely under done.   After paying we were asked if we wanted any sauce. We asked for extra BBQ sauce but was told it costs extra. This would have been good to know before paying.   2 sampler plates without drinks cost just over $27. I think this is overpriced for the amount and quality of our food. I try to support local businesses when possible but I'm sorry to say that we could go to a chain restaurant, get better quality, better service and a lower price. I don't think I will be back anytime soon.

You could do worse for your BBQ fix.  It's a bit pricy for cafeteria style atmosphere. You can expect the staff to screw something up on your order too. The $20/lb. to take some beef brisket home is pretty outrageous.

I've loved Pork On A Fork since the first day I met them at a farmers market.  Their pulled pork & brisket are by far THE BEST anywhere around, and I should know since I am from the midwest where we definitely know BBQ!  I've even got my mother in law hooked & she makes sure to stop by when she is out by their location to get us all some delicious food!

Today I went to Pork On A Fork and ordered the Pulled Pork Sandwich, I got no bun with the (dry) meat they provided. My friend ordered the Monster and no coleslaw on the side, jalapenos were supposed to be on the side and was not either. So I called and complained about the services I had. Jaden said he would talk to the manager and see what can happen, he called back about 25 mins later and just offered me 10% off? We got a better discount with AAA! This is not except-able, I have been in Customer Service over 10 years!!! I will NOT be returning to this place.

My husband and I decided to try this place based off a friend's recommendation. It was ok the meat had some pretty good smoke flavor. The Mac and cheese was also ok it had sat out a little too long and was dry. The cornbread was BURNED literally took it out of wrapper and it crumbled because it was SO dry. If I went back it would be to eat the meat and the meat only.
"no question best BBQ in valley. try the Midwestern monster, yummy in my tummy."

So the food had gone down since I was there last but I thought that maybe it was just an off day so I went back Monday 12/21 and waited in line for 15 mins when I got to order I was told they were out of brisket pork and ribs so all they had was chicken and hot links. I left with nothing. I tried again tonight waited in line again and was told when I ordered ribs they were out. Same story as Monday some surprise order came in. I walked out and won't be back. As someone who is in customer service you really should put a sign out of what is out so people don't waste their time and can go somewhere else

Excellent pulled pork! And the sauce was wonderful. Really yummy waffle fries.  Other than needing more seating ( which I understand they are fixing by expansion) this was a go back to place. Unfortunately we were just visiting from South Florida, too far for takeout!

This is the place for real BBQ....no nonsense, quality meats, and a slow staff that tells you nothing here is rushed!  Their brisquet is perfect, and the choice of sauces keeps your taste buds dancing from meat to meat!
Great BBQ! Highly recommend sides are very good.
After reading reviews I checked them out.  Very good smoked pork. I could see a clean smoke ring in the meat. It was moist and eXtremely flavorful.  I will return again for sure!
All was dry and too heavily salted.   Sides lacked much flavor. We're glad we tried it but we won't be back.
Love the food at Pork on a Fork.  The only downside is that there is limited dining area and the line to order can be long.

I've had lunch here three or four times now as it isn't too far from my work. Each time the BBQ has been very good. No issues with dried out meats or burned anything. The pulled pork is tender and flavorful. The shredded chicken is moist and tender. Anyone who has tried to BBQ chicken on the grill knows how tricky it can be to avoid drying it out.  The staff has always been friendly and helpful.  If you are in the area or in the mood for quality BBQ, give Pork On A Fork a try. I'm a fan :)

Our first time here!  It's my new favorite place for a quick bite!  The flavor in every bite was SO delicious!  I got the bowl with pulled pork, rice, corn, beans, cheese, coleslaw and BBQ sour cream! I wasn't able to eat it all, it was huge!  It was hard to stop though!  SO good!  My husband got the burrito with rice and corn and beans and cornbread on the side. He is a food snob and said it was really good too!

I really really want to give five stars for POF.  I'm thinking even two is too much because the service was just plain horrible. On the two visits..mind you two days apart because the food is excellent, the service was so awful! No hello when walking in the door, a girl behind the counter was rolling her eyes when I couldn't make up my mind...hey, c'mon, everything looks good, let me have a couple of seconds since I've never been here! Second visit, same greeting..i.e. no hello..okay, ordering my food and I mentioned that we were just here on Thursday and the food was so good we had to come back and got zero response from both people behind counter..I was waiting for a great glad to see you back but I got nothing, nada, zip, no response, not even as much as a smile.  Ok then, wow!  The food was great! Don't expect good service here only good food.
Best BBQ in the area!!!! Love it all. We go atleast once a month and its the go to sopt when family comes to town.
The best service. The best food. We'd eat here every day if we could! Our first experience here makes us rave about this restaurant to everyone we know.

Awesome!! Someone told me they had great BBQ, so my family and I decided to pop by on a Sunday afternoon and they were open. Excellent service and amazing BBQ. Everything we had was great!! And we have high expectations for BBQ because we are from Kansas City. Madison was great and very friendly. Highly recommend. They are right by the Deer Valley Airport.
Staff was VERY helpful helping me with my pre ordering questions.  Service was extremely fast.  I had the best baby back ribs ever!

My husband and fellow yelper bookmarked this hidden gem a few months ago. We were downtown today after a meeting at his office, and he suggested we try Pork on a Fork for a late lunch. I agreed and was not disappointed! I love BBQ, and have been to several BBQ joints, and POF was top notch. When I checked in I received an offer of 25% off!! Awesome!  POF is located in an outdoor mall, I felt it was hard to find, as it was our first time here and the signage was lacking letting us know where to go. After walking a bit, we finally found it. We walked in and was met with hello's and big smiles. After reviewing the menu, which is on a digital board, I decided on a pulled pork sandwich. It came with 2 sides and I chose the mac-n-cheese and waffle fries. The fries were fried fresh upon my order, and were hot, crispy and delicious. The mac-n-cheese was omg yummy. It had just a little kick to it, not overwhelming. My sandwich was okay. Here's where my personal preference comes in, although the pork was tender, I felt it was bland and dry. I put the sweet and mild sauce on, and I had to put a lot on to get it to my preference. The bun was soft and fresh. The restaurant was clean and bright. There are several big screen tv's, and colorful art. The prices were reasonable, and the customer service was good. I am glad we came to POF and I can't wait to go back, especially since my husband has their 25% off check in offer as well :) he saves his for later!

Delicious! I had the beef brisket bowl, and totally think the price is worth the meal! I will be coming back here to try other items on the menu! I also liked that they had RC soda, Sunkist and Squirt on their fountain drinks!

Right near the deer valley airport, in a sort of out of the way location exists some of the best bbq in Arizona. The owners are from Nebraska and having lived there for some years, the decor and pictures of small little farms on the wall was a nice touch. I've literally had everything on the menu and NOTHING has been even remotely disappointing. Smoked to perfection and never dry. All the sides are amazing, especially the waffle fries, baked beans, and Mac and cheese. The bbq burrito was an amazing discovery as well. Can't say enough good things about this place!!

Love this place! Pork on a Fork has really stepped up their game. I had stopped going to their Deer Valley location when other options became available, but gave their new location a shot.  BBQ is going through a bit of a renaissance in the valley and it seems to be pushing everyone to do better. Pork on a Fork's brisket is way better than the last time I had it. This location features a quick, simple menu that gets you in and out quickly. Service is friendly, attentive, and fast.  I can only comment on the sides I've had which are the waffle fries, sweet potato fries, and cornbread muffins--all of which are very good.   Their Brisket sandwich is great and their sausage is a great add on. Good quality BBQ fast. Can't complain about that.
Had a pulled pork sandwich from Pork on a Fork today at the Old Town Farmers Market....very very good! Keep up the good work.

This is one of the best BBQ restaurants I have eaten  at!! We got the BBQ sampler with all 4 meats. The chicken was so moist. And all the meat had amazing flavor. For our two sides we got mac and cheese and fries. I loved the smokey flavor that the mac and cheese had. And the fries were nice and crispy on the outside. We will definitely be back.

Went to Pork on a Fork for the first time the other night.  The barbeque was good, I tried ribs, brisket and sausage.  The sausage was great, not overly dried out like a lot of BBQ places tend to be.  The ribs and brisket were both good, but not the best I've ever had.  Their sauces on the table had a decent variety and I enjoyed the spicy one, although it wasn't very spicy.  I wasn't super impressed with the sides.  The mac and cheese seemed a bit grainy to me.  I would come back because it is so much closer to home than Rudy's or Bobby Q's, but not because the food was any better. Overall I would give it a 3.5.

Stopped by to grab lunch today & picked up the "Mini Midwest Monster." It was absolutely delish! Paired my little Sammie with the BBQ Baked Beans & Potato Salad. It doesn't take much to feel me up, so I am stuffed! I'm originally from the Midwest & know a decent BBQ place. I must say it was not bad at all & I will definitely return!

If you are looking for Pulled Pork, Brisquit or BBQ Ribs, look no further than Pork On The Fork BBQ.  This place has all the sides (Coleslaw, Beans, Corn Bread and Mac Salad), spicy sauces and offers clean/efficient service.
Amazing bbq best I have had in Arizona! Nice assortment of sauces too. I highly recommend this place. Just jeep in mind it's not a sit down restaurant. It's take out  but there is seating outside.

The menu on this page is not the menu for this location. We were looking forward to waffle fries and chicken tenders but they don't have a fryer. The meat is tough and sides are bland!! Will not be back - very disappointed. If you want bbq, go to little miss bbq!!
Ron Swanson would approve of this place.  Meat, meat, meat... simple and always cooked perfectly.  For the carnivores in your family take them to this low key, unpretentious barbecue place!
excellent! went today and had pork, chicken and brisket. VERY good. The side's left something to be desired, the coleslaw and potatoes salad were bland.  The emphasis is clearly on the meat.

I have had BBQ all over the country from Ny to cal from Washington to Florida I can tell u for a fact the people and food at this place are top notch. Everything on the menu is smoked to perfection .The prime rib they serve would cost twice as much any where else and still would not taste as good. I eat there at least twice a week sometimes more ,they greet you with smiles and are always helpful to explain any of the food and let you sample some,Try that any where else ,it will not happen.

Keep coming back to this booth at the Ahwatukee Farmer's Market for more porky goodness! LOVE the $12 bag of pulled pork, had it with their new BBQ sauce, yummy and easily two meals. Have had both the bone-in and boneless chops, equally good. Think I'm leaning towards the boneless only due to my preparation...I butterflied and stuffed them with French bread, sweet onions, garlic, gorgonzola and prosciutto..drool! Check them out, you won't be disappointed! My hubby and I go after our standing Sunday appt with our trainer. Love it because they give you samples, and I'm usually starving by then!!!

When my husband and I first came across Pork on a Fork's listing we giggled at the name and vowed to try it if only for the name. We found the perfect opportunity to try POAF when LivingSocial featured them as the local daily deal. After leaving Texas 2+ years ago I thought I would never find good bbq again. Thank you, Pork on a Fork for restoring my faith that you don't have to go to a BBQ-infused state to get great BBQ!   We will return time and time again for their amazing sandwiches and the "f this diet" waffle fries. It is a bit out of the way for me to drive but I would be a liar if I said it wasn't worth it. I would go so far as to say this has got to be the best BBQ joint in Phoenix.

This place is SOOO good !! I usually DONT like BBQ but this was good ! I ate everything  on my plate (usually I don't , I pick) .. 4 different sauces to choose from , friendly staff , fast service. I will def be back ! And will recommend to my friends ;)

Went to POAF, they are a little pricey, but seriously the brisket hit the spot. Nice and smokey, had great flavor (when does a brisket not?), wasn't drenched in sauce. To be honest i could have eaten it without adding any sauce. So delicious. Their sauces are good too.   The line was a little confusing but i figured it out pretty quickly. Get there before 11:45. that is when the rush gets in there.
Really good!! Drove past this place every day and now I'm glad I stopped in. Kids eat free on Mondays!  Delish!!!

I like Pork on a Fork. While not quite as enthusiastic as others might be, I do feel that in terms of those in need of a quick barbeque fix, they're a respectable option. The best? Not quite - but that's not really a "knock" when you look at some of the people they're competing against.  This location in particular, can be easily missed if you're not careful, as it's located in a plaza that's across from the Deer Valley Airport. It's definitely a unique setup, but I feel that it works well with the type of food and environment they're shooting for.  During both visits, my girlfriend and I had their pulled pork sandwich, which is our default choice during barbeque outings. We both agreed that it was decent.  I really like the variety of sauces they have on hand, making certain that you'll find something that "works" for your taste buds.  Sadly, I do feel this place suffers from what I find is a recurring issue with most barbeque places in that, while they've mastered the meat, the sides are always hit or miss. Cornbread muffins are a bit on the drier side, while the macaroni and cheese seems kind of generic. Unfortunately, it has either been phased out or isn't always available, as I was stuck with macaroni salad on our second visit. I can't provide a fair opinion on mac salad since I've intensely loathed it since childhood.  They've since opened up a second location and seem to be doing very well, which is good to hear. Hopefully, they'll continue to grow and tweak things over time. Come to think of it, we haven't stopped by in awhile and it might be time to pay them another visit.   Recommended to try out.

Wandering about looking for a lunch spot we chanced upon POAF to satisfy the bbq craving that had arisen. Spotted amongst the squarish buildings we parked in the special named spaces and sauntered in to be greeted by the food choice line to pick the various meats and preps thereof to create our bbq magnificence. Our party partook in the original with pork, chicken and sausage, whilst the other two in our party decided on salads with pulled pork on top. Weirdly for the side salad with the original there was a choice to include cherry tomatoes but not for the full salads...unclear why this was the case. Regardless the waffle fries and corn bread was quite appreciated on quality. It's not inexpensive - USD12-14 per person but seemingly worth it. A good place if bbq is your thing.
The best smoked food! My favorite sandwich is a beef brisket wrapped in a tortilla! Nice, friendly atmosphere with great employees.

I had been searching for a good BBQ place (specifically a place with good pulled pork) and look no further. This place has lots of options, great sides (I got the waffle fries and pasta salad) and excellent sauce!   The pulled pork sandwich was so tender it was ridiculous. Very tangy BBQ sauce, delicious.   It looks small in the pictures, but there's more seating in the back, and holy cow it's huge!   I will definitely be coming back.  *edit* I have been back a few times, and the food is consistently good. If you rated this place bad, you might have just gotten unlucky. It's definitely good BBQ. The best around, easily. If you think shanes is better, you really have no idea what good BBQ is...

This place has the best brisket bowels and they are fast. I think the best part is that they are one of the restaurants that use Users delivery service. From the time I decided to order till Uber brought it to my door hot none the less was then then an hour.

I got the brisket sandwich and its one of the best and all the bbq sauces are great.   The baked beans are probably the best ive ever had also and bbq is my go to places. the mac n cheese I didn't care for.  Will be back when im in town and I will be getting the brisket again

First time here. I got the Deluxe Sampler (chicken, pork, brisket) and 2 sides (cornbread, Mac+cheese) because I wanted to try a little bit of everything.  It's not easy finding a good BBQ place in Arizona. This is the best one I've been to. All the meats were melt-in-your-mouth tender. My favorite was the brisket. Plastic fork, no knife needed for any of it. 4 sauces at the table (sweet, smoky, hot, zippy mustard) so you can have your choice of sauce. I tried them all and the sweet BBQ was my favorite.   Everything is made from scratch. The Mac and cheese was a strong co-star in the dish. I would have given 5 stars but the soda machine was broken so it was only tea, and I wanted a Coke to wash it all down with.  Very positive and recommended experience. I will be back for sure.

Went to visit Pork on a Fork for dinner on a Friday night with my wife.  I'll start with the bad, because there is only one bad thing about the place - it is difficult to find.  It's in a quasi-industrial strip mall and does not have clear signage.  That said, spending the time to find it was worth the wait.    The Location:  No-thrills, semi-divey joint.  Very clean.  My only beef with the location is that it was hard to find.  The Meal:  I had the Smokin' Meal, which has pulled pork, brisket, sausage, and two sides.  The pulled pork was good; very tender and juicy, not dry at all.  The brisket had a nice char on the outside and was beautiful to look at with some very clear smoke rings.  It wasv also very good.  The sausage almost stole the show.  It was perfectly spicy, had just the right amount of snap, and left me wanting more.  I chose corn bread and baked beans for my sides.  The baked beans were great and had burnt ends mixed in.  They were a little on the sweet side for my taste, but still very, very good.  The corn bread, likewise, was good.  Really, though, the meal wasn't about the sides.  If I could have just had the meat I would have (although I lack the self-control for that sort of nonsense.)   My wife had the pulled pork sandwich.  It too came with two sides (corn bread and macaroni and cheese).  She enjoyed the sandwich, particularly with their mild sauce on it (I forget what they name it).  The mac and cheese, which I craftily (no pun intended) stole a large amount of, was great.  It's not fancy, baked, bacon and breadcrumbs restaurant style mac, but is what Kraft Mac and Cheese would be if it was any good.  Bottom line, delicious.  The Service:  Great.  Everyone at the restaurant was very friendly.  The Price:  Affordable.  The Smokin' Meal, which could have fed two people, was around $10.00.  The Pulled Pork Sammie was about $8.00.  Very reasonably priced considering the amount and quality of the food.  Overall:  Will DEFINITELY return to Pork on a Fork.  Bring friends.  I would think that it was worth the drive even if I had come from South Phoenix.  I think it is the best barbecue that I've eaten in the valley.

best barbecue is Arizona.  I dare you to try and finish the mixed grill burrito.  My one gripe is that it's set up like an every day lunch place, but $15 is to spendy for me to do too often  Editing this review because of a bad experience I had when placing a large order for a work function.  I called an hour in advance, and they told me it would be ready in45 minutes.  When I got there 15 minutes after the time they said, the it wasn't even started.  I couldn't wait, so they lost a two hundred dollar order.    Very frustrating experience, and it makes me think they aren't ready to take the next step building the business.

Three out of five stars...  The food was excellent but the service was shitty, we walked in and the menu was backwards from the door. But what got me was all the kids working didn't do a damn thing to sell the amazing food in front of them. I felt as though I was an inconvenience to them, when all I wanted was to eat. I will try it again... I just hope the enthusiasm of the staff increases, because this place has the ability to be great!

Stopped by on Saturday - being born & raised in TX I thought I would fulfill a BBQ need.  Purchased two plates... Pulled pork sandwich w/2 sides consisting of waffle fries & the macaroni salad 2nd plate was a Sausage sandwich w/2 sides consisting of cold slaw & BBQ beans.  1.  Pulled pork sandwich = meat was generous, tasty and flavorful.  The BBQ sauce the provided added much flavor and was sweet and smooth - very good.  The waffle fries were very tasty, not hot enough... I would have liked them warmer but they were flavorful.  The macaroni salad was your standard "picnic macaroni salad" but had a lot of flavor to it.  2.  Sausage sandwich = generous serving and also flavorful (crisp casing and not greasy).  The slaw was a "no" not good - strange flavor, spicy cabbage.  The beans were average (mushy from over cooking) but flavorful.  Storefront was clean, quiet and almost empty (not a good sign or it could have been too late for lunch crowd - but on a Sat?).  The staff was friendly, cordial and quick.  They took my order timely and had it to me at the end of the counter and ready to go (and the order was correct).  Pricing was average, after all meat is expensive no matter where you go and you are paying for a MEAL (with two sides).  Overall rating... a 4 to 4.5.  I definitely will come back here when I get the need for beef... BBQ beef (or pork) that is.

Pretty good bbq joint for Arizona and they offer a good selection. I eat lunch here about four times a year, so I would recommend it if you are in the area.  I normally stick with the pulled pork and sausage, but their ribs look pretty good as well.  In summary, I like Little Miss BBQ more, but I will continue to support this local joint as much as I can when I am in north Phoenix.
The baked beans and coleslaw are good. I got the pork with bun the meat is tender and the bun is great. Good for a quick BBQ fix...

Went to Pork on a Fork based on the great reviews seen here on Yelp!  The reviews were dead on.  This place had the most tender pork and brisket I have had in a while.  I also tried the ribs and they were amazing.  We actually got there 10 minutes to close and were going to just get it to go, but they talked us into eating there.  The location isn't the greatest so they will definitely need some word of mouth.  Also it should be known that their hours are limited (10-7 Mon-Fri only).  We were told that there usually is a line at lunch time.  We will definitely be going back and this time be cognizant of the hours.

Wow! Absolutely Amazing BBQ!!!!   this place allows you to choose your meat (brisket, pulled pork, chicken, pork, sausage, etc) and then they have 4 different barbecue sauces. They have a tangy mustard, a sweet one And a regular barbecue. The regular barbecue sauce was my favorite.  The portions are amazing. I got two sides with a sandwich. The mac and cheese you gotta try with their special spice. At first, I said no thanks to the spice but then the guy said that he'll just sprinkle a little on. I thought that was weird at first, but I'm so glad he did it.   First Step, pick if you want a burrito, bowl, sandwich, Etc. Second Step, pick your meat and then two sides. I got the waffles fries and the mac and cheese.  Gosh how I wish you guys had one of these in California

My favorite BBQ spot in AZ. I usually get the beef brisket with macaroni and cheese and waffle fries. The meat is cooked really well: it is almost always tender and juicy. They also have good variety of BBQ sauces, from standard to sweet then spicy.  If you're really hungry you can get the sampler plate for around $11 though, that could feed two people in my opinion.  Don't let the outside fool you, this place is great and there is plenty of room for overflow in the back.
Outstanding place for lunch!  Tried the BBQ sampler and everything was terrific.  The baked beans are great and their BBQ sauces are all very tasty.  Great service and top notch BBQ.

The food was wonderful and the workers were very helpful to a couple of first timers. We will certainly be coming back soon. The sample and Midwest monster filled us up with food to spare, an all around great experience.

True BBQ is BBQ that doesn't need sauce to make it taste good.  This place does an excellent job at doing just that.  The meat comes in its purest form - straight off the bbq or smoker.  You put your own sauce on.   We had the pulled pork, chicken, ribs, and brisket.  We all agreed - it was yummy. The pork was my favorite but since I don't eat brisket, I was down to 3 choices.  The chicken was good - not as good as I've had but it was juicy so can't beat that.  The ribs were really good - tender with the perfect bbq grill taste.  For sides we had, the cornbread and mac salad.  Nothing out of the ordinary but I'd get both again.  Next time I'm trying the sausage and mac n cheese.   It comes with rolls but that's just fillers.  One tip, this place is SOOOO Hard to find esp, at night.  We all missed it (3 dif. cars) and kept thinking we had the wrong address.    It is in a business park area across the street from the airport.  Look for the Honeywell building's red sign across and turn into the driveway.

I grew up in Texas and like to think I know a good BBQ, This place is not it.  Their "lunch special" (11.99$) comes with two fatty slices of tough brisket, served luke-warm on a store bought bun. I had a tiny cornbread muffin for .50$ and substandard mac and cheese. The food was "meh" at best. Below par sides I could forgive, but the BBQ being bad? That is sacriledge! The brisket was tough, had no flavor and was about 30% fat by volume, which means they hadn't cooked it long enough for the fat to melt through the meat (perhaps why it had the lack of flavor?).  I'd give this place a hard pass.
clean, sleek and quiet in the afternoon PLUS the smoked chicken was probably the juiciest i have ever had.

Excellent baby back ribs. the meat is tender and the seasoning is right on. this one is not the dry rub version. but slow cook with sauce that caramelize all over the ribs.  don't use the sauce, because it can ruin the rib taste. just savor the meat. this place is a keeper in phoenix.

By far the best bbq in North phoenix, the Midwest monster is amazing, food always tastes fresh like it never seems your getting day old food.  Parking lot kinda sucks and fills up fast but well worth it for the food
This place was recommended to me and I finally got to try it. Awesome food and great service. Will be back!

We were in town on Business. Was referred to by my local Business Associate. What a great place, food was great and so was the service. Our Sever Brooke gave us a location were to go for pool and darts. Had some electronic issues, General Mgr Jake helped me feel at ease....Thank you POAF, I'll be back soon

Just an update, my wife has also started really enjoying this place.  The shocker to this is that she is a vegetarian. She loves some of the side items (Waffle Fries, Mac & Cheese, Corn Bread, etc.)  She will meet me here for lunch on occasion. I convinced her to try a tiny bit of the pulled pork, and surprisingly she said the flavor was very good.

I was so excited to try this Bar B Q!   New location on 19th & Camelback.  HORRIBLE!!!  The meat was dry and hard!I would guess they were overcooked!  The coleslaw had no taste whatsoever.  The bake beans taste the way dirty, sweaty socks smell!  I am so mad and upset!!!  $16.00 totally wasted!  Believe it or not, I actually have had better at Aj's (when I can't get to Bobby Ques quickly).  I should have known the ribs were not that good, because it was only 3 - 4 people in there at what should have been their busiest time of day!  I wish you well Pork on a fork, because I will not be a repeat customer!

Pulled pork was moist, sauce choices were nice, staff very friendly, but too bad they're Cornhusker fans. :-)   This place is getting busy and time to find a larger location but the small, quaint ambience gives it that small town local barbecue place feel.   Better than Dillon's.   Cole slaw was crunchy and not runny. Potato salad is perfect. I don't like macaroni salad and theirs was good. Ribs were fall off the bone.   Just a really good place.

BBQ Done right, Awesome SMOKEY Flavor!  Got the brisket sandwich, coleslaw & sweet potato fries.  Sandwich was rockin! Enjoyed every bit of it!  You can tell they know what they are doing . . . Rich and Flavorful rub with some VERY NICE sauces to complement.  We LOVED the spicy!  Look forward to going back soon!  Only complaint: the brisket was not trimmed, so there were a few mouths full of fat that were not pleasant . . . but I guess its to be expected sometimes.

No. Noooo thank you.  My friend ranted and raved about this place - it sounded good, close to work, and I was in the mood for some BBQ.  I purchased a pulled chicken BBQ sandwich, side of mac and cheese, and.... waffle fries I think (obviously, unforgettable). Within the first bite of my chicken sammich, I found a chicken joint thing within the chicken.... There was only a bun, pulled chicken, and bone fragments (no additional toppings).  They did have a lot of different types of sauces and they were great (hence the two stars instead of one)!  The mac and cheese was super bland and mushy.  The actual restaurant is near deer valley airport, in an office plaza, and has an industrial feel to the inside.  If you really like BBQ, check it out, but check the food before you take your first bite!

Best BBQ since we left Oklahoma!  Very midwest BBQ- just as advirtised!  Loved that they offered for us to taste any side we wanted.  Smoked flavor was awesome, but not overwhelming!  We got the PoBoy and the Midwest Monster!  All the meats were wonderful!  I love the sauces on the side.  We tried them all and every bite had a different flavor.  Waffel fries were crisp and full of flavor.  The baked beans tasted like my homemade 2 day cooked beans.  Prices not bad for portion size.  Very friendly staff.  We went at 5 PM on a Friday and we had no problems with parking or a table.  This is our new favorite place and plan to go once a week.
Been here several times. BBQ is excellent as is the sides. Service is fast as the BBQ is pre made and ready. Plenty of seating in back area.
Got take out yesterday. That was a mistake. The ribs were over cooked and very dry and the potato salad was swimming in a spicy mayo concoction. Won't be going back.

BBQ to die for. I am definitely not a lover of brisket and wanted to ask the lady serving me to switch it out, but I was floored. The brisket is moist and tender and melted in my mouth. I always avoided brisket because it is normally dry and tough. I don't know what their secret is, but it definitely was the best on the plate. All of the meats were moist and juicy with a delicate smokiness. I liked that it was not overpowering.  I had the baked beans and coleslaw for my sides and both were delicious. Beans were well seasoned and slow cooked so that the flavors were developed through out. The coleslaw was crisp and well seasoned My favorite sauce was the tangy bbq. The hot was too salty for my taste but worked well if mixed together.  Service was great and would recommend for lunch or dinner.

Ok; thought I'd give this place a try.   Food was mehhhh. Sandwich was dry meat was dry and chewy.   They serve it to you in styrofoam containers; plastic utensils. Way to be environmentally friendly.   No thanks.

Ok, this place is good. I think is much better that the dickies bbq four great sauces. Clean place. Believe it or not the food had a smoked taste. I got a combo 3 meats for 11.00, that is too cheap... with 2 sides. This place is a solid 4 stars

Wow. I can't Believe It took me so long to finally visit Pork in the Fork! Even though I've been seeing all the positive reviews for a while. Well I bought a Groupon several months ago for it and I totally forgot about and came on my last day. Man this was some serious good BBQ! We ordered a pulled pork and a brisket sandwich with Mac n cheese and corn bread and a side of waffle fries. Now I'm picky on BBQ and I think I can smoke some good meat in my backyard..but this was out of this world. The pulled pork was great..best I've ever had at a restaurant. And the brisket was full of flavor and I could really taste the smoke. I will come back and make it a regular stop.   Located in a small strip mall across from DV airport..it's easily missed. Not much for ambiance inside but the back room is alright  with a few tvs. I'd prob take out next time and they take phone orders so I will order some take out.   All in all POAF is the best BBQ in the Phoenix area. I've been to the great Salt Lick in Austin and this gives overall food a run for their money.

Why is this place that is so hard to find behind a coffee shop in a industrial area doing so well?  The food!  I only came here because of the great Yelp reviews and Arlin B. seems to like the same things I do.  Just like everyone says "the pork is unbelievably tender".  I dont even like pork but I had to try it since so many people were talking it up here.  Well, I can now tell you that I like pork......as long as its from POAF!  Place has expanded to the garage area in back for more seating but we came early so it was not packed yet.  They open at 10am which is awesome for me since I eat breakfast at 6-7 and am usually hungry again by 10.  Service was great, the lady at the counter was super nice and I cant wait to go back.

Ate here last night and the BBQ plate that I had was so so.  Beef brisket was tough, shredded chicken was a tad too dry and the pulled pork was ok. Ended throwing away the brisket! The corn bread was so small it shouldn't be considered a side!  It was just meat and 2 sides and they don't even give you bread or roll.  In Texas where I came from, BBQ there is so much better and they give you all the hot rolls you want!!  Since moving back to Phoenix we had tried other BBQ places here and they were better!  Well tried this place one more time 5-1 -17. Most likely will never come back! Had their pulled pork sandwich and the bun was very stale and hard! Pulled pork was terrible and had so many hard pieces in it. Had a side salad and it just came with lettuce and a couple of cherry tomatoes with ranch dressing that tasted like it was old! I think I'll go now over to Dickeys instead!!

We began our exploration of their BBQ when they first opened up shop at the Deer valley location. It was pretty good BBQ back then so it was easier to deal with the sub par customer service and banal conditions of the restaurant. On our most recent visit, the quality of the food had plummeted wherefore there is no longer a single redeeming factor. The restaurant is dirty, staff appears to be marginally invested in assisting customers, cost is too high for what you get, and our final thoughts upon leaving were "not going to be back anytime soon (if ever).  There are lots of new BBQ places popping up all over the valley making it much easier to be more selective!

By far some of the most amazing bbq in the valley. While wait times can be excessive during lunch it's completely worth it. If you can plan ahead to order online that would be preferred otherwise you'll wait in line... But it's so worth it. Try a Midwest monster and their Mac and cheese.

On a whim my boyfriend decides this is the place for BBQ  he raves about how AWESOME the pulled pork is!! We walk in and it smells amazing! The young girl (blonde w/glasses) behind the counter seems a bit not happy she really must not like working here. Anyhow after waiting sometime in line we reach the said girl and you are out of pulled pork!!! How does PORK ON A FORK RUN OUT OF PORK??? On a Saturday evening  Hmmm maybe next time if there is one hahaha

This little BBQ spot has lots of choices for a good meal. A huge variety of meats, lots of fixins and sides and a wonderful sampling of sauces. I stopped in after visiting a nearby gun shop who said the food was good. They were right.      I had the brisket, slaw, beans and added a couple of ribs to try them. The best item was the ribs. Cooked nicely with a good crust, nice smoke ring and lots of flavor. I enjoyed the brisket. I'm hard to please when it comes to brisket. Most places have bland brisket, mostly because they don't smoke it right. I really like the flavor of this brisket. I will admit that it could have been a little moister but the fact that it tasted good compensated for it.      Both sides were very good. I look forward to trying the pulled pork next time.      I (as always) tried all the sauces. They were all good, but the regular sauce was the best.      If I lived close by, this would be a weekly place to eat.      I'd say this is the 4th best BBQ place I've been to in the valley in my 30 years here. I still have more to try, but this place will be hard to beat.
