Delicious! Best BBQ so far in Phoenix I've had. Portions are huge, meats and sides are very flavorful. Definitely get everytbing in a burrito atleast once.

I've been living in this area for two years now and I recently discovered this place. It's tucked away and resembles many other businesses in the area. In fact, the dining room was converted from a garage. This restaurant may have once been an auto shop, and that's part of its appeal. Pork on a Fork is a diamond in the rough. The food is great and the prices are reasonable. Will definitely be coming back for more.
Been here 2 times for lunch. You get lots of flavorful food. Line is kind of slow but it;s worth it.

Really great food - taste, texture, temperature and appearance are all fantastic. Dining hall is clean and new with a few big screen tvs.  This restaurant is hidden away in a office storage/warehouse complex. No sign on the street (that I could see), you just have to trust that maps is bringing you to the right place.

I've never posted a good or bad review on yelp, but this place is just a solid disappointment and for one main reason......the service (you order at a counter) is brutally slow.  whether there is 1 person in line or 10 the younger aged crew seems to work in slow motion.   the food is good, and i understand good things come to those who wait, but waiting in line for 20-30 minutes at times for half a dozen customers in front of you is absurd.  i waited three hours at franklins in austin, but the line was literally around the neighborhood but they execute the ordering extremely efficiently and very quick.   i've owned a restaurant, but don't think i'm being overly critical just because of that, i just understand how quick they could execute but it truly pains me to watch the counter help move as slow as they do.  the food is already cooked ladies and gentleman, let's get a move on it.   i won't be bringing my $$$ or referrals there until they realize that it's good food but not worth the ridiculous wait to take food to go or eat in.  makes me want to almost open up a bbq joint nearby just to show their current customers that you don't have to wait for just good bbq.

OMG the best baby back ribs I have ever tasted. My favorite baby back ribs before this food experience was the Mason Jar in Mahwah NJ. I have always compared baby back ribs to the Mason Jar to see if any would compare. After over ten years of searching I have found the perfect baby back rib to beat the Mason Jar. Pork on a fork is truly world class. No need for the BBQ sauce but they have a nice variety and I tried two that I liked. The hot BBQ sauce and the Carolina BBQ style sauce were both excellent on my ribs. However you know you are eating excellent ribs when you keep forgetting to pour on the sauce. Pork on the fork ribs were tender fall off the bone delicious. I will return and bring all my rib loving friends.

Stopped in for an early dinner. It wasn't at all crowded. But still a nice vibe to the place. The guy preparing meals behind the counter was very nice and patient with us newbies. I had a brisket bowl - never thought to have BBQ that way. It was really good. The brisket was very tender and juicy with a bit of crust on the edges. Lots of choices for toppings/additions. My husband had a pulled pork sandwich. He thought the pork was a little fatty for his taste, but once he got rid of some of the fat he thought it was very good. And their Cole slaw is near perfect in my book - creamy with a just right sweet/tangy flavor. Another great place to eat in our new neighborhood.
Ordered the barbecue sampler and 2 sides of bbq sauce and when I got home there was no bbq sauce. Missing the best part made me realize the meat had a chemical taste. Very disappointed.
The BBQ was fantastic... I've been trying for 2 weeks to no avail to get a response for catering a party..  They must not need the buisness

The food was amazing.   The pork was tender - chicken flavorful - as well as brisket and smoked sausage.    We got sampler dishes with Mac and cheese, corn, and potato salad.  Price to me was perfect for the amount of food given.   Only gave four stars because the service could have been quicker.   Went on a Saturday afternoon and only had two people working up front with a line to the door.     Took 20 minutes to order and take food out door.  But food is worth wait.

Went here on lunch with a co worker. VERY good food! We had the pulled pork, cole slaw, potato salad and cornbread. Excellent food, excellent service. My recommendation: have the mac and cheese every day! :)

Pork On A Fork, I had such high hopes.  It started with a phone call...  I called to make a takeout order and was put on hold immediately. I hung up after a long 5 minutes. Ok, no big deal - they're busy with their lunch rush, that's a good thing, right?  Except when I got there they weren't busy (anymore perhaps). Whatever, no biggie. A young couple was in front of me and it took about 10 minutes for me to talk to a person that could take my order. Again, not a huge deal, I'm a pretty patient person. I ordered the Midwest Monster, a sandwich that makes waves around town and even on Triple D with Guy. The description looked amazing. But it's too bad my sandwich was missing both the cheese and the slaw. It was a package of meat and a couple slices of jalape√±o, foil wrapped and in between the buns. Nothing else. What a let down. Should I have been watching the girl make my sandwich? Who knows. So I had to slather the whole stack of somewhat dry meat and bread with some BBQ sauce and came away disappointed and $13 poorer. The Mac and cheese was good but I honestly think the corn bread was the best part. I'm all about second chances, so maybe it'll be better next time. But even if the order was made correctly, I didn't get that wow factor I was expecting from all the accolades and press this place has gotten. It's divey, doesn't have that mom and pop BBQ feel, and just was unimpressive. I guess that's the problem with building a place up so much...ok, I'm just rambling now. So, to make a long story longer: They were poor on the phone Slow to take your order Failed at making my item correctly. Cornbread was delicious. Girls working were cute.
Not sure how the meat is cooked, but the pork lost its texture and disintegrated when eaten. Strange how the texture of the meat was so off. Nice service. Bummer.
Our go-to place for BBQ out and for family events at home!  Everything is great, the meats, the sides, the service!

If I could give pork on a fork no stars I would.... so about 7 months ago I ate here and got violently ill. I haven't been back till today. Not only does the staff scratch their faces and handle non food items without changing their gloves and lick their fingers to separate the to-go bags, but I get to the register and ask for 4 BBQ sauce sides. The girl proceeds to tell me that I only get 1 tiny side of BBQ sauce for free, and the rest I have to pay extra for. A BBQ place that charges for BBQ sauce?!!! I hope you enjoy the extra $.82 you received from me because I will never come back. That is absolutely ridiculous. Hope I don't get sick again. I think the owners should put more time and effort into safe food handling procedures and less time worrying about charging for BBQ sauce.

Oh my god this place gets a five out of five star review!!! Why??? Because they are that freaking awesome that's why!!! Let me tell you I have been craving barbecue for a long time but I'm very picky about my barbecue, but Yelp suggested this place to me and I read all the reviews and decided to give it a go and I am soooooo glad I did!!! This is definitely bookmarked and my new favorite barbecue spot. :D   So let's talk about the food, I ordered the Midwest monster (which comes with not one but TWO sides) and for my side I chose the honey barbecue beans and the mac & cheese. Both sides were freaking phenomenal! The mac & cheese was just as cheesy as I like it, and the honey baked beans literally reminded me of barbecues with my family. The Midwest monster- ugh! To die for!!! It's half pork and a half brisket, The meet is nice, juicy and tender and mix with all the right flavors! For my drink I got a sweet tea (i'm addicted to sweet tea) and not everybody sweet tea is good, but there is exactly what you expect Southern Sweet tea to taste like. :)  On top of everything else the staff was extremely friendly, the establishment was clean, and the atmosphere was nice. Definitely coming back for you!

Seriously, this is the best bbq pork ever! I absolutely love POAF, and every time my family visits, they want to eat here! The sauces are so good, but truly the meat doesn't even need any! Oh, and the sides are soooo delicious, too!!!

I work across the lot from this place and have been dying to try it out.  Unfortunately I work graveyard shifts and they close before my shift begins.  I learned last week that they were going to start staying open till 7 on Fridays.  Finally I would get my chance!  let me tell you I was not disappointed!  I ordered the pulled pork sammich, cornbread and potato salad.  The pulled pork was tender, juicy, smokey and porky!  I got half way through the sandwich when I realized I forgot BBQ sauce it was that good.   The staff were incredibly friendly and the food came out very fast.

Sadly, it's gone downhill in recent years.  I still enjoy the ribs (the full rack comes with two sides) but the sides are servings for one person and not two as they used to be.  I asked for ketchup for the fries and a staff member had to run to the back eating area to fill a cup. Had to ask for BBQ sauce on a "to go" order.  And while placing my order over the phone I asked the employee to remind me of the address and she had to ask someone else.  Yep, the employees don't know the address of their work.  Hope a fire doesn't break out.

Tasty new BBQ choice close to home.   Been for lunch a couple of times, the Big Boy Sampler is my favorite (chicken, pork, brisket, sausage).  Meat was flavorful and well prepared.  Good selection of BBQ sauces and beers.   The brisket is particularly tasty.   Tried a few sides, like the cornbread muffin, mac & cheese, and sweet potato fries.   Recommended.

Believe the Hype!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! This place Rocks!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Definitley in my Top 3 BBQ I have ever had & I've been to Texas & the rest of the South! Best Pulled Pork & brisket hands down!! Also the best Mac & Cheese. Only complaint I have, is of their 4 sauces, I only loved one(Sweet & Mild), but the meat was so, tender juicy & delicious, it didn't need much sauce, if at all. Keep up the good work. I live within 5 miles, so they have a new regular customer for a long time!!!!!!!

Second time here wasn't so grand. My bowl was quite a bit smaller than the first time, same amount of meat but everything else was scarce. They were out of de pepper and claimed none of them knew how to change it. Umm okay.

When they first opened I believe the quality of the meat was at its height. I remember the brisket being smoky, juicy and tender. I ordered the brisket the other day and it was just ok. The brisket plate could use some bread with it.

After class, around 7pm, I decided to eat here on the recommendation of the instructor. My mistake. The baby back ribs were overdone, like they'd been sitting in the oven since the early morning. Since I had a to-go order, I was the "winner" by receiving ribs that were tough and dry. Not a "best ribs" place at all. Less than a 1-star rating.

Pull pork sandwich with Mac and cheese and potato salad.  All were very tasty!  I tried some of my dad's sampler plate.  The sausage that came with it was delicious and the chicken was moist and flavorful.  I will definitely be coming back to try more off of the menu.

Pork on a Fork is a hidden treasure. Real BBQ is an art. Picasso and da Vinci are in the building! Actually, Wes and Justin (the owners) are as passionate/nice as you can get. As soon as you walk in, you get gently smacked in the face with "the smell." Then they follow through with "the taste." Pulled pork, brisket, ribs, and hot links will make you a big fan of the art of BBQ.

I took a chance and tried this place out for their catering for a work event for 50 people for the first time, and I have to say, we were all very impressed!!! Not a single person had anything bad to say about the food, in fact everyone was talking about how good it was. We ordered 10lbs each of the pulled pork and shredded chicken, which was all very juicy and delicious. We also got the large pans of Mac n cheese, cole slaw, and potato salad. Our order was ready for pickup just before our scheduled pick up time which was great, and the helpful guys carried it all out to my car and made sure to place the cole slaw on top so it didn't get hot. Great customer service!! They are also on fivestars, so with that big order I also earned a couple free meals and I've redeemed one so far- the brisket with some Mac and cheese and the sweet potato fries. The brisket was AMAZING!!!! Better than some of the "best" BBQ places in a couple cities that I have tried! Was very tender juicy and flavorful and just melted in my mouth. The sweet potato fries were also perfect, crispy on the outside and soft and hot on the inside. Sauces were also very delicious! Will definitely be back, order again for catering, and recommend to my friends. And a side note their bathroom was extremely clean and smelled good, lol! Thanks so much Pork on a Fork keep up the great w(p)ork!!!

Food is good, if not evenly done. Each time is an experiment in inconsistent portions, techniques and in getting your order right. Prices are fair. Today, however, loud rap music with vulgar lyrics with the F-word be shouted out over and over while there were children about. I don't care for profanities being shouted from the speakers while I eat. I really like the food, but I find the aptitude of the staff leaves a lot to be desired and may try once more before I see if things improve before giving up permanently.

From Chicago and Came out to Pork on a Fork. Their mop sauce and mild BBQ sauce is absolutely delicious. I really enjoyed the Coke slaw and Mac and cheese. The atmosphere is traditional BBQ at its best. The owner has put his love and soul into this place and it's obvious. Support local independent restaurants. They are the back bone of this country, not chains.

I am always looking for great BBQ and Pork on a Fork fit the bill perfectly. It is not a normal restaurant space since the restaurant is in a warehouse district. You order in the front of the warehouse and seating is in the back. I ordered the sampler and found the brisket to be tender and flavorful. The pork and the sausage were also cooked to perfection and flavorful. My sides were the coleslaw and mac and cheese. The coleslaw was ok...not great. The mac and cheese was average. They had multiple options for sauce and I always go for the sweet...and it was very sweet. My only complaint was the bread. It was basically small hamburger buns. I don't know if they gave that so that I could make sandwiches with the brisket and pork or what their thinking was. I would have preferred some other bread.

I noticed when this place opened because I love great BBQ and the fixins. I was REALLY disappointed. for  $14 and some change I tried the Brisket sandwich with Cole slaw, cornbread and a drink. 2.25 for a med sided drink is high-even with free refills. the sweet and mild BBQ sauce was tasty but the sandwich was short on meat, the cornbread was no different than I make at home, room temp and served with a cold butter pat.  The cole slaw left a lot to be desired. It lacked luster, flavor and actually seemed dry. I exchanged it for potato salad that tasted slightly better than the stuff sold at grocery. The last gets the star..tasty. If you know good BBQ you will be disappointed. Staff was friendly and helpful.

Decided to give these guys a try on my way home from work yesterday.   I walked in to order take out.   I ordered the chopped pork sandwich, with waffle fries and corn muffin.   When I got home, no fries, and it wasn't like they were busy or anything.   Too bad, because the pork was fairly tasty.   I would have rated them higher, but the service was lacking.

Normally this wouldn't be my type of establishment to come to with a sign greeting you upon entering that says "all of our meat comes naked."  I overlook this statement as their pulled pork is amazing and bbq choices are top notch.  This place is located right near the Deer Valley airport in a boring business center, but when you serve great food it really doesn't matter where your location is.  Expect a line to get into the place during peak times as many others know that their bbq is awesome.  Don't let the line deter you as you won't be disappointed.   My addiction of choice is the pulled pork sandwich topped with a delicious smokey & tangy bbq sauce, sides of waffle fries and mac & cheese.  Follow this order and you will thank me later!

Wasn't great.   Heard great things, but wasn't impressed.    We got the sampler, ribs and a bunch of sides.  Ordered ahead and when we got there they said they accidentally sold the last of the ribs and forgot about our order.   Took forever after we paid, around 30 minutes.   Started out with a bad taste in our mouth, and then the food was just ok.   Although, we didn't get to try the ribs so not sure on those.

First Saturday customer!  All of the meat was outstanding!  The ribs amongst the best I've ever had.  I was in Amarillo recently,  and I'd stack this meat up against theirs any time!  As for sides, the beans were the best followed by the waffle fries.  Potato salad was standard fare, slaw was crispy and fresh. The wife and kid were equally impressed.  Overall great experience. The owners were friendly and helpful...excellent job guys!!  Update:10/17/2011  I'm currently in Bangalore India and I swear to God, I would crawl over a mile of ground glass for a pork sandwich, slaw and beans right now!  I would clean Rosie O'Donald's toilets for a full rack of the best smoked, and best tasting ribs in Phoenix, and just about anywhere else.  I've got another week of wondering around in the BBQ (pork and beef) wilderness that is Bangalore before I stagger through their door and beg to be allowed to sleep in their smoker for an hour or two, then graze my way through the meat counter!  I can almost taste it now.....yumyummm  (If you find yourself in Bangalore, Hit the Hard Rock Cafe for a 10oz burger to keep from going insane.  It's dry, but it's beef, and that's hard to find here.  Even McDonald's doesn't have a beef burger.)
Been to this place a bunch of times, good prices, good food, and quick. My 1 year old son really enjoys it too since the pulled pork is already the perfect size for him to eat.

Just an average BBQ place. I would describe it more as a fast food BBQ place.. got the pulled pork sandwich pretty tasty but bit into a lot of fat- cornbread I couldn't eat because it was cooked for too long so it was hard and stuck to the wrapper not moist or fresh and the MAC n cheese was pretty good! The BBQ sauce was yummy but the hot option isn't really spicy at all- still good place to go if you're craving BBQ and in the area- 5 star for customer service!!

Update.  Something went wrong with Pork On A Fork.  The last two times I was there, the meat was dry, tough and if you didn't use a lot of sauce, tasteless.  My wife feels the same way.  We have stopped going here.  Dickie's on Bell Rd and 7th Street is far, far superior and a better variety of food.

Came here late on a Saturday and they were out of almost everything. Apparently the Groupon they offered caused quite a crowd. Everyone was very apologetic and friendly. Ordered the half slab of ribs with waffle fries. I couldn't believe how large the half slab was when I got it. Meat was delicious and I did not use any extra sauce as the rub on the bones was SO good. Waffle fries were also very good and I left stuffed to the chin with a to go box. My dinner companions both ordered full slabs and could not finish their meals either...quite unusal for both of them as they are big eaters. The parking was not a big deal on Sunday but I can see where it would be a problem during the work week. They have signs everywhere asking their customers to be respectful of the neighbors. What a crazy place to put a BBQ joint! They also serve beer. Can't wait to go back and try some more of the menu.

We had the platter and beef brisket.chicken was very dry.link was perfect.beans were great.mac and cheese was pretty good.some cheese was not melted.beef brisket was good.beans were great.coleslaw was very bland.hopefully better next time.
Very glad my friend suggested we meet here for lunch; lived seven years in Southern barbecue land and really miss it after moving to the northeast. This place is the real deal.

The wife and I decided to give this place a try since I'm a sucker for pulled pork and we've been looking to try new places closer to our side of town.   First off, this place is not the easiest to find. I drove past it the first time since they're sort of in the middle of the business park they occupy and they don't have a sign that you can see until you're just about past the entrance. I guess I can't blame them for that, but it was somewhat annoying.   As far as the food, however, I am impressed. Having set foot inside the place, my first impression was that it was very low-key, bare-bones, no-frills and such. I don't mind that, but sometimes it gives me hesitation about the food. Nevertheless, I was impressed by the pulled pork and so was my wife. It comes dry and you get your own pick of the sauce (they have several varieties) and can apply as much as you see fit. I really like that, because most places don't give you a say at all and the BBQ sauce is what makes the pulled pork sandwich.   The waffle fries were really, really good as was the pasta salad side order I had. I didn't care too much for the baked beans, but I wouldn't dare detract from the rating over that, since the pulled pork sandwich itself was the main draw and did not disappoint me in any way, shape or form.  Overall I was really impressed by this place, as the small 'hole in the wall' style places generally are more fun to eat at. I definitely love the food and the location (now that I can find it!) and was really happy to finally try a place that exceeded my expectations.   I will definitely be back in the near future and highly recommend this place.

Very displeased with this restaurant. I had the one of the samplers. The brisket and chicken was dry. I also had a side salad that had a hair in it. Then I realized no one had hair nets or hats on. When I told one of the employees about the hair she tried to offer me the same side.
Wow what great tasting pulled pork and smoked chicken. Well worth the drive. Good value and portion ratio. Will be back!
Simple meat options plopped onto a metal tray .. but deliciously cut and seasoned, with lots of different house sauces.

I am calling it average BBQ. Not bad but not really good. I really liked the Brisket which was really moist but the pulled pork was pretty dry overall. I also had a side of slaw and macaroni salad both of which seemed like they needed a little seasoning or something to help it pop because they didn't really stand out. If I came back I would just stick to the Brisket I think.

First, the food: Amazing. It always hits the spot and is always more than enough for any human to consume. I want to drink their sweet and mild BBQ sauce from a wine glass every night. The mac n cheese had some magical seasoning on it that is reminiscent of my favorite Cajun seasoning. The coleslaw could use more lemon because it's pretty bland but that's my only  food-related complaint.   Second, the service: Touch and go. Some times we visit and everyone is warm and friendly and the dining area is well stocked. Other times, like the last time we went, we had to repeat our order several times before they could process what we said, and my husband waited a good 5 extra minutes for his meal. The dining area looked like it hadn't been tended to all day. I was able to get the last four remaining forks for my family of five. The trash cans were coated in a thick layer is BBQ sauce goo and the restroom had no toilet paper, a small overflowing mountain of used paper towels (some of which I'm sure were used as substitute toilet paper) and it was obvious nothing was cleaned.   The takeaway: The food is amazing. So ordering to go will be a home run every time. Just don't have high expectations of your dining experience if staying to eat.
Came in and got a beautiful pound of pork for $10. Smoky, gorgeous color, lil bit of bark, cooked perfect. Hit the spot. Thanks.
Delicious BBQ pork and beef. Family owned and operated. The sauces are sweet to spicy and the sides are the best. Not all baked beans are the same and you'll not find better in the state.

What's going on Pork on a Fork? I've always been a fan and highly recommended your restaurant but lately I've been pretty disappointed.  The last couple of times we have ordered from you guys it hasn't been up to your old standards.  The meat I ordered was mostly fat and seemed like it had been sitting in the oven all day. It was extremely tough and dry. Since we didn't get the sauce we ordered with our meals we couldn't even drown the taste. The beans aren't like they used to be either. They used to have some great spice to them with nice size chunks of meat added in. Now it seems like a can of pork-n-beans has been opened with some bbq sauce mixed in.  The cole slaw and macaroni salad are still good. As is the mac-n-cheese. Waffle fries are decent too.  I will probably give it one more chance and am hoping to get what we used to get. Good old bbq.

I never try any place that's less than 5 stars on Yelp unless it's been highly recommended. But I came across Pork on a Fork through Uber Eats. It was good enough to order twice! Get the baked beans, macaroni and cheese, and cornbread as sides...trust me. Must warn everyone though, this is a heavy meal that's flavorful. If you're looking for a healthy option this is NOT the place. This is more of a cheat meal packed high in proteins AND bad fats...delicious nonetheless.
Excellent customer service. Friendly, personable staff. Clean environment. THE FOOD IS DELICIOUS!!

Stopped in here yesterday and I knew the moment I walked in I was in for a treat! The smell of freshly smoked meats was intoxicating!  First, if you weren't looking for this place, you would not know there was an eating establishment here. It's on the end of a building in a small business park.  There was a line of about 12 people when I walked in around 11:30am and when I left it had grown to about 20! (Always a good sign!) I used the bathroom first and there was no soap (or soap dispenser)! That's the main reason I am leaving 4 stars instead of 5. Not only is that nasty but I believe the health department would "ding" them for that.  On to the important part of the review - the food! I ordered a "Big Boy" which was a large sampler platter which consisted of pulled chicken, pulled pork, brisket and smoked sausage. The brisket seemed to be the star of the show! It's the one thing I noticed everyone ordering and I actually ordered an extra portion myself! The samplers also came with two sides, I got the waffle fries and mac 'n cheese. All this plus a a drink came out to be $21 and change. This is the other reason I didn't leave 5 stars, the food overall was really good but that price is steep for a tiny little joint that caters to mostly blue collar workers.  Here is the verdict in the food:  Brisket - excellent Pulled pork - excellent  Pulled chicken - average  Smoked sausage - average   Mac 'n cheese - very good  Waffle fries - very good  Drink - I combined the ice tea and lemonade to make an Arnold Palmer and it tasted horrible! Unfortunately, I didn't taste the drink until I was driving away. Maybe the syrup was running low for the Country-time lemonade?  I asked to try the basic BBQ sauce (they have 4 choices) and the guy at the counter threw some plastic containers with what looked to be homemade sauce in my bag. Unfortunately, the two little containers weren't nearly enough and I didn't realize it until I had gotten to work. The guy knew I ordered extra meat so he should have at least put extra sauce in my bag or asked me if I wanted more. It's the little details that can really make a difference between a good place to eat and an excellent "must have" dining establishment.  All in all, some minor issues but what they do, they do well! The food is really good as is their service! I took mine to go but it looked like they had a little sit down section in the back.  I will definitely be back!
Best pulled pork in Phoenix!! Great food from the top of the menu to the bottom. You won't regret trying this BBQ
We jus moved into the neighborhood and we're hungry from moving all day. We found this great hole in wall BBQ joint. There prices are great and so is the food! A must try!!!!
REALLY good BBQ, LOVE the BBQ burrito. Generous servings, excellent food, great service - reasonably priced. Highly recommend it.

The food was good lady running the place terrible. Young man was taking my order and you could tell he was new. Lady was yelling at him to hurry up (not sure why I was the only one in line) then came over and started telling him off. He tried to ask her a question she told him to shut up. Pulled him over to the side to continue belittling him, never even acknowledged me just walked away. Another employee stepped over from whatever task she was doing and finished taking my order. She mouthed the words I'm sorry clearly not wanting the manager or whoever she was to hear. So if you want to watch employees get tested bad then go here.

Had the Family Feast and it did not disappoint!!! The ribs were fork tender, great smoke flavor and smoke ring!  Their mustard sauce on their smoked sausages were great!  We ordered coleslaw as a side and made pulled pork mini burgers with the slaw which had great crunch texture and not overpowering in flavor.  Great balance!  Also included was smoked chicken and brisket.  Man was that some good eating!!!  Chicken was fork tender and the brisket falls apart easily with great flavor. I WILL be going back and think it's some of the best BBQ in the valley!  They did have these marshmallow bacon brownies that are on my list of items to try next!!!

We used a restaurant.com gift card here and it was fantastic.   We ordered the Family Style Meal for 89.99 and had to push two long picnic tables in the back together for room for the food. It was really good and their BBQ sauces were fantastic I couldn't tell which one I liked better so I used all four.   Their cornbread and rolls were delicious and moist, their meat was amazing and the ribs fell right off the bone.   The place may look small but they have a big room in the back that has plenty of seating for big parties and all the condiments/sauces you could need within arms reach as well.  Pros: Just about everything! Cons:They close too early and are in an odd location, it looks like an industrial strip mall on Deer Valley Rd.  All in All I will certainly be back, and my kids are already begging for me to bring them take out from here.
The food was absolutely delicious! I ordered the smoked sausage burrito with two sides. The portion was just right. Thank you! I highly recommend.

I just finished eating here. It was GOOD!!! I had the sampler but upgraded to include the brisket. It all went down so easy and nice. The sampler included pulled pork, brisket, chicken thigh and mac n' cheese. Highly recommended.
Phenomenal BBQ! We had the brisket sandwich and the Smokin Plate. Everything exceeded our expectations. I'm only sorry that we don't live closer!

DAMN good BBQ.  Really yummy beans. Free refills on drinks.  Small dining area up front, but the back area is HUGE.  don't come here for the eating area, it's pretty spartan.  Come here for the beef, the chicken, the pulled pork.  NOTHING bad.

I checked this place out originally based on the reviews that I had seen here on Yelp and I must agree that the food here is pretty good.      I'm very picky when it comes to BBQ and its been difficult at times to find reliable, good-tasting BBQ in Phoenix but Pork on a Fork definitely delivers in that regard.      The pulled pork sandwich I had was terrific, soft, very flavorful, enjoyed it tremendously and the cole slaw and beans were both on-point.     All in all I would definitely recommend this place and will be going back here many more times in the future.

I'm nor sure what all they hype was about this place. Maybe another casualty of getting on TV, and then raising prices lowering quality. I ordered a Midwest Monster. It was ok, nothing to write home about. The meat on it was very good it comes with Jalapenos and cheese and coleslaw. My only knock on the sandwich was that it was twelve dollars, It was microwaved to melt the cheese, and served on fifty cent bun from fry's. Again the meat on the sandwich was very good it wasn't warm though, obviously not hot enough to melt cheese.  But it comes with two side dishes you say.   I ordered the Mac and Cheese and Waffle Fries. The waffle fry's were the kind you get in the frozen section of your local supper market, and while the portion wasn't small it was also served cold. They were not fried from what I can tell but heated in an oven at some point and served room temp.To say I was unimpressed well no that is exactly what I was unimpressed.   But you also got Mac and Cheese you say.  Crazy as this sounds it was also served cold, or what could be considered room temperature. We had Kraft Mac and Cheese the night before my wife told me it was better. The one thing I can say is they put a little paprika on the top and it does look like they make it from scratch. Not sure who else serves cold mac and cheese though I've never had it served that way at a restaurant before.   In Short it was twelve bucks for what couldn't even be called a real meal. Room temperature side dishes and a microwaved sandwich. I will add the staff was great and moved us right along.  I could have gone to Five Guys and saved myself 4 bucks and had a happy belly.

Went Saturday night at about 7pm. There were 3 of us and we had pulled pork, brisket and ribs. The staff was friendly however the food was disappointing. All the meats were dry. Good smoke flavor but none of the meats tasted fresh. I had beans and waffle fries for sides and liked both very much.  We also tried the mac and cheese and thought it could have been more fresh as well. Dining area was fine however the bbq sauce bottles were all dirty and looked as though they hadn't been cleaned in a while.  We have been in the past and liked it however this last visit was quite a disappointment due to the dry (all of them) meats.  Come on guys, I know you can do better!

Awesome surprise! Drove by it a few times before deciding to try it. Weird location & strange layout, but if you can get past that, the food is great! I've tried several things but you can't beat the pulled pork. The mac & cheese is awesome too. Very very fair pricing. One of the better BBQ I've had in Phoenix. Recommend!

This is the best BBQ in Phoenix. The pulled pork melts in your mouth and the sausage is perfectly cooked. Get the Smokin' Meal - it is a combo of pork, brisket, and sausage, plus you get two sides. Highly recommended.

LOVE the BBQ flavor of the meats here, all are good.  We didn't like the sides much though (personal taste?).  It would be nice to have a few kid options and maybe some smaller choices for when you don't want a HUGE meal but a smaller one.  Other than that, Oh Yeah!  What a gem hidden away - get some more advertising!
Great food and place. Amazing brisket made fresh, pork is tasty, sausage is amazing, their sides are awesome.  Enjoy it here.

It's rare that with four kids and two adults we can all find something we really like. This is that place.    The beans are fantastic. Well, all of their sides are great.  The meats are wonderful.  I've yet to question their wood selections for smoking or cooking times/temps but they know just what they are doing with briskets, butts, and chickens.  We've been here twice and will go back again.

My company orders here on a normal basis.  This time we had an even smaller order, I placed my order online for Friday the 17th between 11:15 & 11:30.. It was easy to place an online order... Then, after my order was placed and the money was taken from my account I get a confirmation email for Wednesday between 3:15 & 3:30.. I called them immediately and spoke with someone on the catering line who assured me that he saw the order and would make sure it was ready on Friday at 11am. Well, we do down to pick up our food today and they say they have no record of an order for today! That they had our order ready on Wednesday and no one showed up! Um, WHAT?! Ultimately, we got our order and 20% off our next order but we had to wait for nearly 30 minutes. It's a good thing their food is so good!
So so good not to be missed.  Great people and all the sauces on the table are amazing
Great flavor! Prices were very affordable.  I fed 4 people for $35ish. This will definitely be on my list of BBQ options

The food was very good for a fast/casual environment. Wasn't expecting to have such flavorful BBQ from a quick place like this. The coleslaw was quite refreshing with great flavor, baked beans were excellent with a mild pepper taste, the chicken and pork were also excellent but the brisket was surprisingly dry. Assortment of BBQ sauces was a nice selection, decor was good. I would've given them 4 stars for food but I'm giving them 3 stars for service because there was only 1 person in front of me and the meat carver was painfully slow. There was no smile and I could barely hear what he was asking due to his mumbling. The 2nd server who compiled my sides was very nice and pleasant but I asked several times for something and even after I was seated, I realized I still didn't have it so had to get up and ask again. I'd give them another try again if in the area since I did enjoy the food.

I'm in trouble, real trouble with this joint.  It is the most delicious BBQ I've ever had.  No more "chains" for me, now it's all about Pork on a Fork.  They are two doors down from where I work so it's super convenient to get my pulled pork fix.  I could really just make a meal out of their sides as well. The coleslaw was fresh and crisp. Baked beans tasted smoky and sweet.  Oh and don't let me forget about the crispy on the outside, tender on the inside sweet potatoe fries.  I ordered a pulled pork sandwich and a beef brisket sandwich. Both were enough to feed me for 4 days!  There was a lot of meet on those sandwiches.  All in all, my belly is happy, even if my waistline is not.  :)
Brisket bowl awesome! Coleslaw base is perfect and the tender tasty brisket is excellent!  Friendly staff too, always say hello and offer to help right away.

First time. It was a little difficult to notice from the road. The brisket was fall to pieces yummy! The beans had a peppery kick. The potato salad was run of the mill. The sausage was good. We were a little disappointed that they ran out of pork as we wanted to do the sampler. The couple behind us just left. I think they should've offered a small discount or something. All in all, good food. Relaxing atmosphere.

Went here tonight with the hubs after repeatedly hearing about it from friends. I got the brisket (no bun), macaroni salad, and coleslaw. All 3 were AMAZING!  I like that they serve their meat "naked" so you can add your own amount and type of sauce. The 4 sauce choices are awesome too! A spicy mustard, Carolina-style sweet sauce, smoky BBQ, and super spicy BBQ sauce...so nice to choose!   In true semi-gluttons style, dessert was devoured by the hubs and me before dinner....brownie with walnuts, marshmallow, chocolate sauce, AND BACON BITS ON TOP!!!!!! LOVE!   Despite not being a super BBQ lover, the casual atmosphere, happy and efficient workers, and amazing food have definitely given this gal incentive to return!

If it wasn't for yelping by neighborhood, we never woulda found this place. We cheated and checked their website first, which informed us that they feature their family-farm pork from Nebraska, so we went in knowing to order pork, rather than beef. That obviously meant pulled pork and brats (they apparently feature a different flavored brat each day).  So, after a bit of driving around the industrial park (We turned in a tad too early, so toured the park) we found it and grabbed one of the few spots marked as theirs on the curb.   Athena ordered the pulled pork sammie with mac/cheese and potato salad. I went beans and potato salad along with my brat - "Sorry, we're out". PANIC set in, I hadn't actually studied the menu...so what did I do? Yep. Same thing everyone does when they panic at a BBQ place...went brisket.   Brisket is nice and tender but it in no way matches the quality, juiciness and flavor of the pulled pork. We tried two sauces - hands down winner? Zippy Mustard, which I tend to think of as a Carolina 'Cue kinda thing and seem to lean that way in my sauce tastings these days.   The beans are good, and well-flavored but I still stick by Honey Bear's as having the best beans (Cow-Bro beans) of all the BBQ joints around.   I do say though, if Im gonna go pulled pork (we split our sammies half and half and shared)I'd head here - not only because its closer but I liked it better (Although I'm partial to the ribs at HB).  The potato salad wasn't to our liking much. Not that it's bad (it features red skinned potatoes) - but I'm pretty partial to "my" kinda potato salad - made with Best Foods mayo and tons o' mustard with no little pickles/relish in it. What can I say? I'm not a Southerner. POAF has the pickles and I'm pretty sure its Miracle Whip..  The tables were clean, and almost all taken by local workers from the surrounding area. They have wetnaps easily available, and they have awesome lever-driven plastic utensil dispensers which are a cool, if kitschy, touch.  Staff is friendly. Place is clean. GO EARLY if you want a brat. They open at 10a and are sold out by 1p...So next time - Im headed b4 lunch rush hits.

YUM! Our go-to BBQ place nearby closed recently so we've been on the hunt for smoked meat.   Upon entering I was pleasantly surprised by the decor. The walls and front of the food line are covered in distressed wood that actually looks smoked itself. A nice touch! There are several tables for seating as well as a wood bench that runs the length of the dining room.  The menu has enough components that you will never run out of options. Hubby got a BBQ sampler with chicken, pork, and brisket. The chicken was his favorite. He chose rice and potato salad as his sides. I tried the brisket bowl on top of baked beans, topped with coleslaw. It was tasty but next time I'll order something on a tray. I'm a food separatist but I powered through and ate everything mixed together. I also ordered a side of Mac n cheese for $1.99.  Overall we were pleased with the meal and ambiance and we'll definitely be back!  Edited to add: four stars for food, the fifth added because of awesome customer service... and a clean bathroom that makes you feel as if you just walked into a saloon!

Amazing macaroni and cheese. Perfectly smoked pulled pork. For delicious homemade barbecue sauce has choose from. Fresh baked beans made from scratch. You can get your food in a sandwich, Bowl, burrito, sampler or more

Came to Pork on a Fork to feed a BBQ craving - the Yelp reviews were incredible, so our expectations were high.  I had the pulled pork sandwich with beans and sweet potato fries. There were also several sauces on the table to choose from, since the meat comes dry and without any sauce. Overall, I liked the pork, but having it soaked in the sauce initially would have probably tasted much better!  Overall, the food was decent, but I'm taking off two stars for the inside of the place. This restaurant and the seating area seemed very unclean to me, and I felt grimey even being in there.  A place can be casual and clean at the same time!

Finally made it back for some tasty BBQ (it's 24 miles away for me). They were out of pulled pork and sausage and apparently we got the last of the brisket. I'm glad they still had my brisket or that would have been a long drive for nothing. I believe they were down to chicken and ribs. I got mac & cheese and potato salad for my sides and they were tasty. Lady behind the counter was on the phone asking customers if they wanted something else or to cancel their order. I'm sure they were disappointed because the food here is really good!

A friend told me about this place long ago but it's 25 miles away, so I was waiting for a reason to go out that way. After seeing the good Yelp reviews and checking out their website, we finally decided to make the drive. It really is a hole in the wall that you probably wouldn't notice if you didn't know it was there. We actually drove past it and had to turn around to get back to it. The building is rather dark outside at night. But once inside, you fill up your drink first, then order at the counter, then pay. I got iced tea and a pulled pork sandwich with mac & cheese and beans. The staff was very friendly and the manager even comped our drinks since it was our first time. That was nice! It doesn't look like there's anywhere to sit and eat but you walk down the hall and there's a big dining area in the back. There were 4 different kinds of sauces on the tables. A sweet, a smoky, a spicy, and a mustard. I went with a combo of sweet & smoky. I liked it! I also tried some brisket from my b/f's sampler and it was really tender and good. The sides were also good, but could have been warmer. When my b/f went back to order more waffle fries (which were tasty) the manager asked how everything was and he mentioned the temperature of the sides. He said the water must be low and they would correct it. So it seems they genuinely want customer feedback to help put out quality food. That is appreciated. They also have BBQ Bowls and a BBQ Burrito on their menu which is different. We'll be back!

Stopped in on the way home to pick-up some BBQ to go. I can't comment on the dinning service or dinning area, the take out area is separate.   The pulled pork was amazing! So tender and juicy. Just the right amount of flavor, and you can pick your own BBQ sauce.   The rack of ribs were melt in your mouth good! The meat was falling off the bone, so delicious. I wish we lived closer, this would be a weekly stop.

Located across from the Deer Valley airport.   Parking is labelled on the curb so be careful you're not parking in a spot that's designated for some of the surrounding businesses however there's still lots of parking available.  Staff are friendly, welcoming, and always willing to answer any questions.  The restaurant has character.  In front where you enter, you order either to-go or to dine in.  If you dine in, you take your food to the back along a corridor that has the restrooms to a garage that has been converted into a restaurant/sitting area.  There's no windows and the lights are bright.    The thing I didn't like was the fact the restrooms wasn't cordoned off from the main eating area.  In other words there were eating tables in the vicinity of the restroom door/area (-1).  When you enter, you get in line and order.  The menu is on the small side as it's on a flat screen TV (-1).  The food is prepared in front of you when you order, e.g. the brisket is cut in front of you, the pulled pork is mixed straight from the container and prepped in front of you, and the chicken is removed from the bone and prepped in front of you.  I had the Smokin' Sampler that comes with 2 sides, pulled pork, smoked chicken and a smoked sausage though you could substitute any meat for brisket for $1.49 extra so what I did was substitute the chicken for brisket.  I opted for the BBQ beans and coleslaw.    The brisket had a nice smokey flavor to it and was tender and juicy.  The pulled pork was also good, though perhaps a little on the dry side which wasn't a problem as I utilized some of their signature sauces they had in the back.  There are 4 sauces/bottles - mustard flavored, sweet & mild (my favorite), hot & spicy (which wasn't hot and spicy in my opinion), and a smoked tangy sauce (another favorite of mine).     The BBQ beans was well seasoned and some kick to it.  Their coleslaw was creamy, not watery, well seasoned, and crunchy.    Price for the Smokin' Sampler was $10.99 plus the $1.49 substitution which wasn't bad for lunch at all.    Portion sizes were good and didn't give that overstuffed feeling but filling.
No Onions...really...out of cornbread..out of pickles...Inventory needs to be addressed.  Skimpy on sauces and sides are small portions.  I actually liked the food but don't think its run well.

I give this place a 3 stars because of their customer service.  I've been to this place a few times, the food it's generally pretty good, the only thing I didn't like is their ribs; they are on the dry/burnt side. However, the rest of their meats and sides are really good. Meats are juicy, well portioned. The sides are homemade (most of them), my favorite are the mac n cheese and the macaroni salad. Their barbecue sauces are savory, spicy, tangy...really good.  The reason for the 3 stars: CUSTOMER SERVICE IS HORRIBLE. I ordered once through UBER eats, and the person at the counter messed up, and did not give one of the dinner plates to the driver. When the driver arrived at my house, I asked for the other plate, and he said; "I specifically asked the girl if that was it, and she rudely replied "yes, that's it". So, while the driver was still at my house, I called the restaurant, I was placed on hold for a while, and finally they answered, the man I talked to said they gave everything to the driver, that he personally had given it to him, and to contact UBER. Luckily, the driver stayed w/ me for the entire talk, and he jumped in, told him that a GIRL was the one that had given him the order, not him, and to not lie about it; that's when the guy at the restaurant got nervous, and put the girl on the phone. The girl, still being rude, told the driver...ok, your order is here, come get it. UBER driver went to go get my order, brought it back, and told me that he was not paid for this extra drive, and that the "kids working there had showed him some attitude". Later that day, I got a call from the manager at the restaurant who apologized and offered me some credit for my next visit. Last week, I went in to use the credit, the restaurant was EMPTY, no customers, and 2 people behind the counter did not greet me, smile, and just stared at me. I approached them, and told him that I was there to get some credit for something that had happened in the past, still, nothing from them, no apology, nothing to make this experience better, one of them went to the back to check for my name on their list, and when he came back, he asked, "what do you want?". Again, the attitude was horrible, they were not rude, but honestly, no enthusiasm, I walked out of there feeling depressed. Again, the food was delicious, but the customer service is a disaster. I truly hope the owner/manager pays attention to that, because it could really bring down a restaurant...a GOOD restaurant.

Went here to day for the first time. It was kind of a drive for us coming from Wittmann, but we will definitely be making the drive again! We got the XL family feast. At first look we thought oh this won't be enough meat for the whole group of us. It not only was enough, but we had leftovers as well. Dinner tonight! yay  The huge sides, we got mac & cheese as one. It could have used a tad more salt. The coleslaw as our second side was on fire! :-) The baked beans we weren't to thrilled about, too much pepper for our taste. My favorite was the sausage & ribs. The pulled pork was a win with the kids, and the brisket well there wasn't any of it in our leftover box!  Fountain drinks were mixed perfect too. Pepsi products. The seating was a little confusing with not knowing where to sit. It's around the corner in the back of the place, but plenty of seating. The utensil dispensers were pretty cool too.     Anyways, it was clean. The people were super friendly, and yes you can tip them! There was a line, and it takes a moment to get your food so don't go for sit in if you are in a hurry, suggest calling ahead for their take out if that's the case. This food is not fast food, it is actually smoked with wood. (There were a few buckets of wood in the back we could see)    If we weren't looking for it we would have passed it, so look for the 1515 on the building, or their little sign they sat by the street. Plenty of parking. They were very familiar with their policies as well, none of that ho-hum what do we do stuff. Even though they were really busy, I saw some of the people making time to come into the dining area to clean and asked everyone at each table if they needed anything.    Thanks for making this a great Fathers Day for my husband, and Sons. See ya all again!

Was out running errands and spotted this place with a "Grand Opening" sign so I thought I would give it a try. Ordered the beef brisket sandwich and they were out of a couple sides so I ended up with mac and cheese and waffle fries. Everything was pretty decent. The side containers for the beans and mac and cheese are pretty small while you get a pretty large portion of waffle fries, not sure why the disparity between the two. The sandwich was also pretty well loaded with meat and there didn't appear to be a lot of fat or funk on it, which is nice. The various BBQ sauces on the table were a good touch.

I used to LOVE this place!! My dad and I were addicted! We discovered POaF when they were just brand new. It USED to be incredible!!!  I notice I am not the only one who is recently complaining "it ain't what it used to be" by way of reviews here on Yelp.   I ordered ribs, brought them home and fed them to the dog! They were so tough I was afraid he might lose his teeth... Okay, just kidding about the dog losing his teeth, but not about the ribs being so tough that the dog got to eat them!!  Because we have always enjoys our meals, I gave it another try. I ordered the ribs and brought them home. Although the dog didn't get them this time, I was very disappointed because they were very, very tough again, but at least not as bad as the time before. I used a fork to tear the meat from the bone and you could actually HEAR the meat ripping from the bone!!! WTH???  There were a couple times when I arrived about 3:00 and they were out of ribs. I guess I got lucky since they have been so crappy lately!! They also have been out of beans, and on another occasion they were out of macaroni and cheese! They told me they were busy working on catering orders...  HOW oh HOW can a restaurant have it so right and lose it so BAD??? If you know how to do it so well, what happened??   I am writing this review in hopes the owners will see this and get it right again!!! If I see the reviews popping back in the favorable column, I will be happy to try it again and remove this review. Until I hear it is back to what it used to be, I will NOT return!!
The absolute best pulled pork sandwich I ever had! Would drive again from North Scottsdale for their food! Great service too!

Way good. Sumptuous, moist, smokey, perfectly seasoned brisket. Not sauced if you want a purist experience. Perfect portion, great sides (Mac n Cheese early in day the best). Simple surroundings and great service. Really friendly hot tattooed women serving. Must lunch spot for those beef lovers.
Missing items but fine whatever but OMG the dryest meat ever!  Mac and cheese is sub par no seasoning and the potatoe salad is gross!!  Bland,  dry,  and hard to swallow will never order again

It pains me to leave this.. LOVE, LOVE, LOVE  the food. However,  took 4 coworkers with me for lunch today. After 30 minutes of watching the meat carver try to carve and weight meat for 5 people, we realized it was going to take about 30 more minutes for the next 10 people to be taken care before our chance. All 5 of us had to walk out. It's disappointing that the carver girl is that slow. If you get a new carver girl, we will be back and will recommend you! Get a new carver girl..please. We want to eat there!
The Monster is BOMB!  1/2 pulled Pork 1/2 Brisket coleslaw hot BBQ jalapenos and pepper jack!  YUM!
This place is a hidden gem and the food is real good. Make sure you make this a stop if you are in north Phoenix.

It was my first time going to the Camelback location and I was not disappointed! Its hard to find great BBQ in Phoenix and im so glad i finally found a spot. Five stars for their outstanding service and to die for BBQ. I recommend the pulled pork and the drool worthy mac and cheese.
Thanks to Yelp I found this BBQ spot the other day! Try the beef brisket with mac n cheese/baked beans combo and you won't be disappointed. Location is a bit tricky but when you find it you'll enjoy!

My 1st visit was awesome. I got my food to go. Didn't know what to order so the guy suggested something with 3 meats and 2 sides. Cost was less than $16 and more than enough to feed 2 people. The meat was perfectly smoked and served with the sauce on the side. I ordered chicken,  beef brisket, and sausage with sweet potatoes fries and Mac and cheese. Food was great and I will go back as I work right across the street. Want to try the peach cobbler next time. Great job guys!

3.5 stars. Got the 3 item combo with pulled pork, brisket, and pulled chicken with mac and cheese and a corn bread muffin as the sides. Also added 2 ribs for 4 bucks. Everything was fine but didn't taste that fresh. Went at about 6:30pm on a weekday, so maybe that had something to do with it. The meat wasn't all the moist and the ribs were a little tough. None of them had a deep smokey flavor either. The corn bread muffin also tasted kind of old. Mac and cheese was good.
Decent, fun place to go eat. The food is average for a good but not great bbq place. Service is always great and food is always fresh.

Tasty food and sides. Bun came not toasted but that's my fault for not asking. I discovered Pork on a Fork upon recommendations of friends who work across the street at Deer Valley airport. Per their experience and glowing reviews, I ordered the pulled pork sandwich which came with a choice of two sides. I chose the potato salad and the close slaw and I found both to be very tasty.  All came to $ 10.79 or so with a drink which I thought was quite reasonable. There is plenty of seating. The back area is a lot roomier and is much quieter and also boasts a large flat screen television.  Upon paying, you are given a number for your table so the server will know where to deliver the order.Service was very prompt - in fact,  I did not even have a chance to sit down as the server was already walking towards me with my order. Highly recommended! The staff was very friendly.  I had dreamed about the place all night since my friends had told me about it already knowing what  was going to order - I had caramelized onions in mind for  the sandwich and of course I walked in there completely forgetting what I had dreamed about. Next time!  ....I went back today (yep two days in a row) as I was intrigued as to how their burrito would taste. I got mine with chicken and pork in it, salsa, cheese and caramelized onions and sides of mac and cheese and potato salad. The food is good and the mac and cheese was absolutely to die for....but it could have been better...and that would start with toasting the bun if you get a sandwich or grilling the tortilla if you get their burrito...That little step alone would add giant leaps to the taste equation...I bet I could have asked but  didn't so shame on me again. At $ 9.29, the burrito is not exactly cheap but it is plenty of food however. POAF (Pork on a fork) would earn an additional star which would garner them five stars if they mastered the basics of toasting and grilling the bun and tortilla...No dinner for me tonight!
Eating the Midwest monster with mac n cheese and sweet potato fries as I type this. I'm going back for dinner. Awesome meal!

My husband and I had a restaurant.com coupon and decided to try this restaurant as it wasn't to far from the house!  We walked in and my first thought was this was just a small little place that was more for the businesses that were around it. After ordering and talking to other people that have been coming there for quite sometime we got a different vibe on the place.  We didn't have to wait long for our ribs and beef brisket which we chose bbq beans and coleslaw.  The sides were out of this world and extremely yummy.    But the meat....OMG!!!!  This restaurant was so good! Pork on a Fork is a hidden gem and we will be going back again.  The ribs...I'm sorry I cannot make them that good!  The meat was so tender and tasty.  The beef was so tender and just fell apart. None of the meat needed any additional sauce added to it because it was very good as it came.  I highly recommend this restaurant to anyone.  The staff were very friendly and helpful. Customers were very happy there and lots of yums coming from many!   Worth the trip no matter what part of the valley you are in!  Give it a try!
Best BBQ in AZ! The pulled pork is delicious and their sauces & beans are also fantastic.  Went there regularly but also used the catering service once - overall great experiences!

Disgusting. The beef I ordered was FULL of fat (most of the dish was actually fat). I will post a picture later on of my dish as well. I'm hoping this is not nearly the best BBQ anywhere near Phoenix or it would be truly sad.

Summary: Great BBQ and friendly service! Great price as well. Would come back again.  Came here on Christmas Eve with a party of 7 around 1pm. This late in the afternoon the back dining room was closed but they accommodated us by bring chairs up for us to sit and eat. A lot of their patrons were take out orders which makes sense to me. They're forte was definitely the meats and not the ambiance of their restaurant.   Order at the counter and they'll pack up your meats in a styrofoam container or metal pan(if you get the big portions) to serve to you.  We got the family meal meant for 5 people and all 7 of us were adequately full but not stuffed.  Got the sweet potato and waffle fries as sides and they were very crispy!  All the meats were done very well and each of my family members had a different favorite. I personally loved the chicken because it had a strong peppery flavor.

Two stars for their service. The food was not good at all. I've been there twice. I thought I'd give them a second chance and try something else on the menu. I tried the sampler with chicken, smoked sausage and tri tip. Mac and cheese and Cole slaw on the side. The only good thing was the Mac and cheese.
Great BBQ, was impressed, even my 11 yr old daughter liked it and it is hard to find something she likes, so we will be going back soon!

So...went here with a buddy tonight to get some grub.  Turned out to be just ok.    I scoped out their menu online a few days before and noticed that they had chicken wings as an appetizer.  There was an asterisk that comes with them though.  They only have them "when available", or if you order them 24 hours in advance.  I called them up Wed night and placed my order for a pound ($10.95).  I picked up my wings and also tried to order a 1/4 lb of brisket.  They told me they could only do 1/2 lb....why?  I don't know and didn't ask.  So a pound of wings, 1/2 lb of brisket ($10.00!) and a drink ran me almost $ 25.00.  Paid them my money, took my stuff and went to the room in the back.  The place is set up weird IMO...it's a counter in the front, then you have to walk to a back room to eat.  It feels like they are 2 separate buildings.  Their floors were slippery too btw...grease?   Anyways....on to the food.  Brisket-  Eh...just ok.  It was chunked brisket and almost more like burnt ends.  It was smoked properly and you could see the red smoke ring etc.  I took a bite and I got the "pot roast" taste.  Maybe I just don't like brisket as much as the next guy?  I will find out for sure when I go to Texas next May :-).  For the price of $10.00 for a 1/2 lb, it was a bit pricey.  Hell....Franklin BBQ in Austin only charges $17.00 a pound and that's considered the best in the world.   This was $ 20.00 a lb and I didn't even think it was that great.  Oh well.  Chicken Wings-  First of all, nobody has reviewed these things or uploaded a picture of them.  Until now.......The wings were plentiful.  They gave me a whole tray full of wings and it seemed way over a pound.  Maybe I got hooked up?  For $10.95 it's a great deal.  The wings were alright.  They were smoked properly and tasted pretty good.  I didn't add any sauce because of my low carbing but some sauce may have improved them a bit.  Since they were smoked and weren't grilled or fried, they did come out a bit soggy.   Not bad though and I would get them again for sure!   Overall this place was just ok.  I would get the wings again but not the brisket.  Service was ok...a tad too " chill" and laid back though but whatever.   They were youngsters and they were nice at least.  It was getting close to closing too so I bet they were anxious to get the hell out of dodge.  Will I be back?  Yeah, probably.  It is right near work and does fit my low carb diet options.  I will be on the lookout for better BBQ in Phoenix though.  A OK for now.  3 stars.

This is the best bbq I can say I've ever eaten in the valley.  It could go up against some of the best BBQ joints in the US. I'm talking places all throughout Texas, Memphis, etc.  I had the 2 meat platter w/Beef Brisket & Pulled Chicken.  The meats are so tender, perfectly seasoned & cooked that you don't even need BBQ sauce; but the BBQsauce is also amazing and adds a lil pop & dimension to the flavor profile of the perfectly flavored meats.  The sides were also not your typical quick, thrown together sides like most places which use prepackaged, bagged & bottled ingredients.  I had the Mac & Cheese - no question that this is homemade (awesomely creamy & perfectly cheesy, not overwhelming-just perfect) & for my 2nd side I had coleslaw. I was totally & absolutely pleasantly surprised. The Coleslaw was also homemade, not bagged cabbage (it was freshly, hand chopped) & mixed w/a homemade, fresh & excitingly flavorful dressing of delightful perfection (not too thick & creamy, yet not too watered down, either - finally after all these yrs ... I've found a coleslaw that has a perfect balance in the dressing consistency, a perfect flavor profile & is made w/fresh, hand chopped cabbage & I can finally say that it's the best slaw I've ever eaten).  My spouse had a full rack of baby back ribs which he couldn't stop raving about.  Ate the entire rack in 1 setting. The meat literally just fell right off the bones.  If you're on the North side of Phx- - -trust me when I say this is a Restaurant you MUST visit.  It will NOT disappoint.

Let me start this review by stating I'm from Memphis and I am a BBQ snob... this is by far the best BBQ that I have found in the Valley.  Service was awesome and Jake even had the perfect music playing!  Can't wait to go back!!!
Good BBQ .. Got lb of brisket and lb of pulled pork. Staff is friendly and food was solid. I did call in order 40 minutes ahead to avoid wait and wasn't ready but they handled it quick. Will be back.

HOLY SMOKES! Literally!   My love of smoked meats runs deep...ingrained and woven into my DNA.  Recently several Yelp friends had sung the praises of their offerings.  It's now my turn to stand up and sing.  After seeing their booth at the Wednesday evening Downtown PHX Market I hoped they would return for the Saturday market.  When I arrived on Saturday, they were there with warmers filled with fresh pulled smoked pork, smoked beef brisket and numerous frozen pork treats.  Their pulled pork and brisket was smoked to perfection, tender and amazing. Their  original brat was fresh and juicy. I also purchased a breakfast package that included sausage (links and patties) and it was supposed to include bacon but they were out that day and I replaced with sliced deli ham.    Since my first visit I continue to go back to their stand on Saturdays for a brisket sandwich. I also picked up some pulled pork to take with me to a superbowl party. It was a welcome addition to the wonderful spread at the gathering.    (2/15) Just last week I picked up some bacon that I have not cooked up yet but look forward to it.    I hope to one day stop into their shop in N. Phoenix.

I used to come here when they first opened and love the place but maybe I've changed because this place just doesn't fit me any more.  My last beans did seem to have any brisket in it the last time I came and that was my favorite thing here (always doubled up beans as my side).  I guess it's time for me to move on and I found another bbq place for me now.  I guess I have a new taste now.  Sorry, it's not you it's me.
I'm a health nut but I will indulge on some POAF!

Nice interior newer sibling to the deer valley location, got the pulled pork, the sausage, and the brisket with nice outer bark to it. All meats were nicely smoked and just delicious, for the sides had cornbread, great  bbq beans, and crunchy slaw. Love the spicy BBQ sauce

Great BBQ! I got brisket which was delicious, as were the sweet potato fries and the potato salad. The flavor of the beans wasn't quite what I expected and were my least favorite part, but the brisket more than made up for it! There were multiple sauce options at the table and the two that we tried were really good. The seating area is tucked in the back and is quaint and quiet.  As others have said, the staff moves pretty slowly and seemed a little unorganized at times. We weren't in a hurry so it was no big deal.  Overall, we really enjoyed it and will definitely be back!

My rating is based off the food and service inside the building.  If we could rate based off of parking and accessibility to the building the overall rating would be lower.  However, those are issues that are not directly related to this restaurant so I will only focus on the food and service.  I didn't know this place was featured on the Official Best BBQ of Arizona shown on the Discovery Channel.  I just found it via Bing Maps because my belly was hungry!  :)  The food was awesome. I ordered the Smokin Sampler with all 4 meats.  Because I love meat and I can.  :)  I used the Crazy J's sauce with was very spicy and great taste.  Everything was great, the polish sausage, the pulled pork, the chicken, and the brisket.    Now, I will not be going back soon, not because of the food but because of the parking.  This is something out of their control.  There is always catering.  :)  They are in an industrial park type of complex.  The parking spots are small for normal sized cars but trying to park my normal sized F-150 was not easy.  When I came out, the person next to me wasn't as careful getting in as I was getting out.  I left with great food and a good ding on the side of my truck right in the sport where their driver side door would of hit.  The line inside was long but moved fast.  The ladies that worked the front line all friendly and did a great job.
Great BBQ joint in North Phoenix. Ample portions, reasonable prices, fast service.

After being prodded months by my co-workers to try this place, i finally did.  Here goes: I walk in and there are 2 blank TV screens above the counter. The staff is waiting for me to order something, but after an uncomfortably long pause by both sides, I finally had to say, "is there supposed to be a menu up there or something?" - Strike One.  After they realize its not working, they spend several minutes trying to fix this, but since I only have an hour for lunch, I find a paper menu and begin to narrow down my selections. I go with some type of BBQ chicken sandwich (BBQ being key here as sauce is implied in BBQ) and the beans as a side. The beans were great.  So before I go any further, let me just say that I was expecting at least some type of base BBQ sauce with the meat. This was not the case and since it was not explained to me (- Strike Two), I only grabbed one tiny cup of some sweet BBQ sauce and took my meal to go.  Naturally, the tiny cup of BBQ sauce was not enough, and my sandwich was very bland and dry. In addition, I was expecting shredded chicken not small pieces that were maybe 1 1/2 inch by a 1/4 inch dropping all over the place but what landed the 3rd Strike was that this sauce tasted like nothing more than corn syrup and liquid smoke. Strike Three - I'm out!  I may try it again, but I will know next time to stock up on some other sauce (there were 3 or 4 to choose from) and go with the Pork or Beef instead.  BTW- The parking really sucked since its in an industrial park and is shared with many other businesses.

OMG. We LOVE, LOVE, LOVE this place. My husband loves BBQ Ribs, so I decided to have his bday here. The place is super clean and I like the layout of the place and the food is just amazing. I ordered the sample platter that came with, brisket, chicken, sausage with two sides which I picked the Mac and cheese and coleslaw. AMAZING. My husband of course got the Ribs. AMAZING. Everyone at our table loved there food. I think what makes this place really stand out from other bbq spots is there sauces. It's like liquid gold. Besides the delicious food, the staff and management is super friendly and they made my husbands birthday perfect. Highly recommend this place. Can't wait to go back.

This place is my husbands absolute favorite place in the whole wide world. The Resturant is in a heavily industrial location. It's just not in a regular Restaurant. Anyways you walk in and the place smells AMAZING. You get in line, kind of like cafeteria style and you give them your order and they put it together right their and hand it to you and you pay. Then you go to the back where you will find seating. You can sit anyplace you want and eat. The seating area looks like a garage that has been converted to a restaurant. So the place is not fancy at all. It actually took me a couple of times going their to warm up to the place. But let's get down to the real reason we go their. Their BBQ is Fantastic. And their sauces are delicious. My husband normally gets the half rack ribs and I get the sampler and we sort of share. The portion sizes are huge. Lots of different side options to pick from and they are all good.

The food is decent but it is a little pricey for the quality. I've come to expect that with this place, very skimpy on the portion sizes. When someone who spends the amount of money that We do at this restaurant asks for extra bbq sauce the restaurant should oblige. You will not keep customers by being a cheapskate with the sauce. You can always add an option on UberEATS for people to purchase extra sauce if need be but for Pete's sake stop acting like jerks always ignoring the request. There are other options for bbq in the area!

Born and raised in a Texas BBQ restaurant, I do competitions myself. So I have a decent handle on BBQ.  I came at 545, which being fair is a tough time. They prob just pulled a shoulder and brisket off letting it sit before slicing for dinner service. Because of this I gave them the benefit of the doubt on the dryness of the pulled pork and brisket.  You can tell they know what they are doing though. It's just there was no flavor profile on either, but a dry piece of meat is tough to recognize the spices or smoke...  Good meat doesn't need sauce, but this needed some due to dryness. The sweet and mild was the only good one, the mustard heavy was good with the pork for the tangy element.  I come this way once a year to Honeywell, I think it's worth giving them a shot again though.

hallelujah- there is some pork up here in the north(kinda)west valley!  My favorite thing about this place is that you can buy the pork by the pound.  I think it's about $14, which sounds a bit spendy, but it is worth it.   The sandwiches are amazing.  If you are in the area and want a hefty lunch- you gotta go to Pork on a Fork!
Great stop for lunch. I had the pork sandwich, mac n cheese and waffle fries. The meat was tender and the 3 choices of BBQ sauce were all delicious!

Pork on a Fork is great BBQ! Their hot BBQ sauce tastes amazing on everything.  By far, the ribs are the best followed by the pork and chicken. The brisket is good, but I have definitely had better.'  The baked beans have pork in them and are delicious, but the mac and cheese and coleslaw are the best two sides.   Great, casual place. Strange set up, but overall yummy! I'll definitely be back.

Excellent place...  parking is a little difficult since the coffee shop next door feels they need the majority of the spaces for their empty shop...  The pork is extremely tender and very flavorful. The bbq beans have a very unique smoky flavor.  I couldn't get enough!  So far I have been here three times, and it's ROCKED every time...   Keep up the awesome work!
