Flag this comment  1 Previous Review: Hide ¬ª     11/24/2010  Reviewing their food for the first time at their new restaurant location in far north phoenix (Deer Valley Airport only USED TO be the boonies), but i've been hearing about their meat for some time now.  A delicious smoky aroma gently smacks you around and lulls you into submission once you enter.  A simple menu offers the lunch selection (soon to offer breakfast too). I knew i wanted pulled pork as an entree, and honestly didn't notice what else they had.    The usual side offerings of beans, potato salad, and coleslaw never appeal to me, personally.  I don't fault them for that, but a pickle spear being my only other available side left me feeling less than satiated.  Maybe some french fries, or at least chips?    The pulled pork sandwich had a nice smoky flavor, and the meat was juicy without being fatty.  The bun was simply generic.  Maybe these guys could get into cahoots with a local baker to put their special meat on something a little more worthy?    The sauces offered were "Sweet Mild" (which was both) and "Hog Wild Hot" (which was neither, but still tasty).  Both had a distinct molasses sweetness in a thick tomatoey base, the Hot with a little more spice flavor to it, but not much heat at all.  The atmosphere is simple and clean.  Ribs, breakfast, and "Swine & Dine" nights are on the way, according to the owners. Look forward to many more days of coming back to work smelling like a meat smoker !

Probably some of the best BBQ you'll ever eat.  The meat is very tender and melts in your mouth.  The two sides I had- Mac n' Cheese and beans were also very good.  This place is very unassuming and somewhat tough to find since it's in an industrial park, but a great restaurant nonetheless.  Give it a shot.

Really disappointed with this place. After looking at their menu, pictures and reviews my husband and I were really excited to eat here. But that quickly changed upon walking in, I ordered online and went straight to the register and was ignored by the two working be the counter, one was talking to other customers, putting their meal together so that I get, but the other guy wasn't. I just stood there feeling dumb for about 5 minutes before the lady working the register came up. This was our first time ordering Pork on a Fork, ordered online and assumed the BBQ sauce just came with the meal, the girl working the check out was new and forgot to ask what BBQ sauce we wanted, disappointing upon getting home, but was just going to remember for future visits. Then I tried my bowl...the rice was undercooked and crunchy, BBQ sauce was not added to the bowl, and that was on the instructions when I ordered and the meat was on the dry side. I ordered the pork slider for my daughter and was given the brisket (I won't complain about that because the brisket was REALLY good) but annoyed with the fact the order was wrong. And my husband got cornbread as a side, the size and taste was laughable. Overall, not satisfied. IF we ordered from here again it would only be the brisket in bulk!

They forgot about our sweet potato fries while we sat there looking stupid. A worker, was staring at my wife like we were deer in headlights. So 30 minutes after sitting and waiting for our fries we lost our appetite at the service and asked to speak to the manager, a young lady assumed the position of manager and said she would talk to the male worker about his conduct. I ate my dry and cold pulled pork and my wife threw hers away, my toddler ate the fries on the drive home not really caring. This was 5 months ago, maybe they are better now.

Ordered from Uber Eats so I didn't knew what to expect but I had high hopes....  Paid $30 for 2 sandwiches that were pretty small, didn't even order 2 sandwiches, but at least the brisket was good. Me and a co-worker decided to go in  and expect whatever came to us. When it arrived I was initially confused because we got 2 sandwiches when that wasn't what I ordered, at least that's not what I thought I ordered. In both the app and on their menu online is describes the Midwest Monster as a "heaping pile of Brisket" topped with slaw, cheese, and jalapenos when that's not what it is. Its a small brisket sandwich jalapenos and cheese. I was pretty disappointing because I didn't want a sandwich and if I wanted one I would've ordered a brisket sandwich.  So if you're ordering the Midwest Monster beware because you'll be upset that you got a sandwich like I did and not a pile of delicious meat. My other complaint is that they we're the smallest sides I've ever seen. I ate my Mac & Cheese in 2 bites and although the cornbread was good the same holds true true the size. The sandwich isn't even that big. For paying $10 for a brisket sandwich, 2 sides and $3 more just for jalapenos and cheese is upsetting.  Too bad because it's close to my house but probably never go there ever. Now I know. Please fix your menu description and your app description.

We've been to Pork on a Fork numerous times.  Because we love their pulled pork sandwich, we always ordered that.  Well, this time we tried the baby back ribs.  They were absolutely delicious!  Very meaty, and the meat fell off the bone with the tenderness.  What a dilemma now;  what to order when we go back!  If you go, don't forget to order their sweet potato fries.  The best ever!

Love this place! Excellent value, good food and good service. Was happy to learn it's also owned by nebraskans...so that made my heart happy. We found it while my brother was in town from Nebraska and were looking for good bbq that didn't cost a fortune. They satisfied all our needs.

i have no idea if the food is any good. didn't get a chance to try it. but, did waste an hour and a half of my day trying to try it. the place isn't close to home but wanted to give it a shot and drove there. waited in line for another 15 minutes only to find out they were out of everything but chicken and sausage.... on a tuesday night. what? couldn't they put a sign by the door telling us they were out of all the good stuff and we could cut our losses there without waiting in line? what a crappy way to treat potential new customers.
Best BBQ burrito ever try it with beans, cheese, waffle fries (ask for the ends) and either pork or brisket is good I prefer brisket but it does cost a little more.

I'm lucky enough to have a new job that is a 4 minute drive from here, I made the first of many lunch trips here today. I got a BBQ combo platter and it is seriously the best thing ever. I have tried other BBQ places in town and while they're good too, this is amazing! Juicy pork with tons of flavor, delectable chicken, and because I'm going all out for you, fellow yelpers, i upgraded to brisket for the 3rd option and its AMAZING.   I got the Mac n Cheese because well, we're going big here today, and the cole slaw. So much flavor, so tasty. I seriously love everything and the price isnt too bad, after all I have plenty for dinner here as well. It all comes with no sauce and then you can add whatever you like, I got a couple options to try out and, you guessed it, they are awesome too smokey sweet, tangy, spicy - whatever you like.   My only concern here is how big my obsession will grow...time to buy a gym membership for the sole purpose of eating here as often as possible! :)

Pork on a Fork has been on my radar for a while after reading a fellow Yelper's review. Once again Yelp did not let me down. I don't get to Phoenix often as I live in the east valley, but today I had an appointment just blocks from here. My wife and I decided to stop in for a late lunch . We quickly spotted the POF van from Camelback. After a little searching we found the store on the back side of the mall. At some point you could just follow your nose to the source of the smoky BBQ aroma. Upon entering you are you are greeted with a slow bluesy background music. The place is clean and trendy with plenty of tables.  They must have thought we were nuts, because the first thing we did was to post a selfie by the POF sign in order to claim the 25% off coupon you get when you check in on Yelp. The wait staff greeted us warmly and took our orders. I ordered the pulled pork sandwich with the highly recommended mac-n-cheese and baked beans for sides. I watched with anticipation as they carefully assembled my sandwich. A generous portion of pulled pork heaped on a fresh baked bun. I wish they would have thrown a couple sliced pickles on as well. One thing you must keep in mind, this pulled pork is not cooked in sauce. If you expect saucy BBQ pork, this is not it. What you get is tender, smoky, juicy slow cooked pork shoulder. There are 4 different amazing sauces to drown your sandwich in at your table.  The mac-n-cheese was fantastic. It was very cheesy, and had a bit of a zing to it. I think it may have been made with sharp cheddar. There was a seasoning sprinkled on top which was the perfectly complimented the dish. The macaroni was cooked perfectly, not sticky, not mushy. I could make this my main course and both sides also. It was truly the best mac-n-cheese I've ever had. The baked beans were good. They were even better with a little spicy BBQ sauce mixed in.  Jake came out to chat with us for a while. He gave us a little history of POF. I told him this was a place Guy Fiere would like. This is just the kind of place he would feature on Drive-ins, Diners, and Dives. Although the food was impressive what impressed me most is Justin's personal response to most of the Yelp posts. This tells me he cares about Yelpers. It's this kind of personal touch that scores POF a spot on my Outstanding Service list.

Had the Midwest Monster. Loved it. They put the sides in these small aluminum cups and I thought it wouldn't be enough. These small aluminum cups use Mary Poppins purse technology as my side of BBQ beans kept on giving.

Had sample platters cause hey life is all about choices. We loved the chicken, the sausage was ok,  the brisket was pretty good, pulled pork ya ok alright. Waffle fries two thumbs up. The sauces are bomb a little regional sampling from the big BBQ kings in the states. The mustard one was killer. I was not a huge fan of max and cheese need to pep up the flavor on that a bit. All in all I will say this it tastes pretty good and the place is wicked clean so ya I'll be back and hey saving 25% on our first try all good stuff.
Seriously... my favorite BBQ place. There isnt one thing that ive had on the menu that i didnt like  The pulled pork and the ribs are my favs

I just want to shout out this place! We came right at closing and we thought we were out of luck. We both had a long day and were frustrated because we were looking forward to BBQ. While we were outside trying to figure out where else to get food, A very sweet and respectful employee named Alundis came out and invited us in. He was so respectful and we couldn't have been more grateful. The team took care of us and made our night!! Not only is this food so BOMB, the customer Service was top notch! Thanks So much

A-OK.   We are on a mission to find the best BBQ in the valley and this was the first place we went.  We ordered the pulled pork sandwich, Chicken plate and some bones to try the ribs, because, after all it is a BBQ place and you have to get pulled pork and ribs.  The pulled pork was good. Nothing that really stood out to be special and the meat was kind of dry. I wish they would have put some sort of sauce on the meat prior to serving (they have different sauces in pumps for you to pick and choose) but since they let you pick which kind of sauce and how much, I guess it makes sense.  Chicken plate consisted of two chicken breasts and some sides. Waffle fries are generic with a cajun seasoning, baked beans were alright, honestly they looked like mush and the flavor was ok. Chicken was good though. Good seasonings and very tender.  The thing that saved the meal were the ribs. Ribs were pretty good! Tender (not falling off the bone tender) and came with some sort of light glaze which was much better than any of the sauces.   I would have given this 3.5 stars if I could but since I don't think I'll ever crave/have the desire to comeback, it gets a three.

Food is alright.  The smoke flavor is Intense.  Almost overwhelming by the end of the Meal.  Space is limited But i know they are expanding.  Sides are great, Prices are a little high.    Overall i'll come back but need to br craving it.  That smoke flavor can get a little bland by the end of the meal.  However to each there own

It definitely lived up to the expectations of being a upper echelon BBQ joint. I ordered the BBQ Pork plate with waffle fries and beans and was not disappointed. I actually forgot to pour their BBQ sauce on the pork until i was almost halfway through with the meal. It was that tasty, I would say if your in that neck of the woods, POAF is the place to go. The service was very prompt and I even used a Yelp deal to score a free 24 oz drink. Overall, they get my highest recommendation.   BBQ pork, beans, waffle fries and an Arnold Palmer... doesn't get much better then that!

I love this place!  We weren't sure what to expect since the restaurant is in an office building plaza.  Kinda weird, but the employees in the other businesses are lucky!  We went in here on a whim after reading all the awesome Yelp reviews.  Our first impression was a girl at the front and she was super nice and didn't rush us while we were checking out the menu options.  I ordered the pulled pork sandwich with macaroni & cheese and my husband ordered the brisket sandwich with a side of baked beans.  He also ordered a side of ribs to sample.  The wait wasn't too bad -- it took about 10 or 15 minutes and it was ready to go.  They are cool with their sauce and let you fill up the small plastic cups and take as much as you want of it (which is awesome, because the sauce tastes SO good!).   It's a nice, thick sauce and they have several flavors to choose from.  We go to a nearby area to have a little picnic by ourselves and notice that they forgot to include the side of ribs.  We pack everything up and go back to get those.  The employees were really nice about it and apologized and gave my husband the side of ribs.  We repeat the same process and realize that they also messed up my husband's order and gave him a pulled pork sandwich instead of the brisket sandwich.  We decide to let it go and eat our food.  The pulled pork has great flavor.  The meat actually tastes like it has been smoked for several hours and is good enough to eat on its own without any sauce.  However, we weren't going that route, because the sauce is too damn good not to eat.  The baked beans and macaroni & cheese were not anything special, but they were good.  The ribs were our favorite part!  We absolutely loved them.  Very tender and the sauce they chose to slather them in was delicious.  This place is pretty far from where we live, but we would definitely go out of our way (again) to eat here more.
Decent BBQ place. Interesting concept as you can order your meat in a burrito, bowl, etc.
The meat is great. The options are great. The mac is great. The fires are great. The management is great. Absolute favorite local spot. Give them your business!

I want to make sweet love to their beans!!!!  PoaF is a very small place that is easily missed. But, take the time to find it and you will be VERY happy! The prices are reasonable and the portions are large. we have gone to Dillion's for years and like it very much, but PoaF is the real deal. The brisket has a black char on the outside- just as it should. The sweet potato fries are thick and full of flavor. And the beans.... So much flavor and large chunks of pork in them........  Go! Now! Run!!   Update......  And now they have thick, rich, creamy mac and cheese!!!!!!  Run faster!!! Now!!

Second time here. Have sampler the first time it was very good got half rack of ribs this time some of the best ribs I have ever had. Great job guys keep up the good work and open up one in Scottsdale. Very fresh have great sides and 4 different sauces to choose from. Will be going back.

Yum yum yum. This was my second visit and it was as yum as I remember it. Both times I had the combo which was pulled pork, pulled chicken and brisket. My two sides were coleslaw and tossed salad. The servers were super welcoming and helpful. The dining area was clean and well stocked. Great spot for groups, meetings or family outings.

POAF certainly does deserve to be called the best in the valley! Their menu items certainly offer a variety of wonderful choices. Their barbecue is unlike any other and really stands out from the rest. If you ever feel like dining in, Pork On A Fork is the way to go. Also, shoutout to the worker in the Monster Energy hat. He is very friendly and sure knows how to make the best burrito!
Got myself the pulled pork sandwich. Meat was excellent quality and with just the right amount of tenderness vs chew. Sauces were excellent as were the sides. Definitely a keeper this place.
Kinda of a dump of a restaurant, but the food is great. Kind of tucked in the industrial park and little available parking, but I will go again. Some of the best BBQ around.

The BBQ isn't bad, but I cannot give POAF a positive review. They charged me $28.00 for a pound of brisket, with no sides. This is about 40% higher than even the most expesive I have seen. For example, the better Bryan's BBQ in Cave Creek, about 10 miles away, charges $13.95 for a pound.   The sauce here is good, have several different flavors, all of which I liked. The sandwiches are good as well, although slightly pricey at $10-$12 dollars with waffle fries. The ribs, while not bad are not really the best. I think it's the way they slice and serve them.   When POAF first opened they put forth a better effort, but upon their subsequint success they seem to have become a little complacent, and a tad greedy.  Hopefully over time they will find a better price balance, appreciate thier customers and become the great place to eat that they should be.

5 stars for their ribs.  The to go rack comes pre-sauced which surprised me. I was disappointed at first, but once I tried them at home, they were delicious that way.  I usually got them dry rubbed when ordering. The default is with the sauce now.   And, when ordering ahead, they do not start preparing. You have to tell them to start now to have it ready when you arrive. This is the default, not to start the order until you wait in line there and order again. That makes no sense to me.  The brisket is usually very moist and juicy. Last time it was dry and tougher. The pork was consistently drier than I am used to for BBQ pork.  So I don't get it anymore there. The chicken is very tasty and I love the smoke flavor it has. But the pieces are tiny and you only get 1 thigh in the combination.  The sausage is average, not bad, not great.  They moved the sauces to the back room, and for a whole rack of ribs I only get 2 tiny to go cups of sauce. What the heck?  Really, you people (at POAF) would make due if you had a whole rack of ribs and only 2 tiny cups of sauce????  Moving the sauces to the back makes it more inconvenient to get more to go. Don't know why they are so stingy with the sauces for to-go.  Free drink when you check in on Yelp.  It used to be super hot and muggy in the back room. Now that it is their only room, the temperature is much better.  TV's back there. None on the news. All on sports. Lame.  It is very pricey here for lunch.  Drink and a plate runs you about $10-$13.
Go get you some crazy good bbq here there is not one bad thing on the menu. I am now craving there food again. YUM!

Average at best. Me and my fianc√© are trying out different BBQ food joints to cater our wedding and this one is dead last. We tried the sample platter for $15 (small portion). The chicken was very dry, the pulled pork had literally no flavor, and the best part was the brisket which had some moisture and flavor. The sauces again are poor to average. The mustard sauce, spicy sauce, and smoked sauce were all strange tasting, their normal sweet bbq sauce was their best, and again, it was average. This place is definitely good enough to have a quick bite to eat and enjoy some average BBQ but it IS NOT STELLAR. I don't understand all this hype as if this is killer BBQ, it's not.
I absolutely love their food the brisket is fantastic I just wish the employees seemed happy to be there other than that love the place
Holy smokes this place is awesome! There pulled meats are to die for. And their mac n cheese is the best thing I've had all year! Love love love it!

I visited this restaurant for the first time today and loved it.  I had the 1/2 rack of ribs with beans and mac and cheese.  The ribs were meaty and delicious and not too fatty.  The mac and cheese was excellent with a complementary smoky flavor.  I like how fast it was served too!  I can honestly say I was in hog heaven...lol!

Okay this is an update;   A.  They have put some money into redoing the building to make it look better--a good sign. B.  The problem is most of the BBQ meat has NOT been smoked..without sauce most just tastes like regular meat, especially the pork. C.  A friend of mine gave me some Value Alliance card money to spend there-they took it at the deer valley location, but not at the central Phoenix location which I thought was odd--I live next door to the latter--had to drive all the way to deer valley... D.  I will continue to eat there--but they need to smoke the meat more. E. By the way they hire min wage teenagers who look nasty and don't want to be there--they need to hire some older more pro staff who know what they are doing I think
Best BBQ in Phoenix thats for for sure! The smokiness and melt in mouth BBQ keeps you longing for more. I can't wait to cater our Super Bowl Party and share the love with friends.

Maybe I am spoiled since I grew up in the Midwest and had access to great barbecue on almost every corner, but I am not impressed with the barbecue here.  We've ordered at least 10 times over the last year and the chicken is usually dried out and the beef has little taste.   The only thing that I would consider half way decent is the pulled pork. The dine in area is usually fairly dirty, it doesn't look like the owners pay much attention to it.      The Phoenix area suffers from a dearth of good barbecue,  this place is average at best. It won't remind you of home.

I can no longer recommend coming to this once great place.. Everything that made this stand apart  ( in a good way) is now gone..  It has been declining for so time now, however I have been holding hope that it would turn back around. ..  Today is the final nail in the coffin for me...  This was the worst lunch I have had in years..  Literally not one part of my meal was enjoyable. .. not even the coke (now RC ) or the use to be always great cornbread. ..  The old bland beans has no flavor (other than pepper ) and the ribs so over cooked that they were more like hard tack
Great place to go after the car and quad passed emissions sweet potato fries rock baby ribs yoummy

The portions are not very big for the price. The meats were okay - tried the brisket and the pulled pork and both tasted solid but not anything special. I did enjoy the sides - the cornbread muffin and mac and cheese were both pretty good; unfortunately there wasn't a whole lot of either. The mustard sauce was also pretty good, so be sure to ask for that when you're here.

What a disaster.  I had the delux combined pork, beef, chicken sampler... cold all, dry. Service station messy. Only item that was hot were the beans... and somehow this is the best in phx.... No Chance....will not return.

I went for my first time today. I loved it a bit of a wait, and in fact while I was in line the line tripped out the door, very popular place! I got the pulled pork with a side of Mac & Cheese and  Baked Beans.  It's an assembly line kind of set up.  I got the food to go so can't comment on the atmosphere. The pork was good, a little dry but good portion amount. I've had BBQ at Dickey's and it's been super fatty- this was not the case at all at Pork on a Fork.   The mac & cheese reminds me of Picaddillys if any of you are from the south. The backed beans were really good, and I'm not even a baked beans kind of gal!  I used the sweet tangy bbq sauce and really liked it- very tangy and they gave me tons of sauce cups full of it to go!   It was good!
Excellent barbecue!   I order the mixed meat burrito every time. Great food all around!

I am not sure where to start other than the positive.  We were greeted with a well informed and friendly young lady at the register. The menu is small which I like, so ordering was a breeze. The waffle fries are tasty and so is the mac n cheese. This is where I will part with the positive.   I ordered along with my daughter the pulled pork sandwich. Half of which (i'm kicking myself for the lack of picture) was fat. Not fat and lots of meat but straight up disgusting slimy fat that I had to pick out. Gross! The bun was mushy and so was half of the salvaged meat. The texture was terrible. I added 2 ribs for $2.99 and they were not even worth commenting on. My husband wanted to eat the rest of them and I was more then happy to share the ribs with out the warning. The look of disgust on his face might have been worth the trip. ;) Don't get the ribs or the pulled pork!!   The sauce selection was... sweet and gross, smokey and tangy (which I preferred) and spicy. Overall bad taste to the sauces. My young daughter couldn't even eat the sweet mild one as the taste was bad. She is a typical picky eater but this will be the first BBQ she wouldn't eat.   The brisket is ok...and I mean ok. I am not a fan of sausage but my hubby said it was amazing. So if you are going to check out this joint my suggestion would be sausage, waffle fries and mac n cheese.   Also...what kind of BBQ place does not have fresh brewed tea?? This is a first for me and a big disappointment. Make fresh brewed tea!!!   I love BBQ... a lot and I am shocked by these reviews. I hope I was just there on a bad night or something. I am all for local business and I hate chain restaurants...so I was pretty disappointed as I found myself wishing I was at Shane's rib shack down the road.
It's a decent bbq place for the area. There really isnt many other options close by. They have a pretty good bbq burrito, but the prices are pretty steep for what you get.
